loans.name: Reyna María

texts.es: La Señora Reyna A. tiene un negocio de refresquería ubicado en su casa de habitación, tiene siete años de experiencia, su núcleo familiar es de cuatro personas en el que incluyen a sus dos hijos pero ellos ya están casados, así que prácticamente solo es ella y su esposo, solicita crédito en CEPRODEL para el mejoramiento de vivienda, y ahorita en la época de invierno no mojarse y poder tener una mejor condición.
texts.en: Reyna A. has a refreshments business located within his home.  She’s been doing this for six years and has a family of four that includes her two children.  They are married, so it’s basically just she and her husband.  She is asking for this loan, through CEPRODEL, so that she can make improvements to her house, so that it will not leak this winter and they will have better living conditions.

loans.use: Home repairs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Nayruth Noeli

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CLORINDA MATTO DE TURNER”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Calca en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nayruth;  La socia tiene 19 años de edad;  ella es madre soltera  y tiene 1 hijo, La socia se dedica a l comercio minorista ella tiene un stand de venta de frutas al por menor en el mercado central de Calca. Ella requiere comprar de los proveedores al por mayor frutas para la venta final. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de frutas al por mayor de los proveedores. 

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Nayruth belongs to the Clorinda Matto de Turner Communal Bank.  The bank is situated in the Calca district, Urubamba province, Cusco department.

Nayruth is 19 years old.  She is a single mother, and she has one child.  She is a small businesswoman.  She sells fruit for retail prices at her stand in the central market in Calca.  She needs the loan to buy fruit wholesale from providers so that she can sell the fruit at her stand.

She is grateful for and values the loan granted by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy fruit wholesale from providers

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CLORINDA MATTO DE TURNER”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Calca en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Hilda  La socia tiene 49 años de edad;  ella es casada y tiene 2 hijos, La socia se dedica a la compra y venta de abarrotes en el mercado modelo de Calca ella  también vende productos secos en su mismo stand, La socia desea implementar su tienda de abarrotes en su stand propio que compro en el mercado y también quiere comprar granos para vender. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos de abarrotes (azúcar, leche, arroz, aceite y granos secos como maíz, habas, cereales).

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Hilda belongs to the Clorinda Matto de Turner Communal Bank.  The bank is situated in the Calca district, Urubamba province, Cusco department.

Hilda, age 49, is married and has two children.  She buys and sells groceries in the Modelo Market in Calca.  She also sells dried products at her stall.  

She wishes to set up her grocery store in her own stall, which she bought in the market.  She also wants to buy grains to sell.  

She is requesting the loan to buy grocery products (sugar, milk, rice, oil, and dried grains like corn and beans).

She is grateful for and values the loan granted by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy grocery products

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more charcoal

loans.name: Carmen Luz

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CLORINDA MATTO DE TURNER”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Calca en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Carmen;  La socia tiene 40 años de edad;  ella es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia  se dedica a la compra y venta de productos de barrotes en el mercado modelo de Calca. Ella necesita implementar sus productos, La socia comprara al por mayor arroz, aceite, azúcar entre otros para la venta. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos de abarrotes. 

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the community bank "Clorinda Matto de Turner", which is located in the district of Calca in the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco.

Carmen is 40 years old, married, and has two children.  She works buying and selling necessities in the market in Calca.  She will buy rice, oil, sugar, and other products wholesale and then sell them.  She is asking for this loan in order to invest in the purchase of more basic products.

She is thankful for and values the loan given and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase of basic products

loans.name: Family Light Group

texts.en:
Siah M., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Family Light. She is 39 years old, married, and has two children who are 10 and 15 years old. She was able to attend school only through seventh grade due to financial constraints. Siah describes herself as a determined woman whose goals are to improve her business and continue to educate her children.

For 10 years, Siah has been selling building materials such as paint, door locks, cutlasses, nails, shovels and hammers in New Georgia Community outside of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 25000 Liberian dollars (LRD) portion of this 92000 LRD group loan to buy more hardware supplies.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, M. F. is inset at the lower right because he was absent when the photo was taken.

loans.use: To buy more hardware supplies

loans.name: Teresa Mercedes

texts.es: La señora tiene un año de estar laborando en la Alcaldía Municipal de Catarina desempeñando el cargo de Responsable del Centro Turístico Mirador, en donde con su salario mantiene a sus dos hijos que están en edad escolar y que a punto de sacrificio los ha sacado adelante, ahora ella le solicita a CEPRODEL un financiamiento para pagar unos gastos personales que tiene y así seguir desarrollando el crecimiento y mejoramiento del nivel de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
The lady has been working for the past year for the City of Catarina as the Attendant at the Mirador Tourist Center.  She uses her salary to support her two school age children.  She has managed to move them ahead in life through much sacrifice.

She is asking CEPRODEL for a loan to pay some personal expenses she has so that she can continue developing and improving her family’s living standard.

loans.use: For some personal expenses.

loans.name: María

texts.es: María tiene 50 años, es una madre de familia muy jovial, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y su hija mejor, quien es motivo de todo su esfuerzo. Desde muy temprana edad ha trabajado apoyando a su madre en la venta de pollos, con el tiempo su madre viajó al extranjero, haciéndose cargo entonces del negocio. Su trabajo inicia muy temprano por la mañana, con la recepción de pollos de su proveedor y a las 8:00 de la mañana arranca su día laborar atendiendo amablemente a su clientela, que en su mayoría son amas de casa. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es la comunicación amena que tiene con los clientes. Lleva más de 36 años en esta actividad; por lo que espera comprarse una camioneta para iniciar en el negocio de distribución de pollos a varios puntos de ventas.  Es su 25avo crédito con MFP, sabe que si lo paga a tiempo, podrá acceder a otro y mayor cantidad. Es una persona muy responsable de su grupo comunal, por lo que es muy querida y respetada por el resto de las socias. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería para abastecerse de cantidad de pollos para aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
María, age 50, is a very jovial mother.  She lives in her own house with her husband and her youngest daughter.  Her daughter is the motivation for all of her efforts.

From a very early age María worked helping her mother sell chickens.  In time, her mother traveled abroad leaving María in charge of the business.  Her work starts very early in the morning when she gets the chickens from her provider.  At 8:00 in the morning she starts her work day of kindly waiting on her customers.  Most of her customers are housewives.  What she likes most about her work is the pleasant conversations she has with her customers.  She has been doing this for over 36 years.

She hopes to buy a truck for her business to start distributing chickens to various sales locations.  This is her 25th loan with MFP.  She knows that if she pays on time she will be able to access another loan for a larger amount.

She is a very responsible person with her communal bank.  She is admired and respected by the other members.  She will use the requested loan to buy more merchandise.  She will stock more chickens in order to increase her earnings.

loans.use: To stock up on chickens

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of flour, oil, butter, baking powder, yeast, etc.

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es:
Gloria es una mujer de edad, muy esforzada al trabajo, desde hace varios años se ha dicado a su propio negocio que es la costura y venta de ropa. Iniciando con poco capital propio. Profesión que aprendió junto a su prima.
Es madre de cinco hijos, siendo su esposo tipógrafo el cual juntos han construido su pequeña casa de concreto. Atreves de los financiamiento ha hecho mucha mejora  a su humilde casa. Con el crédito anterior logro comprar su inodoro para la construcción del baño logrando mejor higiene. En su negocio mantiene el equilibrio, ya que cuando no tiene costura vende ropa nueva.
Con este préstamo comprara materiales de construcción  como: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro, zinc, perlines y comenzar la obra. Que será de gran beneficio para su familia.
texts.en:
Gloria is a hard-working woman.  For several years, she has worked at her own business sewing and selling clothing.  She started with little of her own capital.  She learned this profession with her cousin.  Her business is able to stay stable because when there is no sewing, she sells new clothes.

She has five children, and her husband works as a printer.  Together, they built their small concrete house.  Thanks to loans, they have made many improvements to their humble home.  With the last loan, they were able to buy a toilet and build a bathroom for better hygiene.  

With this loan, she will buy construction materials like stone, sand, cement, iron, zinc, and roofing beams and then start the work, which will be a big benefit to her family.

loans.use: Purchase stone, sand, cement, iron, zinc, and roofing materials to start construction of a room

loans.name: Yadira Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora B. es una mujer luchado con su negocio a logrado sacar adelante sus hijos que están en edad escolar, así mismo en su pulpería ha incluido ropa para ofrecerles a sus clientes y le ha ido muy bien, ahora ella solicita a ceprodel un crédito para la compra de ropa BB  crece, pantalones para dama, pantalones para varón, blusas variadas y trajes para niños ya que ahorita se acerca la temporada de las fiestas del Departamento de Masaya y quiere lograr ofrecer sus productos y con esto poder seguir dándole un futuro provechoso a sus hijos.
texts.en:
B. is a woman who is struggling to support her school age children with her business.  She has added clothing for her customers to her grocery store’s stock and has done well.  

She is now asking Ceprodel for a loan to buy Bebe Crece brand clothes, women’s and men’s pants, and assorted blouses and outfits for children since the Masaya Department festival season is approaching and she wants to be able to offer these items in order to continue to give her children an advantageous future.

loans.use: To buy Bebe Crece brand infant wear, women’s pants, men’s pants, assorted blouses and children’s apparel.

loans.name: Remigia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS ROSALES D. SAYLLA”; este banco está situado en el distrito D. Saylla en la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Remigia;  La socia tiene 58 años D. edad;  ella es casada  y tiene 4 hijos, La socia se dedica a la venta D. chicharrones desD. el año 2000, ella elabora este plato típico a base D. carne D. ovino, ella prepara los chicharrones acompañados con papas doradas y ensalada D. cebollas con hierba buena. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. carne D. ovino para la venta semanal D. chicharrones.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Remigia is a member of the Los Rosales D. Saylla Communal Bank.  This bank is situated in the Saylla district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

Remigia, age 58, is married and has four children.  She has been selling “chicharrones” (fried pork rinds) since the year 2000.  She makes this typical dish from pork.  She makes the chicarrones accompanied with golden potatoes and a salad of onion and herbs.

She is requesting the loan to buy pork for her weekly sale of chicharrones.

She is grateful for and values the loan granted by this means, and she pledges to make her payments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy pork for her weekly sale of chicharroes

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS ROSALES D. SAYLLA”; este banco está situado en el distrito D. Saylla en la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yolanda;  La socia tiene  52 años D. edad;  ella es casada  y tiene 6 hijos, La socia se dedica a la venta D. chicharrones desD. hace tres años, ella elabora uno D. los paltos típicos D. la región a base D. carne D. ovino, ella prepara los chicharrones acompañados con papas doradas y ensalada D. cebollas con hierba buena. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. carne D. ovino, y los otros ingredientes para la venta D. chicharrones.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a member of the community bank "Los Rosales D. Saylla" [The Roses of Sayalla], which is located in the Sayalla district in the province and department of Cusco.

Yolanda is 52 years old, married, and has six children.  She has worked selling chicharrones [pork rinds] for three years.  She makes one of the typical dishes of the region using lamb.  She prepares the pork rinds with roasted potatoes and onion salad with mint.  She is asking for this loan in order to purchase lamb and other ingredients to prepare pork rinds.  

She is thankful for and values the loan she has received and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase of meat and other food items

loans.name: Rigoberto Antonio

texts.es:
Rigoberto tiene la edad de 35 años, padre de un hijo, reside en un barrio José Dolores Estradas.
Se dedica al comercio el cual tiene su propio negocio, una pulpería y un pequeño comedor, iniciando con dinero propio, ya que en años anteriores viajo a los Estados Unidos de América, en donde trabajo mucho y trajo dinero ahorrado. Ya que su profesión es ebanista y donde trabajaba el negocio se complico. Y toma la decisión de irse.
Lleva varios años ya en el negocio pero desea aumentar su inventario en venta de comida como en su pulpería el cual no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para este aumento, es por eso hace el financiamiento en Afodenic logrando a si su objetivo el cual espera mejorar meta de venta, con esta inversión. El cual está contento por el apoyo económico atreves de los plazos flexibles de la institución.
texts.en:
Rigoberto is 35 years old, the father of a son and lives in the neighborhood José Dolores Estradas.
He works at a shop where he has his own business, a local store and a small dining area, started with his own money. In years past he traveled to the United States of America where he worked a lot and saved money. He is a cabinetmaker by profession but where he was working the business got complicated. He made the decision to return. 
He already has been working in this business several years, but he wants to increase his inventory and food sales in his store, however he doesn't make enough money for this growth. It is because of this that he made the financing with Afodenic, accomplishing his goal which he hopes will improve his sale goals with this investment. He is happy for the economic help through the flexible periods of the institution.

loans.use: This investment that you are making is to increase food sales by increasing inventory of the local store allowing for better sales and income.

loans.name: Merle

texts.es: Merle, de 53 años, es una madre de familia muy tratable y trabajadora,  vive en su casa con su esposo y su último hijo. Después de haber  trabajado por muchos años vendiendo pescados, cambio de rubro, es así que se dedica vendiendo zapatos y prendas de vestir, en un puesto del mercado más concurrido de su barrio, que queda a 40 minutos de su casa. Desde entonces, se levanta temprano a preparar el almuerzo para que así pueda llevar su ponchera a su puesto de trabajo, en donde se queda hasta altas horas de la noche. Es así que viene trabajando muy contenta y a la vez arduamente, brindado un trato amable a cada uno de sus compradores, por la preferencia que le dan. Lo que mas le gusta de su negocio, que ésta mercadería de zapato, botas y ropas; no se deterioran ni tienen fecha de caducidad y a la vez le genera buenas ganancias, a pesar de las pocas ventas en el día. Para el futuro, planea poner una tienda  de venta de productos comestibles, además desea terminar de construir su casa y acondicionar varias habitaciones para alquilarlos. Es su 25avo crédito con MFP, y sabe que tiene que pagar puntualmente sus cuotas y esta dispuesta hacerlo como hasta ahora. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de zapatos de vestir ya que se acerca las campañas navideñas.
texts.en:
Merle is 53 years old and is a nice and hardworking mother.  She lives with her husband and her youngest child.  

After working for many years selling fish, she changed careers and is now selling shoes and clothing in a more crowded market in her neighborhood, which is 40 minutes from her house.  Since then, she has gotten up early to prepare lunch so she can bring it to work with her, and she works until late at night.  She is very happy with her work even when it is hard, and she treats each one of her customers well.   The thing she likes best about her business, which is a market of shoes, boots, and clothing, is that it doesn't go bad or have an expiration date.  It also generates good earnings, even with few sales a day.

In the future, she plans to open a store selling food products.  She would also like to finish building her house and fix up some of the rooms to rent them.

This is her 25th loan from MFP, and she knows she has to make her payments on time and is ready to do so, as she's done before.

With this loan, she will purchase dress shoes since Christmas is approaching.

loans.use: Purchase of a variety of shoes

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS ROSALES DE SAYLLA”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Saylla en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Cornelia;  La socia tiene 38 años de edad;  ella es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, La socia se dedica a la agricultura como fuente principal, después ella también cria animales menores (aves de corral), también ella alquila en época de siembra terrenos. La socia necesita alquilar un terreno para sembrar maíz, para lo cual requiere dinero para pagar al tractor que limpiara y afirmara el terreno, comprar las semillas y abonara el mismo, luego el riego. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en el alquiler del terreno.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Cornelia belongs to “Los Rosales de Saylla” (The Rose Bushes of Saylla) communal bank, situated in the district of Saylla, Cusco province, department of Cusco.

Cornelia is 38 years old, living with a companion, and has 2 children.  She is dedicated to agriculture as a principal source of income, and she also raises small fowl (chickens, etc.).  And she rents land to farm in planting season.

She needs to rent land to sow corn, and for this she needs to borrow money to hire a tractor for plowing, and to buy seeds and fertilizer; and, later, for irrigating the fields.  Cornelia requests a loan to invest in land rental.

Cornelia appreciates and values the loan provided by this source and in the same manner, she promises to comply with the payments on schedule.

loans.use: TO INVEST IN RENTING FARM LAND FOR PLANTING CORN

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS ROSALES DE SAYLLA”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Saylla en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Martha;  La socia tiene 47 años de edad;  ella es casada  y tiene 3 hijos, La socia se dedica al comercio minorista ella compra y vende cervezas en la calle pasión en Saylla, ella tiene su tienda también prepara botanas y vende en el mismo local. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar cervezas al por mayor. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de cervezas para el negocio.

 La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower is part of the Los Rosales de Saylla communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Saylla, which is in the province and department of Cusco.

Martha is 47 years old, married, and has three children. She works as a retail merchant, buying and selling beers on Calle Pasión (Passion Street) in Saylla. She has a store and also makes and sells snacks there. Martha is requesting the loan to buy wholesale beers for her business.

She appreciates and values the loan provided and she promises to make her loan payments according to the established timeline.

loans.use: To purchase beers for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: TO BUY A TABLE AND INGREDIENTS FOR HER RESTAURANT

loans.name: Miriam Del Socorro

texts.es:
Miriam es una mujer dedicada al trabajo, teniendo su negocio propio la venta de ropa el cual ella misma hace. Oficio que aprendió desde joven el cual ha venido mejorando en la costura.
Es madre de dos hijos, siendo su esposo sastre, en donde ambos trabajan con el propósito de obtener mejores beneficio para sus hijos.
Con los prestamos ha venido invirtiendo en la compra de tela en cantidad para hacer su costura ya que no solo hace trajes, sino que también, sabanas, cortinas entre otro.
Con esta nuevo financiamiento desea comprar: un rollo de tela de cavalier que son sesenta yardas y comenzar  a producir su producción en ropa. Lo que será de bien para seguir equilibrando su negocio.
texts.en:
Miriam is a hard-working woman.  She operates a business selling clothing that she makes herself.  Making clothes is a skill that she learned many years ago and she's become better and better at it over the years.  Miriam is the mother of two children.  Her husband is a tailor and the couple work together for the benefit of their children.  
Miriam has used past loans to buy wholesale supplies of cloth which she's used not only to make clothing, but also sheets, curtains, etc.  She will use this loan to buy: a sixty-yard roll of "cavalier" cloth to make clothing.  The loan will allow her to continue balancing her business.

loans.use: Buy supplies of cloth for tailoring business.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS ROSALES DE SAYLLA”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Saylla en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Juana;  La socia tiene 69 años de edad;  ella es casada  y tiene 4 hijos, La socia se dedica a la atención de su tienda abarrotes, ella tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en la cual vende todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad, La socia desea implementar su negocio comprando todo tipo de abarrotes al por mayor, ella comprar arroz. Fideos, leche, azúcar. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra productos de abarrotes.

 La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower is part of the Los Rosales de Saylla communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Saylla, which is in the province and department of Cusco.

Juana is 69 years old, married, and has four children. She works at her small grocery store where she sells all types of basic needs items. Juana wants to stock her business and buy all types of wholesale groceries such as rice, pasta, milk, and sugar. She is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of grocery items.

She appreciates and values the loan provided and she promises to make her loan payments according to the established time frame.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of grocery items.

loans.name: Buenaventura

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “LOS ROSALES DE SAYLLA”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Saylla en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

 El socio es el Sr. Buenaventura; El socio tiene 72 años de edad;  el socio es casado; El  socio se dedica a la atención de su restaurante chicharroneria junto a su esposa, ellos juntos atienden a sus clientes y disfrutan de lo que tienen y hacen. El socio desea el préstamo para los insumos y mejorar la decoración del local, comprando mezas y sillas. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de insumos y sillas y mezas para mejorar el local.

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "LOS ROSALES DE SAYLLA." This bank is located in the district of Saylla in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

The member is Mr. Buenaventura. He is 72 years old and is married. The member works in his chicharroneria (restaurant that serves chicharrones, something like pork rinds) with his wife. Together they attend to their customers and enjoy what the have and make. The member wants this loan for consumables and to improve the decoration of the location by buying tables and chairs. The member requests the loan to invest in buying consumables, chairs and table to improve the premises. 

The member appreciates and values the loan bestowed to him through this method and in the same way he promises to fulfill the payments in the established period.

loans.use: To invest in buying consumables, chairs and tables to improve the premises.

loans.name: Cris

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS ROSALES DE SAYLLA”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Saylla en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Cris;  La socia tiene  24 años de edad;  ella es madre soltera  y tiene 1 hijo; La socia se dedica a la atención de su propia chicharroneria, ella también cría cuyes aves de corral, ahora la socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la construcción de un galpón para aves de corral y crianza de cuyes. La socia solicita el préstamo para construir galpón para cuyes y aves de corral. 

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “LOS ROSALES DE SAYLLA.” This bank is located in the district of Saylla in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco. 

The member is Mrs. Cris. She is 24 years old and is a single mother of her son. The member works in her own chicharroneria (a restaurant that sells chicharrones, something like pork rinds) and she also raises guinea pigs and farmyard birds. Now the member is requesting a loan to invest in the construction of a shed for the farmyard birds and raising guinea pigs. 

The member appreciates and values the loan bestowed on her through this method, and promises to fulfill her payments in the established period.

loans.use: The member requests the loan to build a shed for guinea pigs and farmyard birds.

loans.name: Katia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS ROSALES DE SAYLLA”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Saylla en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Katia;  La socia tiene  30 años de edad;  ella es soltera; La socia se dedica a la crianza de  aves de corral y cuyes. La socia requiere en esta oportunidad el crédito para comprar animales de corral y de este modo incrementar sus ganancias. La socia compra tiernos los animales los cría engorda y vende, algunas veces se reproducen y esto genera mayor ingreso y esta vez ella aumentara sus animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar aves de corral. 

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Katia is a member of the community bank "Los Rosales de Saylla" [The Roses of Saylla], which is located in the Saylla district in the province and department of Cusco.  

Katia is 30 years old and single.  She works raising poultry and guinea pigs.  She would like this loan to purchase farm animals to increase her income.  She purchases young animals and raises them to be sold.  Sometimes they reproduce and this generates more income and increases the number of animals she has.  

She is asking for this loan to purchase poultry.

Katia is thankful for and values the loan she has been given, and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase of farm animals

loans.name: Paula

texts.es: Paulina, de 51 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia, en compañía de su esposo y sus 2 hijos por quienes trabaja arduamente. Por muchos años apostó en la fabricación de zapatos y no le resultaba rentable, ya que no contaba con la maquinaria necesaria para dinamizar su trabajo. Por ello se dedicó a la fabricación de correas para jóvenes y niños, en el taller de su casa conjuntamente con su esposo y su hijo. De esta manera trabaja arduamente hasta altas horas de la noche, ya que tiene muchos pedidos que cumplir, asegura además en distribuir a los diversos puestos de la mercadería que produce, de esta manera podrá ganar más clientela. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es que no requiere de mucho esfuerzo como la fabricación de zapatos, en cambio le permite captar buenas utilidades. En adelante, desea seguir trabajando con su esposo, para alcanzar la solidez  económica y el fortalecimiento de su capital de trabajo. Es su 21avo crédito con MFP, sabe que si lo paga a tiempo, podrá acceder  a otro con mayor tranquilidad y sin traerle complicaciones a su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará remaches, ojillos, piedrecitas para adornar las correas juveniles que fabrica.
texts.en:
Paulina, 51, is a hard working mother.  She lives in her own house with her husband and two children for whom she works very hard.  For many years she worked at shoe manufacturing but didn’t do too well because she lacked the necessary machinery to propel her work.  She therefore went into making belts for young adults and children in her home-based workshop with her husband and children.

She works very hard this way until quite late at night because she has many pending orders to fill.  She also makes it a point to distribute merchandise to the various sales points in order to acquire more customers.  

What she enjoys most about her work is that it doesn’t require as much effort as shoe making and yet produces good profits.  In the future she’d like to continue working with her husband to attain economic stability and to strengthen her working capital.

This is her 21st loan with MFP.  She knows that if she repays it on time she will be able to attain another one more easily and without causing complications to her communal bank.

She will use the requested funds to buy rivets, eyelets and decorative stones to decorate the belts she makes.

loans.use: To buy materials to make juvenile belts.

loans.name: Eñor De Torrechayoc Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR D. TORRECHAYOC”; este banco está situado en el distrito y provincia D. Urubamba  departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Mery;  La socia es natural D. Calca ella tiene 29 años D. edad y tiene 2 hijos, ella se dedica a la compra y venta D. cristalería y regalos, ella tiene una pequeña tienda en la cual venD. todo tipo D. vasos, floreros, jarras y regalos adornos en vidrio. La socia necesita un capital extra D. trabajo para invertir en la compra D. mercadería. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería.

Los otros socios alternan sus actividades con la atención D. tiendas abarrotes, venta D. verduras y frutas, chofer y artesanía.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Señora Mery is 29 years old, has 2 children and is originally from Calca  .She is also a member of the communal bank "Señor D. Torrechayoc".  The bank is located in the district and province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco. 

Señora Mery buys and sells glassware and gift items for a living.  She has a small store in which she sells all types of vases, jars and glass ornaments.  She needs extra working capital to invest in her business and will use the loan to buy merchandise.                                                                              

The other members have various other jobs such as, attending to grocery stores, fruit and vegetable sales, driver and artisan.  

Señora Mery is grateful and appreciates the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Batan Orcco Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “BATAN ORCCO”; este banco está situado en el distrito D. Huaro,  provincia D. Quispicanchis,  departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Julia;  La socia es casada ella tiene 4 hijos y ella tiene 51 años D. edad; Ella se dedica a la venta y elaboración D. maicillos tradicionales y tamales. La socia es también la presidenta D. este simpático grupo D. mujeres emprendedoras y cariñosas, ella se dedica a la venta D. maicillos en el distrito D. Huaro y a la venta D. tamales los fines D. semana en el distrito D. Urcos. DesD. el año 2000, La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar ingredientes como harina y maíz.

Las  otras socias alternan sus actividades con la venta D. tamales, ponches D. maíz, leche y guinda, venta D. comida, tienda D. abarrotes, crianza D. animales venta D. ropa, compra y venta D. maíz.
La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member is in the “BATAN ORCCO” (To Return  Above) communal bank located in Huaro, Quispicanchis province, Cusco department.

Julia is married and has 4 children.  She is 51 years old.  She sells traditional maicillos (corn flour cookies) and tamales.  She is also the President of this likable group of enterprising, affectionate women.  She has sold maicillos in Huaro and tamales on weekends in Urcos district since the year 2000.  She is asking for funds to buy ingredients like flour and corn.

The other group members alternate their chores with selling tamales, corn drinks, milk and cherries, food, groceries, clothing, farm animals and corn.

Julia is grateful for and values the loan granted this way and at the same time commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy ingredients like flour and corn.

loans.name: Cristo Salva Group

texts.es:
Esperanza es la coordinadora del Grupo Cristo Salva 1 y 2. Su familia está compuesta por 4 hijos y su esposo, ambos (padre y madre) han educado y criado a sus hijos. Nos dice que sus retos o desafíos más difíciles ha sido dedicarse como madre para darle un futuro mejor a sus hijos. 

Esperanza está muy emocionada de recibir su primer préstamo en Esperanza Internacional.  Ella ha tenido su negocio por alrededor de 20 años, el cual inició vendiendo joyas de plata, como anillos y cadenas utilizando un dinero que tenía ahorrado. Esperanza está planificando invertir su nuevo préstamo en la compra de Ropas interiores por docenas, tanto de hombre, mujeres y niños. Ella va a utilizar sus ganancias para ropa nueva y de esta manera poder hacer crecer su negocio y lograr su sueño de poder terminar de construir su casa, también desea tener buena salud y tener una vida más estable económicamente. 

Está asociada de Esperanza comenzó con nosotros porque las cuotas de pagos son más flexibles y a un menor interés. Su historia está siendo usada para representar a los demás miembros de su grupo y a los clientes de Esperanza, tanto los haitianos (quienes en su mayoría ha emigrado hacia la Republica Dominicana desde Haití, algunos de ellos recientemente) y los dominicanos, quienes por lo general viven en comunidades muy pobres, esta zona, como muchas otras zonas de escasos recursos en la Republica Dominicana, carecen de agua potable y energía eléctrica constante. Este grupo se encuentra ubicado en una zona de pocos recursos de La Romana, una ciudad cuya economía depende de la producción de Caña de azúcar y la industria del Turismo de alto nivel.
texts.en:
Esperanza is the coordinator of the Silva Groups 1 and 2.  Her family is made up of 4 children and a husband. Both of them, (father and mother) have raised and educated their children.  Her most difficult challenges, she tells us, have been in her role as a mother trying to provide a better future for her children.

Esperanza is very excited to receive her first loan through Esperanza International.  She has had her business for about 20 years, which she started by selling silver jewelry such as rings and chains, using money that she had saved up.  Esperanza is planning to invest the proceeds of her loan in the purchase of undergarments in dozens, for men, women and children.  She will use her income for new clothing and in such a way will be able to grow her business and achieve her dream of being able to finish building her house.  She also wishes to maintain good health and have a more financially stable life.

This member of the Esperanza Group joined us because of the flexible loan payments and better interest rates.  Her background is representative of  the other members of the group and customers of Esperanza, the Haitians (who for the most part have immigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti, some of them recently) and the Dominicans, both generally live in very poor communities.  This area, like many other areas of limited resources in the Dominican Republic, is lacking in drinking water and constant electrical energy.  This group is located in a low resource area of La Romana, a city whose economy depends on the production of sugar cane and the high level tourist industry.

loans.use: To purchase undergarments in dozens.

loans.name: Guimoxa Group

texts.es: Esta foto fue tomada en L. casa D. Petra Enedina C., una integrante del grupo Guimoxa, que está ubicado en el Estado D. VeraC. en México. Se ve al grupo D. señoras alrededor D. L. mercancía D. doña Petra en L. foto. ElL. se dedica a  L. venta D. cosméticos que inicio hace 5 años. Solicita el préstamo para comprar más mercancía y cubrir sus pedidos. Sus clientes  L. consideran una  persona muy trabajadora. Al momento D. solicitar este préstamo se siente contenta pues va a reinvertir en su negocio. Tiene 42 años, estudio hasta el 7mo. Semestre D. economía, es casada y tiene en total 1 hijo varón. Quiere este crédito para comprar mercancía para surtir sus pedidos. Espera lograr mejorar su vida económicamente y L. D. su hijo con su autoempleo.
texts.en:
This photo was taken in Petra Enedina C’s house.  She is a member of the Guimoxa group located in the Mexican state of VeraC..  In the photo we can see the group of women surrounding Petra’s merchandise.

She has sold cosmetics for 5 years and is asking for funds to buy more merchandise in order to fill her pending orders.  Her customers consider her to be a very hard working person.  She is happy at the time of requesting the loan because she will be able to reinvest in her business.

She is 42 years old and finished the 7th semester majoring in Economics.  She is married and has one son.

She wants this loan to buy merchandise to fill her orders.  She hopes to improve her life and her son’s life economically through her self-employment.
.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to fill her orders.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra is part of the communal bank “Esperanza de Colombo” and resides in the city of San Vicente.  For the past five years, Alejandra has prepared meals, main dishes, salads, and meats, and sells them outside in the streets and sometimes caters to office staff and store owners as clients in the centre of the city. Alejandra employs a woman who helps her sell the prepared meals. Alejandra also makes cakes, such as “kuchenes” a popular sweet cake introduced to Chile by the colonial Germans.  

With this loan Alejandra plan to purchase disposable trays for her chicken and beef dishes.  Alejandra would travel to Santiago to purchase these goods, as it is cheaper there. Alejandra’s husband accompanies her on these trips by car, as he is also a borrower of Fondo Esperanza and takes on construction contracts.  Alejandra dreams of one day opening a store to sell roasted chicken adjacent to her house, so that she could also care for their two small children, a seven year old and newborn only seven days old. 

Alejandra enjoys the ambiance of Kiva Partner Fondo Esperanza and working with her fellow group members and loan officer.  She is also pleased with how easy the process to obtain a loan is with Fondo Esperanza.  Alejandra´s saying is: “Fondo Esperanza fell from the sky to help me.”
 
San Vicente de Tagua Tagua is a commune zone in the center of Chile, belonging to the Region of Libertador General Bernardo O’Higgins, located on the banks of the Estero Zamorano River. San Vincente de Tagua Tagua's main source of income is based on the production of lemons, oranges, and avocados.

loans.use: disposable trays for meat dishes

loans.name: Vyacheslav

texts.en:
Vyacheslav is married and all of his children are grown. He makes a living selling hardware items -- locks, abrasives, heaters and similar items -- at a market in the town of Berdyansk. He enjoys running his business, which he started six years ago and would like to expand.

Vyacheslav is applying for a loan of 10,000 Grivnas to buy more items to sell to his customers. His goal is to increase his income and make further investments in his business. He is a hard-working, entrepreneurial person and believes this loan will help his business to grow further.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to his customers

loans.name: Las Mariposas De Rafael Alvarado Group

texts.es: Esta foto fue tomada en la casa de Angélica Rebeca C., una integrante del grupo Las Mariposas de Rafael Alvarado, que está ubicado en el Estado de Veracruz en México. Se ve al grupo de señoras en el lugar donde doña Angélica prepara su comida. Ella se dedica a  la venta de comida que inicio hace 7 años. Solicita el préstamo para comprar mobiliario como mesas y sillas para el negocio, también quiere comprar algunas cacerolas que le hacen falta. Sus clientes  la consideran una persona muy responsable, trabajadora, y  con un sazón muy bueno. Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente contenta pues va a reinvertir en su negocio. Tiene 53 años, estudio hasta el bachillerato, es soltera y tiene en total 2 hijos (1  varón y 1 mujer). Quiere este crédito para comprar mobiliario y así dar un mejor servicio. También espera mejorar sus situación económica y poder realizar mejoras a su casa para darle mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
This photo was taken in Angélica Rebeca C’s house, a member of the Las Mariposas de Rafael Alvarado (Rafael Alvarado’s Butterflies) group located in the Mexican state of Veracruz.  The women can be seen in the place where Angélica prepares her food.

She has sold home-made food for 7 years.  She is asking for funds to buy furniture like tables and chairs as well as some pots she needs.  Her customers consider her to be a very responsible, hard working woman with a good talent for cooking tasty food.

At the time of requesting the loan she feels happy because she will reinvest in her business.  She is 53 years old and finished high school.  She is single and has two children (a boy and a girl).

She wants the loan to buy furniture to provide better service.  She also hopes to improve her economic situation and do some home improvements in order to provide her family with an improved quality of life.

loans.use: To buy furniture and pots and pans for her business.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a member of the communal bank “Esperanza de Colombo” and lives in the city of San Vicente. She makes a living running various businesses, including catalog sales and the production of crafts items such as trays and small boxes in which people store items. She also owns six video game machines which are located in a neighborhood business. Her husband manages these machines and also works as a teacher.
 
Janet employs two women who, for a commission, help her sell clothing. She has applied for a loan to buy more items, such as various types of clothing, to sell to her customers. She dreams of one day owning a store where she sells children's clothing, which is in short supply in her community. 

Janet has three children, who are 6, 5, and 2 years old. She must manage her time carefully, especially when her two oldest children are in school. She likes working with Kiva Partner Fondo Esperanza, because it charges a low interest rate on loans. She also values the lessons provided by Fondo Esperanza during the group meetings, on topics such as how to properly price products. 

San Vicente de Tagua Tagua is a commune zone in the center of Chile, and is part of an area known as Libertador General Bernardo O’Higgins, located on the banks of the Estero Zamorano River. Most people in this part of Chile make a living selling lemons, oranges and avocados.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Mujeres De Esperanza 1 & 2 Group

texts.es:
Yuri es una de los miembro del Grupo Mujeres de esperanza 1 y 2, compuesto por 10 mujeres microempresarias dedicada a las ventas de ropa, productos naturales, zapatos, etc. Su familia está compuesta por ella, su esposo y dos hijos. Nos dice que su reto o desafío más difícil es cobrarle a los clientes que le deben. 

Yuri está muy emocionada de recibir su Segundo préstamo en Esperanza Internacional, despues de haber pagado satisfactoriamente su prestamo anterior y haber dado un paso para el crecimiento de su negocio.  Ella ha tenido su negocio por alrededor de 15 años, el cual inició vendiendo sabanas y ropa interior, utilizando un dinero que tenía ahorrado. Yuri está planificando invertir su nuevo préstamo en la compra de Productos y medicamentos de la marca Amway, nuestra asociada es distribuidor de los mismos y tiene una amplia clientela que le hacen pedidos, pero tambien vende de modo ambulante ofreciendolos al detalles para las personas que no pueden comprar un frasco. Ella va a utilizar sus ganancias para reinvertir en su negocio y hacerlo crecer. Su sueño es poder lograr sus metas como familia, viendo sus hijos ya adultos, profesiones y piensa lograrlo cuidando de su negocio, tomando mas prestamos y ahorrando a través de Esperanza. 

Está asociada de Esperanza comenzó con nosotros porque tenia la necesidad de invertir capital a su negocio, y por que cree mucho en el programa. Su historia está siendo usada para representar a los demás miembros de su grupo y a los clientes de Esperanza, tanto los haitianos (quienes en su mayoría ha emigrado hacia la Republica Dominicana desde Haití, algunos de ellos recientemente) y los dominicanos, quienes por lo general viven en comunidades muy pobres, esta zona, como muchas otras zonas de escasos recursos en la Republica Dominicana, carecen de agua potable y energía eléctrica constante. Este grupo se encuentra ubicado en una zona de pocos recursos de Puerto Plata, una ciudad cuya economía depende del sector inmobiliario y la industria del Turismo, aunque este sector ha sido opacado por las nuevas zonas turisticas emergentes.
texts.en:
Yuri is one of the members of the “Mujeres de Esperanza 1 y 2” (Women of Hope 1 and 2) group which has 10 micro businesswomen who sell clothes, natural products, shoes, etc.  Her family is composed of herself, her husband and two children.  She tells us that her most difficult challenge is collecting from customers that owe her.

Yuri is very excited to get her second loan from Esperanza Internacional having successfully repaid her previous loan and taken a step towards her business’ growth.  She has had her business for about 15 years that she started using her savings to buy bed sheets and underwear to sell.

Yuri is planning to use her new loan to buy Amway brand products.  She is an Amway distributor and has a wide clientele that places order but she also sells the products in an itinerant manner selling the products piecemeal to customers who can’t afford to buy the whole jar.  She will use her profits to reinvest in her business and make it grow.  Her dream is to reach her goals as a family, to see her children grow into professional adults and she plans to do so caring for her business, getting more loans and saving through Esperanza.

This Esperanza associate started with us because she needed to invest capital in her business and because she believes in the program.  Her history is being used to exemplify her other group members as well as clients of Esperanza, both the Haitians (who for the most part have emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti, some of them quite recently) as well as the Dominicans who generally live in very poor communities like this zone and many others like it in the Dominican Republic which have few resources; they lack drinking water and reliable electricity.

This group is located in an area of few resources called Puerto Plata, a city whose economy depends primarily on real estate and Tourism although the latter has recently been overshadowed by new, emerging tourist areas.

loans.use: To buy Amway products.

loans.name: Hermes Felipe

texts.es:
Hermes es un hombre muy trabajador, se dedica ah administrar su propio negocio. El alquiler de cuarto y  un taxi que el mismo trabaja. Casado y padre de tres hijas.
Negocio que inicio con iniciativa y con ahorros de su trabajo anterior. Atreves de los préstamo ha venido hacer las mejoras a su casa. Pues todo esta ah altos costos principalmente la canasta básica. El equilibrio lo ha logrado gracias al cuarto que alquila ya que las carreras de taxi están bajas.
Con este préstamo hará la mejora de su techo, ya que necesita mejorar esta condición en su casa. Para el bienestar familiar y que gracias a los financiamientos de la institución lo está logrando: para esto comprara: diez lamina de zinc, doce perlines,  cuatro bolsa de cemento, bidón de pintura, entre otros.
texts.en:
Hermes is a very hard working man.  He administers his own business which is a room rental and driving a taxi.  He is married and the father of three daughters.

He started his business with his own initiative and savings from a previous job.  Thanks to loans he has been making home improvements because everything, especially the basic monthly food needs, has gone up in price.  He has managed to stay even thanks to the room he rents because the taxi fares have been low.

With this loan he will improve the roof because he needs to improve this aspect of his house for his family’s wellbeing.  Thanks to the loans from the institution he is accomplishing it.  He will buy ten sheets of zinc metal, twelve metal beams, four sacks of cement, a large container of paint among others.

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies to reroof and improve the family's living conditions.

loans.name: Juana Maela

texts.es: Juana tiene 46 años tiene 5 hijos ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos. hace más de 16 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que no ha sido fácil mantener este negocio, por lo que anteriormente tenía una pulpería, pero con el paso del tiempo le fue gustando la venta de cosméticos además que algunos clientes no le pagaban es por eso que no pudo seguir. Por lo que es cliente de Fundación León 2000 desde hace tiempo y ha tenido cierta experiencia con los financiamientos. Juana solicita este crédito para la compra de materia prima como lápiz labial, polvos, sombras, perfumes, cremas y tratamientos.
texts.en: Juana, 46, has 5 children and works selling cosmetics. She has been in the cosmetics business for 16 years, which has not always been easy. Prior to this she had a stationary store but over time she came to enjoy selling cosmetics. Moreover, some of her customers were not making payments and she was not able to continue the stationary business. A client of Fundación León 2000 for some time, Juana has experience with loans. She is currently requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as lipstick, powders, eye shadows, perfumes, creams, and hair and body treatments.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: The Women´s Bank Of Faith Group

texts.en:
The Women´s Bank of Faith is made up of nine women who live in La Rita, Limón, located near the Carribbean coast of Costa Rica. The loan consultant who has been working with these women describes them as a motivated collection of individuals with the desire and ability to work hard towards the success of the group as well as the overall improvement of living conditions for the members and their families. In general, the main obstacle to the success of these women has been a lack of access to working capital. This loan will enable the group members to invest in their businesses and expand operations. 

The women of this group are involved in various productive activities including the rearing and selling of animals (pigs and chickens) as well as commercial and industrial activities. Nuvia, Tania, Yesenia and Lilliana R. have businesses selling clothing in their community. For these women, this loan will be used to finance the purchase of inventory items such as clothing for men, women and children as well as shoes and jewelry. 

Lilliana Morin and Doris are in the business of animal rearing. While Lilliana raises chickens and pigs, Doris only handles chickens. For these two loan recipients, this loan will be used to finance investments in livestock, animal feed and construction materials (for the construction of animal pens).
Rita is the elected president of this group.  During the week, she takes care of her children and carries out domestic tasks at home. During this time, clients come to peruse various items she has for sale such as clothing, jewelry and shoes. On the weekends, she travels from door to door in her community selling items to clients. Sometimes, her husband goes with her and they travel to neighbouring communities in order to find new clients.
 
Rita says her main goal is to increase the income generated from her sales business. She says that with more revenue, she will be able to provide a higher standard of living for her family. She would also like to increase the amount of revenue she receives from sales to stores as opposed to individual clients. Rita explained that, like other group members, her main hindrance has been a lack of access to working capital. She says that this loan represents an opportunity to overcome this obstacle. 

The members of The Women´s Bank of Faith have been neighbours and friends for a number of years. The group acknowledges the advantages of the group lending model: the ability for each group member to act as a loan guarantor as well as recipient. They also acknowledge the potential disadvantage which could manifest itself if any members have trouble making repayments, as each individual is responsible for all repayments.

loans.use: For the purchase of clothing, jewelry, livestock and animal feed

loans.name: Maria Estella

texts.es: Maria Estella tiene 61 años, es una mujer luchadora y alegre, y a pesar de los constantes problemas que afronta está siempre busca la forma de salir adelante. Desde muy temprano se temprano ella se dedica a la venta de carne de res, cerdo entre otras. Como todo negocio estableció un pequeño negocio de estos productos en su vivienda  por lo que llegan diferentes clientes que solicitan de este productos. Ella dio inicio por su Mama quien anteriormente vendía en el mercado fue así que desde muy joven aprendió a ganarse la vida. Por lo que solicita este crédito para la compra de carnes ya que tiene cierta demanda. Sueña con hacer más grande su establecimiento y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
María Estella, 61, is a hard working, cheerful woman.  Despite the constant difficulties she faces she always seeks ways to get ahead.

She sells meat, primarily beef and pork, among others, from very early in the day.  Like all businesses, she set up this small business in her home and different customers come by to seek these products.  She started out thanks to her mother who used to sell in the market and this is how she learned from a very young age to earn her livelihood.

She is asking for this loan to buy meats because she has a bit of demand.  She dreams with enlarging her establishment and make some home improvements.

loans.use: To buy meat.

loans.name: Union Con Esperanza 1 & 2 Group

texts.es:
Jefrica es una D. los miembro del Grupo Union con esperanza 1 y 2, compuesto por 10 miembros dedicada a las ventas D. ropa, cosmeticos, zapatos, vegetales, etc. Es una joven madre soltera D. 22 años D. edad, L. cual dedica su tiempo a los estudios, atender su negocio y cuidar a su pequeña bebe. Nos dice que su reto o desafío más difícil ha sido criar a su niña soL., si un padre a su lado. 

Jefrica está muy emocionada D. recibir su tercer préstamo en Esperanza Internacional, despues D. haber pagado satisfactoriamente sus prestamos anteriores y haber dado un paso para el crecimiento D. su negocio.  ElL. ha tenido su negocio por alrededor D. 8 meses, el cual inició despues D. haber realizado un curso D. artesania, anteriormente estaba en L. venta D. ropa y cosmeticos pero despues D. haber estudio, vio una mejor oportunidad en desarrollar este nuevo negocio. jefrica está planificando invertir su nuevo préstamo en L. compra D. materiales para L. elaboracion D. obras artesanales, su plan es comprar yeso, pintura y platos D. barro, en los cuales piensa pintarlos con diferentes motivos. ElL. va a utilizar sus ganancias para ahorrar y a corto plazo poder rentar un local para su negocio, donD. pueda exhibir y vender sus obras. Su sueño es poder lograr tener un local propio para su negocio, y piensa lograrlo con su esfuerzo y adquiendo mas prestamos. 

Está asociada D. Esperanza comenzó con nosotros porque tenia L. necesidad D. desarrollar un negocio que le permitiera cuidar a su hija y ontener ingresos. Su historia está siendo usada para representar a los demás miembros D. su grupo y a los clientes D. Esperanza, tanto los haitianos (quienes en su mayoría ha emigrado hacia L. Republica Dominicana desD. Haití, algunos D. ellos recientemente) y los dominicanos, quienes por lo general viven en comunidades muy pobres, esta zona, como muchas otras zonas D. escasos recursos en L. Republica Dominicana, carecen D. agua potable y energía eléctrica constante. Este grupo se encuentra ubicado en una zona D. pocos recursos D. Puerto Plata, una ciudad cuya economía depenD. del sector inmobiliario y L. industria del Turismo, aunque este sector ha sido opacado por las nuevas zonas turisticas emergentes.
texts.en:
Jefrica is one of the members of the “Union con Esperanza 1 y 2” (Unity with Hope 1 and 2) group which has 10 members who sell clothes, cosmetics, shoes, vegetables, etc.  She is a young, 22-year-old, single mother who spends her time studying, tending to her business and caring for her young baby.  She tells us that her most difficult challenge has been raising her daughter by herself without a father by her siD..

Jefrica is very excited about receiving her third loan from Esperanza Internacional after having repaid her previous loans satisfactorily and taken another step towards her business’ growth.

She has had her business for about 8 months.  She started it after taking some crafts courses.  She used to sell clothing and cosmetics but after taking the courses she recognized a better opportunity in developing this business.

Jefrica is planning to invest her new loan buying materials to make crafts.  Her plan is to buy plaster, paint and clay plates that she plans to decorate with various motifs.  She will use her profits to save up so that she can rent a locale shortly for her business and be able to display and sell her works. Her dream is to have her own place for her business and she plans to reach it through effort and by getting more loans.

This Esperanza associate started with us because she needed to develop a business that allowed her to care for daughter and still earn income.  Her story is being used to exemplify her fellow group members as well as all Esperanza’s clients both the Haitians (who for the most part have emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti, some of them recently) as well as the Dominicans who for the most part live in very poor areas, like this zone, and many others in the Dominican Republic that are poor in resources; they lack drinking water and reliable electric service.

This group is located in an area of poor resources called Puerto Plata, a city whose economy depends on real estate and tourism although the latter has been overshadowed recently by the emergence of newer tourist areas.

loans.use: To buy paint, plaster and plates.

loans.name: Nuvia Estibilita

texts.es:
En la calle San Eduardo vía a Santa Ana, de la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde épocas coloniales,  se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal “16 de Julio”.

Aquí encontramos a la señora Nuvia ella tiene 36 años de edad, está casada hace 13 años, de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 11 y una precisa pequeña de 7 años, los dos estudian en escuela. Su esposo es chofer de un expreso escolar.

A los 17 años aprendió corte y confección en la Academia Luis Alfredo Carvajal de la ciudad de Portoviejo, es así  como tiempo después se dedico a coser ropa y hoy tiene un pequeño taller de costura en su casa, trabaja todos los días de 8am a  10h30 y de 14h00 a20h00, en espacios de tiempo se dedica a ayudar a sus hijos en las tareas de la escuela, confecciona todo tipo de ropa pero lo que mas le gusta hacer es ropa sport y casual, trabaja con la ayuda de su hermana ya que sola no alcanza a  cumplir con los trabajos que le llegan.

Este crédito es para comprar telas y otros materiales para la costura. Esta en el Banco Comunal hace ya seis años y le gusta por las facilidades para realizar los pagos y por la ayuda que recibe de la institución.

Su sueño es tener un taller grande en el centro.
texts.en:
The members of the “16 de Julio” communal bank meet every two weeks on San Eduardo street toward Santa Ana, in the city of Portoviejo.  Since colonial times, the city has been referred to as the city of the Royal Tamarinds.

Here we find Nuvia.  She is 36 years old and has been married for 13 years.  She has an 11 year old son and a precious 7 year old daughter, both attending school.  Her husband drives a school bus.

When she was 17, she learned how to cut and make clothing at the “Academia Luis Alfredo Carvajal” in Portoviejo.  She began making clothing and now has her own small tailor shop in her home, where she works daily from 8:00 AM to 10:30 AM and then from 2:00 PM to 8:00 PM.  In her spare time she helps her children with their homework.  She makes all types of clothing, but what she enjoys making the most is sport and casual clothing.  Her sister helps her because she gets too many orders to do herself.

She will use the money from this loan to buy fabric and other materials.  She has been with her communal bank for six years and she likes the ease of repayment terms from the institution.  Her dream is to have a large shop in the city center.

loans.use: Supplies

loans.name: Angela Del Socorro

texts.es:
Ángela es una mujer  trabajadora, económicamente muy humilde, trabaja en limpieza en una empresa privada, casada, siendo su esposo vigilante.
Sus recursos económicos son pocos y es atreves del prestamos en Afodenic ha venido mejorando su casa, tiene una parte de la vivienda toda de concreto. Ya que va poco a poco porque no cuenta con la disponibilidad para hacer un préstamo de mas cantidad.
Es por eso con este financiamiento comenzara la construcción de la otra pared de concreto para poder avanzar en las mejoras para esto comprara: materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro y comenzar la obra.
texts.en:
Ángela es una mujer  trabajadora, económicamente muy humilde, trabaja en limpieza en una empresa privada, casada, siendo su esposo vigilante.
Sus recursos económicos son pocos y es atreves del prestamos en Afodenic ha venido mejorando su casa, tiene una parte de la vivienda toda de concreto. Ya que va poco a poco porque no cuenta con la disponibilidad para hacer un préstamo de mas cantidad.
Es por eso con este financiamiento comenzara la construcción de la otra pared de concreto para poder avanzar en las mejoras para esto comprara: materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro y comenzar la obra.

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Ivania Azucena

texts.es: Ivania Azucena tiene 63 años. Su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 16 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que ha sido muy difícil pero ha logrado superar. Cuando inicio necesitaba ingresos para mantener a su familia, siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una persona responsable y que disfruta de su trabajo, sus dos hijos le ayudan en lo que pueden porque saben el sacrificio que ella realiza para proporcionarles lo necesario  este financiamiento es para la compra de mercadería variada y que necesita para ofrecerle a sus clientes. Desea incrementar su inventario y mejorar las condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Ivania Azucena is 63 years old and has been selling general merchandise for 16 years.  It’s been very difficult for her, but she’s managed to be successful.  When she began, she needed an income to support her family.  She has always been known for being responsible and she enjoys her work.  Her two children help as much as they can, because they are aware of the sacrifices that she makes to provide for their needs.  She will use the money from this loan to buy a variety of merchandise that she needs in order to offer it to her customers.  She wants to increase her inventory and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Enma Estela

texts.es:
En la calle San Eduardo vía a Santa Ana, de la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde épocas coloniales se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal “16 de Julio”.

La señora Enma es socia del Banco Comunal desde hace 10 ciclos y esta muy contenta de pertenecer al mismo, le gusta por la seriedad del grupo y porque siempre recibe la ayuda cuando lo necesita de la institución. Tiene 51 años de edad, y hace muchos años su querido esposo falleció y desde allí tuvo que hacerse cargo sola de los gastos de sus tres hijos que hoy ya son mayores de edad pero aun viven con ella,  el mayor está haciendo la rural pues estudio medicina y los otros aun estudian en la Universidad.

Dice que era una carga muy dura y es así como empezó vendiendo productos de Avon (productos de belleza y perfumería), trabajo que al pasar los años fue incrementando. Trabaja todos los días desde las9 am hasta las 15h00 su sistema es por pedidos, los cuales los realiza cada  fin de mes, deja a crédito sus productos y cobra por semana o quincena.
  
Este crédito lo quiere ocupar para arreglar el piso de su casa que como es de madera esta un poco deteriorado y ya le han causado molestias, por eso espera cambiarlo para mejorar su humilde hogar.
 
Sus sueños son que todos sus hijos cumplan sus metas y terminar su casa.
texts.en:
The “16 de Julio” communal bank meets every two weeks, on San Eduardo Street, toward the city of Portoviejo.  Since colonial times, it has been known as the city of the Royal Tamarinds.

Enma has been with the communal bank for ten cycles and she is very happy to be a member.  She likes the security of the group and the fact that she always receives help from the institution when she needs it.  [Enma] is 51 years old and it’s been many years since her loving husband passed away.  Since then she’s had to take charge of the expenses for her three children, who are now adults but still live with her.  The oldest is now establishing his career.  He studied medicine and the other two are students in university.

She tells us that this was a difficult task, but this is how she came to begin selling Avon products (perfumes and cosmetics); work that increased over the years.  She works daily from 9:00 AM to 3:00 PM, and sells on credit, collecting from her customers weekly or biweekly.

She will use the money from this loan to fix the floor in her home.  It is a wooden floor that is a bit deteriorated and has caused her some problems.  She wants to replace it and improve her humble home.  She hopes that her will children achieve their goals and that she is able to finish her home.

loans.use: Repair the floor in her home

loans.name: Juana Del Carmen

texts.es: Juana del Carmen tiene 51 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general hace mas de 13 años que tiene este negocio, inicio para mejorar los ingresos de su vivienda, tiene una amplia variedad de clientes que llegan a solicitarle diferentes productos, por lo que ha sabido salir adelante. Es con el paso del tiempo que ha logrado adquirir experiencia y además en los financiamientos que han sido de gran ayuda. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de materia prima como pantalones, camisas, cosméticos, calzado y ropa interior.
texts.en: Juana del Carmen is 51 years old.  She sells general merchandise and began this business more than 13 years ago to increase her household income.  She’s learned how to get ahead and has a large variety of customers who request different products from her.  Over the years she’s gotten more experience and the loans have been a great help.  She will use the money from this loan to buy inventory, such as pants, shirts, cosmetics, shoes, and underclothing.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 50 años, es una madre de familia amable y cordial, vive con su esposo y sus 5 hijos en casa de su madre. Recorriendo las calles de su distrito, Rosa se dedica a la venta de ropa a sus amistades, familiares y algunas vecinas que viven cerca de su casa. La gran ventaja que tiene es que ella tiene buen gusto por seleccionar la ropa que vende y que son del gusto de la mayoría de los  clientes, motivo por el cual las prendas terminan por venderse rápido. Disfruta mucho de su trabajo,  aunque eso implica que tenga que caminar mucho ya que cuanto más vende, es más las ganancias que recibe. Con el tiempo desea poner una boutique, donde pueda exhibir en vitrinas la mercadería que posee y poder captar más clientes. Es si 25avo crédito con MFP y está feliz de poder obtenerlo, manifiesta que invertirá todo el dinero  en su negocio. En su grupo comunal, es muy querida por la solidaridad que demuestra. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará polos, buzos y demás ropa, para abastecer el pedido a sus clientas.
texts.en: Rosa, 50, is a friendly, courteous woman.  She lives in her mother's house with her husband and 5 children.  Rosa sells clothing for a living.  Her customers are her friends, her family and neighbors in the surrounding streets.  Her great advantage is her unerring taste.  She buys the kind of clothing that her customers want and, consequently, she can easily sell the clothing on to her customers.  She likes the work very much even though she spends a lot of time going door to door.  She doesn't mind because knows that the harder she works, the more she'll earn.  She would like to set up her own shop where she can display her merchandise and bring in customers.  This is Rosa's 25th MFP loan and she's very happy to get it.  She will invest the loan in her business.  She is very well regarded in her community group because she fully supports the other members.  The money from this loan will buy shirts, sweaters and other clothing that Rosa will stock for her customers.

loans.use: Buy clothing to resell.

loans.name: Marlon Antonio

texts.es:
Marlon es un joven muy trabajador, pues siempre apoyo a sus padres con el negocio. Es casado con dos hermosos hijos. 
Trabaja independiente administrando su propia pulpería que tiene meses de haber comenzado ya que ha trabajado con sus padres en la variedad de cosmético al por mayor.
Hoy en día está logrando las mejoras para su familia ya que está contento por este nuevo negocio que espera sobresalir adelante a través de los financiamientos  en Afodenic,  que han venido hacer de gran beneficio para el incremento de productos. Logrando así más clientela y mejores ganancias.
Con este préstamo comprara: gaseosas, jugos, golosinas, productos lácteos, pollo, carnes, productos de limpiezas, granos básicos. Y poder llenar mas para lograr un mejor inventario, mejores ventas y salir adelante con su negocio.
texts.en: Marlon is a hard-working young man and he helps his parents with the business that he operates.  Marlon is marrried and has two beautiful children.  He owns and manages a corner store that he spent months setting up because he was working with his parents all the while.  Now, he's working on behalf of his family with this new business, a business that he hopes will leap ahead with help from Afodenic.  Past loans have already helped him increase the variety of products he can stock which, in turn, has increased his customer base and his earnings.  With this loan, Marlon will buy: soft drinks, juices, snacks, dairy products, meat, cleaning products and grain products.  He'll be able to stock more inventory, improve sales and move the business ahead.

loans.use: Buy merchandise to resell.

loans.name: Angela Rosa

texts.es:
En la calle San Eduardo vía a Santa Ana, de la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde épocas coloniales se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal “16 de Julio”.

La señora Angela esta en el Banco Comunal hace varios años, los créditos le han servido mucho en su negocio, en su vida y ha podido mejorar mucho su situación, en la actualidad es la tesorera del Banco. Tiene 49 años, está casada y de esta relación tuvo tres hijos ya todos mayores pero dos aun viven con ella. Su esposo es maestro de colegio.

Se dedica al comercio de productos  Yanbal y Romanel, trabaja todos los días unas tres horas diarias, entrega sus productos y cobra cada semana, estos productos son de catálogos y así mismo se los realice por pedidos cada fin de mes.

Este crédito lo va a ocupar en comprar más mercadería para poder cumplir con los pedidos.
 
Sus sueños son llegar a ser una gran empresaria y tener un almacén.
texts.en:
The members of the 16 de Julio community bank meet every couple of weeks on San Eduardo street in Portoviejo, a city known from colonial times as the City of Royal Tamarinds.

Sra. Angela has been a member of the bank for several years and she has used past loans to greatly improve her business and her situation in life.  She is now the group's treasurer.  Sra. Angela is 49 years old and married with three children.  The children are grown, but two still live at home.  Her husband is a teacher.

Sra. Angela sells Yanbal and Romanel products.  She works some three hours a day, every day, delivering her products.  She collects from her customers weekly.  She buys from catalogs, filling orders at the end of each month.  

Sra. Angela will use this loan to buy merchandise to fill orders.  

She wants to be a successful entrepreneur and own her own store.

loans.use: Buy products to resell.

loans.name: Sandra Del Socorro

texts.es: Sandra se dedica a una pulpería. Ella dio inicio hace más de 8 años comenzó con esfuerzo propio vendiendo muy pocos productos por lo que además se dedica a la venta de guirilas con cuajada por lo que siempre le ha gustado ser una persona muy trabajadora y disfruta de interactuar con sus diferentes clientes que llegan a su vivienda. No es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos para lograr sacar adelante su vivienda.  Este crédito es para la compra de materia prima como granos básicos, detergentes, golosinas entre otros productos de primera necesidad.
texts.en: Sandra is dedicated to a small retail store. She started more than 8 years ago when she began the effort selling a few products. She also sells guirilas, a pancake made of corn, because she has always liked to be a hard worker and enjoys interacting with her different customers who arrive at her home. This is not the first time she requests a loan to improve her house. This credit is for the purchase of raw material such as basic grains, detergents, and candy, among other necessary things.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: Maria Isabel se dedica al destace de cerdo. Hace más de 17 años que inicio este negocio, y por medio de su esposo quien le ayudo a dedicarse a este negocio. Es una persona que tiene mucha experiencia con créditos, por lo que no ha sido la primera vez. Tiene 1 hijo menor de 6 años que está a su cargo  ella se levanta temprano pues sabe que la mayoría de sus clientes llegan a buscar sus productos. Este crédito es para la compra de materia prima como cerdos ya que tiene muy buenas ofertas. Sueña con obtener más capital de trabajo para mejorar su calidad de vida.
