texts.en: Maria Isabel is dedicated to gutting pigs. For more than 17 years she has been working in this business, through her husband who helped her get started in this business. She has a lot of experience with credits, so this is not the first time. She has a 6 year old son who she takes care of. She wakes up early since she knows that the majority of her customers arrive early to ask for her products. This credit is to purchase raw material such as pigs since she has a lot of great offers. She dreams of obtaining more working capital to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Elber Joel

texts.es:
Elber tiene 32 años de edad, es soltero y vive en casa de su primo, ubicada en el asentamiento humano San José de Moro, una zona urbano – marginal situada cinco minutos antes de llegar a la ciudad de Chepén, el lugar pertenece a la región La Libertad y se encuentra ubicado aproximadamente a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado consistente en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para realizar actividades de transporte), el brinda su servicio en la ciudad de Chepén contando con una demanda estable, ya que las mototaxis son consideradas un medio de transporte estable y rápido.

El continuo uso otorgado a su mototaxi ha hecho que esta empiece a sufrir algunas fallas que requieren de urgente reparación para garantizar su correcto funcionamiento, como no cuenta con capital suficiente para realizar esta acción ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Elber es un joven muy trabajador y bastante responsable. Las personas que le conocen le consideran alguien tranquilo y de confianza.
texts.en:
Elber is 32 years old, single and lives in his cousin's house, located in San Jose de Moro, a marginal urban zone located 5 minutes before the town of Chepen in the La Libertad region, about an hour north of Chiclayo, the captial of the state of Lambayeque.

He is dedicated to cargo and passenger transport in a motorickshaw (motorized vehicle that consists of a motorcicle with an annexed cabin to realize transportation activities). He provides this service in the town of Chepen, and he counts on a stable demand, since motorickshaws are considered a stable and fast mode of transportation.

The continual use of the motorickshaw has caused it to suffer some problems that require urgent repair to guarantee correct performance; since he doesn't have enought working capital to repair it he thought he should request his first 2000 nuevos soles loan to Edpyme Alternativa.

Elber is a responsible young man who is a hard worker. The people who know him consider him someone who is calm and trustworthy.

loans.use: Repair and maintenance of a motorickshaw

location.town: San José de Moro - Chepén - La Libertad

loans.name: Rosa Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Rosa Del Carmen tiene 33 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos de 8 y 14 años de edad respectivamente. La señora tiene un negocio de reparación y venta de repuestos de bicicleta, en un negocio ubicado frente al estadio una buena zona con fácil accesibilidad. Ella ya tiene 9 años de estar trabajando en este tipo de negocio, anteriormente tenía el negocio en su casa y después lo traslado buscando como obtener más ventas. Ella empezó a los 24 años de edad con su difunta mama, después con otro amigo del taller hasta que logro independizarse. Ella solicita este crédito con el propósito de comprar más repuestos para ofertar más productos. Lo que ella aduce, es que el negocio lo tiene que administrar ella para saber bien como están las ganancias y saber cuánto tiene que reinvertir. Su sueño es salir adelante y principalmente brindar los estudios universitarios de sus dos hijos para que ellos salgan adelante en la vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa Del Carmen is 33 years old. She is married with 2 children, ages 8 and 14. She has a bicycle repair and parts business, located across from the stadium, a good, easily accessible location. She has been working in this business for 9 years. Previously she worked out of her home, and then moved the business in order to increase sales. 
She began this business with her mother, who is now deceased, when she was 24 years old, and after that worked with another friend until she was able to work on her own. She is requesting funds to purchase more parts and offer more products. She believes she has to manage this business herself, in order to know what she's earning and how much she needs to reinvest. Her dream is to continue moving foward, and be able to provide a college education for her two children, so they can succeed in life.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, D. 72 años, es una madre D. familia muy trabajara, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Su  actividad a la que Rosa se dedica, es la venta D. artefactos electrodomésticos usados. Su trabajo inicia comprando estos artefactos deteriorados y usados, luego su esposo verifica que repuestos deberá cambiar y después hace el mantenimiento técnico para luego ser vendidos nuevamente. D. esta manera viene trabajando durante 15 años y lo que más le apasiona D. ello, es la comunicación y el contacto con sus clientes, sin embargo le incomoda es que no cuenta con un puesto fijo, porque constantemente le desalojan los policías municipales, del lugar donD. se sitúa. Se siente contenta D. vender artefactos reparados a precios asequibles, por lo que le compran D. todas las condiciones sociales. En adelante anhela alquilar un puesto dentro del mercado o cambiar D. rubro por el que se dedicaría a la venta D. ropa. Este es el 33avo crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas a tiempo y esta dispuesta hacerlo, ya que no quiere perjudicar a su grupo comunal, es donD. es muy querida por el resto D. sus socias. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará repuestos D. licuadoras, asimismo juguetes y ropa para iniciar otro rubro y aprovechar la campaña naviD.ña.
texts.en:
Rosa, 72 years old, is the mother of a very hard-working family. She lives in her own house with her husband and her three children. She works selling used appliances. She starts by purchasing used and damaged appliances, then her husband determines which parts should be replaced, and then does the repairs so they can be resold. 
She has been working in this business for 15 years, and what she enjoys most is the communication and contact with her customers. However, what troubles her is not having a fixed location, because she is constantly being moved by the local police from wherever she is situated. She is happy to sell these used appliances at reasonable prices, so people in all economic situations can buy them. 
In the future she hopes to rent a location within the market, or change careers and sell clothes. This is her 33rd loan from MFP, she understands that she must make her payments on time, and is committed to doing so, as she doesn't want to harm her communal bank, where she is well liked by the other members. With the funds she is requesting, she will purchase parts for blenders, as well as toys and clothes to start another business, and take advantage of the holiday season.

loans.use: Comrpar repuestos para arreglar los artefactos que venderá.

loans.name: Erika Del Carmen

texts.es:
Erika es una pequeña comerciante, se dedica a la venta de su propio negocio, la venta de cuajadas, tortillas, enchiladas, frutas. Para poder ayudar a sus padres, anteriormente trabajaba en una librería, pero renuncio y esta mas enfocada en su negocio, que atreves del financiamiento espera aumentar de inventario para poner a la venta mas producto rico, que llamen la atención del cliente.
También los fines de semana hace sopa, tacos oh vigoron,  para vender y poder ganar. Como objetivo es poder crecer un poco más.
Es por eso con este crédito comprara: granos básicos, pollo, carne, frutas, verduras y golosinas para lograr el aumento de inventario. Está contenta por poder seguir adelante con su inversión que gracias a la institución lo está logrando.
texts.en:
Erika is a small trader, who engages in selling cuajadas (a dessert made of curd cheese), tortillas, enchiladas and fruits in her own shop. In order to help her parents, she had started working in a book shop, but she then stopped and is now more concentrated on her activity; thanks to the loan she hopes to increase her stock to be able to sell more tasty products that will attract more customers.
In the week-ends she also prepares soups, tacos and vigorón (a typical Nicaraguan dish made of vegetables, marinated chile, boiled yucca and friend pork wrapped in plantain) to sell them and earn some more. Her goal is for her activity to grow a little bit more.
For this reason with the loan she is requesting she will buy: basic grains, chicken, meat, fruits, vegetables and sweets to augment her stock. She is happy to be able to keep on running her activity thanks to the loan this institution is about to grant her.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, chicken, meat, fruits vegetables and sweets to increase her stock.

loans.name: Pez Globo Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Pez Globo, porque la mayoría de las integrantes venden globos y otras cuantas venden pescado en los tianguis. Está ubicado en Atlacomulco en el Estado de México.  El grupo está conformado por 12 integrantes. 

Patricia M. González es la presidenta del grupo. Tiene 43 años, estudió hasta el 2º año de primaria, es comerciante y tiene en total seis hijos (2 mujeres y 4 hombres). Ella se dedica a la venta de globos que inició hace 23 años. Solicita el préstamo para comprar globos metálicos y tanque de gas helio para inflar los globos. Sus clientes en su gran mayoría son niños o según la ocasión puede ser que también consuman los novios o esposos, su mercado es en las calles de la Ciudad de México (Parque Residencial en Coacalco), además de zonas concurridas como parques, explanadas, centros recreativos, etc. Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente contenta y motivada. Quiere este crédito para  la temporada del 01 y 02 de noviembre, navidad y dia de reyes, ya que la venta es buena en estos días. También espera terminar de estudiar la primaria y secundaria, actualmente está estudiando la primaria en el sistema abierto (INEA), además tiene el objetivo de remodelar su casa.
texts.en:
This group is called Pez Globo ("Balloon Fish") because the majority of the members sell balloons and the others sell fish at street markets.  They are situated in Atlacomulco in the State of Mexico.  The group is composed of 12 members.

Patricia M. G. is the president of this group.  She is 43 years old and has a total of six children (2 girls and 4 boys).  She has only studied up to second grade.  She is a vendor and sells balloons, which she began doing over 23 years ago.  She is seeking a loan in order to purchase metallic balloons and helium gas tanks to use to inflate them.  The majority of her customers are children, or depending on the occasion, sometimes they can also include boyfriends and husbands.  Aside from crowded areas, like parks, esplanades, recreation centers, etc., she also sells her products on the streets of Mexico City (a residential park in Coacalco).  As she applies for this loan, she is content and motivated.  She would this credit for the 1st and 2nd of November, Christmas, and the Three Wise Kings Day, since sales rise on those days.  Also, she hopes to finish elementary and middle school.  Currently, she is finishing her primary education through the open system (INEA).  Lastly, she wants to remodel her house.

loans.use: To invest in her business.

loans.name: Noris Fátima

texts.es:
En la calle San Eduardo vía a Santa Ana, de la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde épocas coloniales se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal “16 de Julio”.

Aquí conversamos con la señora Noris que nos cuenta un poquito de su vida, ella tiene 47 años, está casada y tiene tres hijos, dos ya son mayores de edad y una linda jovencita que estudia en colegio, su hijo mayor ya no vive con ella, ya que tiene su propia familia, el marido es chofer de un tractor.

Es una ama de casa que para obtener ingresos propios se dedico  a la venta de Yanbal (productos de belleza y perfumería) por catalogo y también vende sabanas, vende en su casa donde sus clientes llegan a recibir sus pedidos aunque hay días que sale a recorrer más que todo en lo que es la venta de sabanas, este trabajo dice que es mas complicado pero es el que mejores ganancias deja comenta, trabaja todos los días unas cuatro horas a excepción de los sábados que realiza los cobros casi todo el dia.

Este crédito lo va ocupar en ir hasta Guayaquil a comprar sabanas ya que es allí donde ella compra porque son mejores y  a buen precio. Esta en el Banco Comunal hace 7 años y en la actualidad es la presidenta del Banco.

Su meta es tener un negocio más grande
texts.en:
On the street, San Eduardo via a Santa Ana, in the city of Portoviejo, known as Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos (The City of the Real Tamarinds) since colonial times, members of the communal bank, "16 de Julio," meet every fifteen days.  

Here, we conversed with Señora Noris, who told us a little bit about her life.  She is 47 years old and married.  She has three children, 2 of which are of legal age and a beautiful young daughter that is studying.  Her oldest son no longer lives with her and has his own family.  Her husband works as a tractor operator.

She is a house wife that sells Yanbal (beauty products and perfumes) through catalogs to earn her own living.  Also, she sells sheets from her home, where her customers come to give their orders.  However there are days where she spends most of her time out and about trying to sell her sheets.  She says that this job is very complicated but it earns well.  She works every day for about four hours, except on Saturdays, when she collects her payments for the week.

This credit will be used to cover her costs to travel to Guayaquil to purchase sheets, which is where she goes to buy them because they are better quality and cheaper.  She has been a member of the communal bank for over 7 years and currently is the president of the bank.  Her goal is to have a bigger business.

loans.use: Purchase sheets.

loans.name: Mónica De Lourdes

texts.es:
En la calle San Eduardo vía a Santa Ana, de la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde épocas coloniales se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal “16 de Julio”.

La señora Mónica tiene 38 años de edad, esta divorciada hace ya un buen tiempo, de esa relación tiene un hijo de nueve años y dice que es lo mejor que Dios le dio, a pesar de lo duro que es sacarlo adelante ya que en la actualidad está en la escuela y esto conlleva  muchos gastos, vive en la casa de sus padres, aprendió corte y confección hace mucho tiempo en el Centro de Aprendizaje Virgen De Guadalupe.

Es así como al verse sola con su hijo decidió instalar un pequeño taller de costura aprovechando que su papa le dio oportunidad de que lo ponga en su casa y no pague arriendo, trabaja todos los días desde las 8am después de dejar a su hijo en la escuela hasta las 12h00, de allí ayuda a su hijo en las tareas para luego volver a su costura hasta la noche, dice que es sacrificado pero a ella le encanta su trabajo y lo realiza con amor  por eso que tiene muchos clientes afirma.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar telas y materiales de costura. Es socia del Banco Comunal hace 5 años y le gusta por las facilidades para conseguir los créditos.
 
Sus metas son tener casa y taller propios.
texts.en:
On the street, San Eduardo via a Santa Ana, in the city of Portoviejo, known as Ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos ("The City of the Real Tamarinds") since colonial times, members of the Communal Bank, "16 de Julio," meet every 15 days.  

Señora Monica is 38 years old and has been divorced for quite some time.  From that relationship, she has a 9 year-old son and says that it was the best gift from God, regardless of the hardships of being able to provide him with a better quality of life.  He is currently in school, which comes with many additional costs.  She lives in her parents' house.  She learned to cut and tailor a while ago at the Virgen de Guadalupe Learning Center.

Seeing that she was a single mother, she decided to install a small sewing workshop, taking advantage of the opportunity her father gave her to have it in their house without paying rent.  She works every day from 8am, after dropping her son off at school, until noon, when she helps her son with his homework.  She then continues to sew into the night.  She says that it is a sacrifice but she loves her work and does it with love which is why she has many stable customers.   

This credit will be used towards the purchase of fabrics and sewing materials.  She has been a member of the Communal Bank for over 5 years and likes it for the ease at which she can obtain loans.  

Her goal is to have her own house and her own workshop.

loans.use: Purchase fabric, buttons, thread, closures, etc.

loans.name: Mayra Rafaela

texts.es: La señora Mayra Rafaela tiene 51 años. Su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Inicio con pocos productos pero ha sido con el paso del tiempo  que ha logrado mejorar su negocio, se levanta temprano desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche que regresa a su hogar pues ha demostrado ser una persona muy luchadora.  Este es su sexto crédito con Fundación que ha obtenido con mucho sacrificio, con este crédito comprar mercadería variada para sus clientes. Por lo que sueña con seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Mayra Rafaela is 51 years old. Her activity is the sale of general merchandising. She started with a few products but has improved her business with the passage of time. She wakes up early at 8 am until 9 pm when she comes back home since she has shown to be a hard working person. This is her 6th loan with Fundacion, and she has obtained it with a lot of sacrifice. With this loan she will purchase a variety of merchandise for her customers. She dreams of investing in her business to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Crispin Andia

texts.es: El Sr. Crispin Andia E. P. de 47 años de edad, vive junto a  esposa e hijos.Tiene casa propia la cual se encuentra ubicada el el distrito de Pachacutec. Se dedica a la labor de campo en una empresa de la zona. Su esposa trabaja como ayudante de cocina en la misma empresa. El Sr. crispin es una persona muy emprendedora que gracias a su esfuerzo a logrado construir parte de su vivienda. Requiere el crédito para terminar de construir dicha vivienda. El Sr. Crispin está muy agradecido por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a tráves de este financiamiento.
texts.en: El Sr. Crispin Andia E. P. is 47 years old, and lives with his wife and children. He has his own home which is located in the Pachacutec district. He is dedicated to field work in a local business. His wife works as a kitchen helper in the same business. Mr. Crispin is a very entrepreneurial person that thanks to his efforts has managed to build part of his home. He requests this credit to finish building this home. Mr. Crispin is very grateful for the support that we can provide him for this financing.

loans.use: Improvement of home

loans.name: Brígida Eufemia

texts.es:
En la calle San Eduardo vía a Santa Ana, de la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde épocas coloniales se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal “16 de Julio”.

La señora Brígida tiene 63 años de edad, esta casada y tiene cinco hijos ya todos mayores de edad, uno de sus hijos vive con ella, su esposo es jubilado. Ella es socia fundadora del Banco y le gusta por la ayuda que siempre ha recibido para su negocio y para el bienestar de su familia.

Es una ama de casa que se dedica a lo que mejor sabe que es la cocina, tiene un pequeño puesto de comida donde prepara además de platos fuertes comida rápida como empanadas, corviches, humitas y otros, trabaja de jueves a domingo desde las 16h00 hasta las 20h00, su esposo le ayuda en su trabajo.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar cerámica para arreglar el piso de su casa ya que tiene tiempo que quiere hacer esto y con este préstamo al fin lo va a poder hacer.
 
Su sueño es terminar su casa por completo.
texts.en:
In the street of San Eduardo via Santa Ana, in the city of Portoviejo, known as the city of the Royal Tamarinds since colonial times, the members of the Communal Bank "16th of July" meet every 15 days.

Ms. Brigida is 63 years old, married and has 5 children who are all grown up. One of her sons lives with her; her husband is retired. She is a founding partner of the Bank and likes it for the help she has always received for her business and for the welfare of her family.

She is a housewife who is dedicated to what she knows best, cooking, and she has a small food stand where she prepares entrees and fast food such as meat pies and other products made of corn. She works from Thursday to Sunday from 4pm to 8 pm, and her husband helps in her work.

This loan is for purchasing ceramic tile to fix the floor of her home; she has wanted this for a while and with this loan she will finally be able to do this. Her dream is to finish building her home completely.

loans.use: Purchase tiles for the floor

loans.name: Juana Mercedes

texts.es: La señora Juana Mercedes se dedica a  la venta de ropa usada. Hace más de 5 años que tiene este negocio, siempre ha sido una mujer muy luchadora y emprendedora y con la ayuda de los financiamientos ha salido adelante.  Sus clientes siempre le están solicitando diferentes productos es por eso que solicita este crédito con el fin de suplir la demanda con sus clientes como pantalones, camisas, faldas y trajes. Ella desea obtener buenas ganancias de este crédito y al mismo tiempo mejora la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Juana Mercedes has sold used clothes for over five years.  She has always been a very tenacious, enterprising woman who has managed to get ahead with help from the loans.

Her customers are always asking for different items so she is asking for funds to meet customer demand for pants, shirts, skirts and suits.

She hopes to earn good profits from the loan and at the same time improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Jessica Pamela

texts.es:
En la calle San Eduardo vía a Santa Ana, de la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde épocas coloniales se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal “16 de Julio”.

La señora Jessica tiene 32 años de edad y tiene de casada 16 años, de esta relación procreo tres hijos de 15, 10 y 8 años, el mayor esta en colegio y los otros dos en la escuela. Su esposo es bodeguero en una constructora.

Tiene un salón de belleza junto con su hermana donde comparten el trabajo y por supuesto las ganancias del negocio, realizan muchos trabajos desde tinturados hasta depilaciones, trabajan todos los días  desde las 9 hasta las 19h00 y los sábados hasta las 22h00.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar tintes, cremas y otros productos de belleza que utilizan y que además venden en el salón. Es socia del Banco hace 4 ciclos y está muy a gusto porque en cada reunión aprende mas y se divierte con sus amigas.

Sus sueños son ser una gran cosmetóloga y tener su SPA.
texts.en:
The members of the “16 de Julio” (July 16) communal bank meet every two weeks on San Eduardo Street towards Santa Ana in Portoviejo, known as the City of Royal Tamarinds since colonial times.

Jessica is 32 years old, married for 16 years and has three children who are 15, 10 and 8 years old.  The oldest is in high school and the other two are in school.  Her husband is a warehouseman at a construction company.

She has a beauty salon with her sister where they share work and, of course, profits from the business.  They do all kinds of jobs from hair coloring to hair removal.  They work every day from 9am until 7pm and on Saturdays until 10pm.

The loan will be used to buy hair dyes, creams and other beauty products that they use and sell at the salon.  She has been a member of the Bank for 4 cycles and is very pleased because she learns more at each meeting and she enjoys her fellow members’ company.

Her dream is to become a great cosmetologist and to have her spa.

loans.use: To buy hair dye, creams and beauty products.

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
La Señora. Martha G. es socia del banco comunal Eugenio Espejo, vive por el sector de Monay en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por ser la tercera ciudad más importante del país, es una ciudad única por su arquitectura, su gastronomía y su cultura
 
La Señora Martha tiene 38 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 23, 21, 12 y 10 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos son casados y viven independientemente, sus tercer hijo   estudia en el colegio y su ultima hija en una escuela de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como guardia de seguridad privado, con el trabajo y sacrificio conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

Doña Marta es enfermera y labora ejerciendo hace 5 años, trabaja en una casa privada en donde labora un día las 24 horas y descansa al día siguiente. En temporadas festivas se dedica a pintar cerámica y vende a sus familiares y conocidos. También elabora tortas bajo pedido.

Se encuentra en la banca comunal hace 3 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa para iniciar con un nuevo negocio.

Su meta es terminar  su casa.
texts.en:
Martha G. is a member of the Eugenio Espejo loan group. She lives in the Monay neighbourhood in the city of Cuenca, the third most important one in the country, renowned for its architecture, gastronomy and culture. 
 
Martha is 38 years old. She is married and has 4 children aged 23, 21, 12 and 10. The two eldest sons are married and live independently. Her third son is studying and her daughter goes to a school in the city. Her husband works as a security guard. Thanks to their hard work and sacrifice Martha and her husband have managed to build their own house. 

Marta is a nurse and she has been practising for 5 years. She works in a private house. She works one day for 24 hours and rests on the next. During the holidays she paints pottery and sells it to friends and family. She also makes pies on demand. 

She has been with the loan group for 3 years and she will invest the loan in the purchase of clothing to start a new business. 

Her goal is to finish her house.

loans.use: Buy trousers, blouses, shirts and clothing in general.

loans.name: Morenica Del Rocío

texts.es:
La Señora. Morenica T. es socia del banco comunal Eugenio Espejo, vive en la comunidad de Narancay Bajo a unos 10 minutos  de la ciudad de Cuenca, en donde su gente se dedica a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, muchos encuentran en la ciudad un trabajo en fábricas, construcción etc., también han migrado a varios lugares del mundo en busca de una mejor oportunidad de trabajo.

Nuestra socia tiene 35 años, es divorciada y tiene 3 hijos de 19, 17 y 9 años de edad, su primer hijo trabaja y estudia en la universidad, su segundo hijo está en el colegio y su ultimo hijo en la escuela, con su trabajo y sacrificio ha logrado construir su casa propia.

Doña Morenica trabaja hace 7 meses como niñera, labora de lunes a viernes sin un horario fijo. En su casa tiene un pequeño kiosco el mismo que atiende desde las cinco y media del día hasta las nueve de la noche, cuando se encuentra en el trabajo sus hijos le ayudan a la atención, los fines de semana se dedica a la preparación de comida rápida.

Este es el tercer crédito que realiza en la banca comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de gaseosas, cervezas, confitería etc. para su kiosco.
 
Su meta es terminar su casa.
texts.en:
Morenica is a member of the Eugenio Espejo communal bank and lives in the community of Narancay Bajo, some 10 minutes from the city of Cuenca. Here people practice agriculture and raise livestock.  Many are in the city now, working in factories, at construction, etc.  Or they have migrated to various places around the world in search of better opportunities for work.  Her 1st son works and also studies in the university; her 2nd son is still in school, and her last son is also in school.  With her work and sacrifice, Morenica has managed to build her own house.

Morenica has worked for the last 7 months as a nanny, working from Monday to Friday without a fixed schedule.  In her house she has a small kiosk that she attends from 5:30pm until 9:00 at night.  While she is at work, her children attend to customers.  On weekends, she prepares fast food.

This is her 3rd loan from her communal bank, and she will use it to buy soft drinks, beer, sweets, etc., for her kiosk.

Morenica's goal is to finish her house.

loans.use: BUYING SOFT DRINKS, BEER, CANDY, ETC, FOR HER KIOSK

loans.name: Suon

texts.en: Fishing is the most important part of 43-year-old Suon K.’s daily work. She and her husband wake up every morning, drive their boat toward the middle of the river, and then fish. After they have made their catch, they hurry to the local market and sell it to their regular buyers on credit. They collect their money after their buyers sell all of the fish that they have delivered. Suon K. and her husband also support their four children, all of whom are enrolled in school.  Recently, some of family’s fishing equipment has cracked, affecting their ability to fish effectively and frequently. Therefore, Suon K. has decided to seek a loan to buy new fishing equipment to replace the broken items.

loans.use: To buy new fishing equipment to replace broken items.

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.es:
La Señora. María Y. es socia del banco comunal Eugenio Espejo, vive en la comunidad de Narancay Bajo a unos 10 minutos de la ciudad de Cuenca, en donde su gente se dedica a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, muchos encuentran en la ciudad un trabajo en fábricas, construcción etc., también han migrado a varios lugares del mundo en busca de una mejor oportunidad de trabajo.
 
La Señora. María tiene 27 años,  es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 7 y 4 años de edad que están en la escuela, su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora conduciendo un taxi, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Doña María trabaja como empleada domestica hace un año y tres meses, labora desde las nueve de la mañana hasta las cinco de la tarde.

Este es el tercer crédito que realiza en la banca comunal y está contenta de formar parte de un gran grupo de mujeres luchadoras y emprendedoras.  Su crédito lo va  a invertir  en la salud de su hija ya que se encuentra con una infección intestinal y los remedios son caros.
 
Su meta es tener un negocio propio de venta de ropa.
texts.en:
Ms. María Y. is a member of the Eugenio Espejo communal bank.  She lives in the community of Narancay Bajo, some 10 minutes from the city of Cuenca, where most people work in agriculture or animal husbandry.  Many people also find work in factories, doing construction, etc. in the city.  Some have also migrated to various places around the world in search of better work opportunities.

Ms. María is 27 years old, married, and has two children who are 7 and 4 years old.  The children are in school and her husband is a taxi driver.  They do not own their own house so they rent.

Doña María has worked as a domestic employee for one year and three months.  She works from nine in the morning until five in the afternoon.

This is her third loan through the communal bank and she is happy to be part of a great group of hard-working and enterprising women.  Her loan will be used towards her daughter's health, as she is suffering from an intestinal infection and the medicines are expensive.

Her goal is to have her own business selling clothes.

loans.use: to buy medicine for her daughter, who is suffering from an intestinal infection

loans.name: Arancy

texts.en:
Arancy G. is a 38-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two businesses: the buying and selling of Nipa, a type of leaf which is used to make various items, and pig farming. She lives in Toril, Bocana, Ilog, Negros Occidental, has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2001 and has used her membership to improve her life by making careful use of various loans. By working hard and paying careful attention to her business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 6,000. To continue this improvement, Arancy is applying for a loan, her 11th, for PHP 24,000 to expand her businesses.  She aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the Dungganon (or honorable) way.  

About NWTF:  
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through its poverty alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To expand two small businesses

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy P. is a married woman who lives in Prk. Pateno, Brgy. Bocana, Ilog, Negros Occidental. She earns a living by working with her husband to sell fish. They have two children who are 2 and 7 years old. Daisy joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of nine loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, she has succeeded in lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. She now earns a monthly profit of PHP 7,000, and has applied for a new loan, her tenth, for PHP 15,000, to buy more fish to sell to her customers. Her long-term goal is to save enough money to buy a motorcycle. Daisy P. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell to her customers

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
As everyone knows, fish is the main essential fresh food for everybody, in particular for families who depend on fishing and fish-selling. Mrs. Em S. currently depends on selling fish at the local busy market. She sells fish that she either gets from her husband’s fishing or buys from her wholesale supplier. 

Mrs. Em S. is a humble mother who has been blessed with seven children. Mrs. Em S. faces difficulty with transporting her items to sell. Mrs. Em S. has been paying money for taxis because she doesn’t have her own vehicle. To decrease the cost of carrying her goods, she would like a $1,200 loan in order to buy a used motorbike for transport needs. Mrs. Em S. proposes to use the remainder of the loan to purchase fishing tools.

loans.use: To buy a used motorbike to transport her items to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda M. is a 48-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating three business ventures: Nipa (palm leaves), pig fattening and fish vending. She lives in Prk. Toril, Brgy. Bocana, Ilog, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2003 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her Nipa, pig-fattening and fish-vending businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). Erlinda is now borrowing PHP 23,000 so that she can use it as additional capital. This will be her 11th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 19,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Erlinda aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable") way. loans.name: Nay

texts.en:
The man shown in the picture is Mr. Nay M., 36, a fisherman. He usually needs to take eight hours a day to fish, in and around Tunle Sap River. He catches around 12 kilos of fish per day and sells them in bulk to his customers, who are retail sellers in the market. 

His wife’s name is Dan; she is 41 and works with him in the fishing trade. This couple has five children who are single. One of them earns about $1 a day as a fish currying worker. 

This family normally earns an average of $7 per day to help cover their family’s daily living needs. Currently, the fishing is temporarily interrupted because the fishing equipment is broken. That is why Mr. Nay M. requested a loan in order to buy additional fishing equipment.

loans.use: To buy additional fishing equipment

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie D. is a married woman who lives in Sentro 2, Brgy. Kabac, Bantayan, Cebu. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: pig fattening, buying and selling of charcoal, and buying and selling of beverages, rice, and eggs.  Her husband Pedro D., who is 51 years old, works as a Seaman to earn his living. They have three children whose ages range from 20 to 29 years old. 

Annie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2001 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 11 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Annie has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 29,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 20,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 12th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,500 which she intends to use as additional working capital so that she could continue to save up for the future by putting up a new business.  Annie is hoping to get into the fishing business, for which she needs to purchase fishing materials and a pump boat. Annie D. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

loans.name: Meas

texts.en: Mr. Meas N. is a 37-year-old, married man. He is the father of three children, all in school. This couple usually generates an income of $7 a day to manage their family and meet the hunger of their three children. Mr. Meas N. and his wife get up when the sky is still dark in order to prepare their tools to fish in and around the Tunle Sap River, which is the top place to catch fish. After they have finished fishing, they take the fish to sell at the local market. Because this is the main way for him to earn money, Mr. Meas N. is applying for a loan to purchase more fish to increase his stock.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Thean

texts.en: Thean N., 50, is a low-income person living in Siem Reap Province. She is a good and determined mother who tries to feed her five children, even though her husband is a soldier, and he normally visits home. She has one child who helps her with fishing, while the remainder stay in the family home. Thean N. travels with her child to the middle of the river where they always fish. After finish fishing, Thean N. hurries to bring the fish to retail at reasonable price in the market. She presently uses a boat that is getting old and needs repairs frequently. To solve this problem, Thean N. is requesting a loan of $400 to repair her old boat as well as buying more tools for fishing activities.

loans.use: To repair her old boat as well as buying more tools for fishing activities.

loans.name: Chub

texts.en:
Mr. Chub S., 30, is married with two school-aged children at home in their small house, and he earns his living from fishing. Mr. Chub S. always rises early to prepare their tools and go to the middle of the river by boat to fish. Then Mr. Chub S. sells to the wholesaler at a reasonable price.

To help with the responsiblity of the family, his wife sells grocery products in front of her house. She has been running a grocery business for a long time and earns an average of $4 a day. Recently, some of the grocery items have been sold out from her stock and Mr. Chub S. wants to encourage his wife's business. So Mr. Chub S. is taking out this loan to increase his wife's inventory to continue selling.

loans.use: Additional capital for her store

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita D. is a married woman who lives in Hda. Bungyod, Brgy. Matab-ang, Talisay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a general store and a ready-to-wear clothes business. Her husband Jimmy, who is 54 years old, works as a carpenter and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have eight children between nine and 23 years old. 

Angelita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Angelita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 5,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, thus raising the family's standard of living.  For her fifth cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000 to buy more inventory for her general store so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Angelita D. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon — a title of esteem bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.name: Faustina Eva

texts.es:
La Sra. Faustina Eva C. G. es comerciante del mercado la estación con 22 años de experiencia en el negocio, lo inicia con frutas y verdura ambulante  actualmente vende ropa en un puesto fijo.

Este crédito lo utilizo para incrementar su inventario con mercadería de mejor calidad para así obtener mayores ingresos, y  lograr a mantener su hogar ya que es madre  soltera con un hijo a su cargo.  

La Sra. C. G.  está muy agradecida con ceprodel por que le ha ayudado que su negocio crezca  con otros productos además de la venta de ropa está iniciando una pulpería en su casa.
texts.en:
Faustina Eva C. Garcia is a merchant of La Estacion (The Station) market with 22 years of experience in the business.  She started as an ambulant merchant with fruits and vegetables and currently sells clothes at a permanent location.

She used this loan to increase her inventory with better merchandise and this way increase her earnings, also to sustain her household since she is a single mother with a child under her care.

Ms. C. Garcia is very appreciative of Ceprodel because they have helped grow her business with other products.  Aside from selling clothes she is starting a grocery store at home.

loans.name: Zuura

texts.en:
Zuura T. is 57, married and has two children. Zuura was born in Tadjikistan, in a large family where all children helped their parents farm. At the age of 21, she got married and moved to her husband’s place.
 
In 1993, in order to find better life for their children, Zuura and her husband moved to the Kara-Dobo village in Kyrgyzstan. They began to engage in cattle breeding and managed to multiply their cattle to two cows and two calves. However, there wasn’t an appropriate infrastructure in the Kara-Dobo village and Zuura’s family relocated to the town of Kara-Balta. Here, Zuura became the main holder of her small farm, which today needs to be developed. As a result, Zuura is applying for a loan of 20,000 KGS to buy one milk cow and sheep. With the revenues from this investment, she plans to broaden her business by purchasing more cattle for fattening. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that aim to increase employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase one milk cow and sheep

loans.name: Bayanbat

texts.en: Bayanbat N. is 32 years old and lives with his wife and two young sons in the Uvs province of Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent. His wife stays at home taking care of their two sons. Bayanbat operates a shoe sewing business. He began his own business in 2003 with help of his mother and since 2008, he has been operating his shoe making business by himself. Over the years, he has managed to build a stable operation and his earnings have enabled him to improve his family's standard of living. He has used his earnings to purchase new furniture and electronic products for his home. In the future, he hopes to expand his business. He is requesting a 300,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more materials such as leather, fabric, heels and glue for his shoe sewing business.

loans.use: Purchase more materials for shoe sewing business

loans.name: Hoàng

texts.en:
M. Hoàng Thị (20209010007) is a 40 year-old female living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  She is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To make a living, M. owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store.  The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community.  M. has been engaged in this business for over 18 years and earns approximately 3.000.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2008, M. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  M. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6.048.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.  M. is now requesting a new loan of 8.288.000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  The loan will be the 4th loan taken out by her from SEDA.  M. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

----------------------------------

M. Hoàng Thị (20209010007) là 40 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học.  Để kiếm sống, M. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán các loại sản phẩm khác nhau trong cộng đồng địa phương.  M. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 18 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, M. kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2008, M. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  M. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  M. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện điều kiện sống chung của gia đình người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

H. Vũ Thị (20209010011) là 35 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học.  Để kiếm sống, H. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm từ gạo trong cộng đồng địa phương.  H. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, H. kiếm được khoảng 3.200.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2008, H. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  H. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các vật dụng mới để mở rộng việc giới thiệu sản phẩm.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  H. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Lê

texts.en:
T. Lê Thị (20209010006), a 53-year-old female living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh, is married and has four grown children. To making a living, T. owns and operates a business venture selling rice products in the local community. Engaged in this business for over 12 years, she earns approximately 3.500.000 VND a month.

In 2008, T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 6.048.000 VND from SEDA that was used to purchase additional products to sell, she is now requesting a new loan of 8.288.000 VND to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be T.'s fourth loan from SEDA, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. T. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 12 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, T. kiếm được khoảng 3.500.000 VND một tháng. Vào 2008, T. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. T. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND. Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua các thành phần thô cần thiết để chế tạo sản phẩm để bán. Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Rosario's Group

texts.en:
Rosario R. is from the village of Sepac, Sapang Dalaga. She is 49 years old. Rosario is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Rosario is married and has 8 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosario owns & operates a business venture in the food sector running a grocery store. Rosario has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Rosario joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosario has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,500 PHP from PMPC. Rosario is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Rosario from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for grocery business

loans.name: Ramira's Group

texts.en:
Ramira J. is from the village of Salimpuno, Sapang Dalaga. She is 49 years old. Ramira is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Ramira is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Ramira owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector particularly in planting assorted crops to sell. Ramira has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Ramira joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ramira has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for the business. Ramira is requesting a new loan of 14900 PHP which will be used for corn production. This loan will be the 10th loan taken out by Ramira from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of the her children. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for corn production

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph Mbodo is a 70 year old married man. He was introduced to KADET LIMITED by a Credit Officer and this is his 1st loan with the company. Joseph owns a farm in the Lamu area of Nairobi.
The farm business which he operates has been in place for the past 34 years now. Joseph plans to use his loan of Kshs 20,000 to buy more goats to grow his business.
His customers are mainly residence of Nairobi area where the farm is situated. Joseph hopes to use the anticipated profit that will come from the sales to grow his business into large scale farming and later venture into mixed farming.

loans.use: Buy more goats to sell for a profit

loans.name: Nelly  Ndunge

texts.en:
Nelly Ndunge is a 41 year old single mother of one child, Winnie Mwendwa, who is 15 year old and in secondary school. Nelly runs a salon in Umoja estate, just few kilometers from Nairobi city centre. Umoja is a very busy place and most of her clients are her neighbors. She has been in this business for three years and earns KES10,000 as income every month. She also sells cereals, as another source of income.

Nelly has never borrowed from any other MFI, and she was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend. She is now applying for second loan of KES30,000 to buy a hair drier worth KES20,000 and chemicals for her salon worth KES10,000. The profit generated from the expanded business will be used to further develop her business.

In the future, Ndunge hopes to educate her daughter and to be able to provide the necessary basic needs for her family.

loans.use: To buy a hair drier worth KES20,000 and chemicals for salon worth KES10,000

loans.name: Oyun

texts.en:
Mrs. Oyun D. is 49 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Oyun and her husband, Lkhasuren, have been running a furniture-making business since 1998. They have managed to send the elder daughter to Korea to study. Their son is a sculpture who works on a freelance basis and also helps with the parents’ business. The younger daughter studies at the local University of Agriculture.

Oyun and her husband buy materials such as plywood, HDF board, glue and fabric from local wholesalers and make different household furniture for apartments and gers (a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent). They sell them at Narantuul and Denjiin myanga, the two biggest outdoor markets in Ulaanbaatar.

Since Oyun and her husband started their business, they managed to buy a family house with a plot of land. Currently they are doing some renovation to the house. The loan they are requesting will be used to renovate the house and to increase their working capital and inventory.

loans.use: To renovate their house and increase their working capital and inventory

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter N. is a 44 year old man who is married. He and his wife have four children. Peter has a carpentry business which he has been operating for the past 14 years now. His workshop is situated in Mpeketoni, Lamu.  Most of his clients come from the area where he operates the business.

This is the fourth time Peter is taking a loan from KADET LIMITED after being introduced to the company by another client of the company. The loan amounts to KES 35,000 and Peter plans to use some of the funds to add more working tools to his workshop, to strengthen the business. The other portion of the loan is to be used to market the business. Peter wishes to use the anticipated profit from the business to continue educating his children and to help out in looking after his family as well. He hopes that one day his business will grow big enough to enable him to engage in the export industry.

loans.use: To add more working tools to the workshop, and to market the business.

loans.name: Concepcion's Group

texts.en:
Concepcion D. is 61 years old, married and has two adult-aged children. She is from the village of Sapang Ama within the municipality of Sapang Dalaga, part of Misamis Occidental on the Mindanao islands. Concepcion is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Concepcion works in the art sector, particularly in nipa (native roof) weaving. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2006 Concepcion joined PMPC to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000 PHP from PMPC that was used for personal purposes. Concepcion is requesting a new loan, her fourth from PMPC, of 7000 PHP that will be used for house repairs. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair her house

location.town: Sapang Ama Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a 48 year old married man. He has one wife and four children. The gentleman got introduced to KADET LIMITED by a credit officer of the company. 

Currently, Moses operates a retail shop whereby he is the sole proprietor of the business. The shop is five years old and is situated in Maweni Malindi town and the main customers are mostly Malindi town dwellers. This is the third time that Moses is being served with a loan from KADET LIMITED. This loan is for KES80,000. He plans to use a big portion of the loan to add stock to his business and the rest of the loan to repair his place of work.

Moses wishes to use the anticipated profit coming from the business to educate his children and continue looking after his family. He also dreams that one day he may get to expand his business and perhaps own a supermarket.

loans.use: To add more stock to the business and to repair his place of work.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen M. is a married woman who lives in Tapon, Barangay Sillon, Bantayan, Cebu. She earns her living by operating 3 business ventures: dried fish, a general store and fish vending. Her husband, Ramon M., who is 63 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have 10 children who are 23 to 39 years old. 

Carmen joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 16 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Carmen has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 17th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,000 which she intends to use to purchase additional stock so that she can continue to save up for the future of her children's education and for her family's needs. Carmen M. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase additional stock.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Vigae Group

texts.en:
Balagashi A. is in his late thirties, divorced and has one child. During the week, he walks door-to-door offering manicure and pedicure services. During the weekend, he works at a beauty salon. Balagashi has been working in this for the past four years, and works daily between 10:00 a.m. and 6:00 p.m. The business earns Balagashi a good monthly profit.

This will be Balagashi's second loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. His previous loan was used to increase the stock needed for his business, a loan which he has successfully repaid. Balagashi aims to use a second loan to buy more materials such as towels and artificial nails. He also wishes to expand his business by starting to sell bed sheets. Balagashi's aim is to one day earn enough profit to build a house for himself.

Balagashi will share this loan with his loan group Vigae, which totals fifteen members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans.

In the picture, Balagashi is seen wearing black, second from right.

loans.use: To increase his stock and to start selling bed sheets

loans.name: Eloglan

texts.ru:
Eloglan A. 39 let. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey, sin kotormu 10 let on uchitsya v shkole, i doch kotoroy 8 let ona uchitsya v shkole. Eloglan yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli region vmeste so svoyey semyoy.

Eto uje vtoroy ssud Eloglana,  koqda on bral perviy loan on pomenyal svoy bizness, no uje proyda vremya on opat reshil zanatsya skotovodstvom potomu chto on tak lubit svoyu rabotu chto uje ne smoq bez neyo. Eloglan etomu bizneesu skotovodstva nauchilsya u svoyeqo otca. Seychas Eloglan nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupi korovi.
texts.en:
Eloglan A. is 39 years old. He is married and has two children: a 10-year old son who attends school and an 8-year old daughter who is also in school. Eloglan is an Internally Displaced Person. He is a refugee from [the town of] Fuzuli. Now he lives in Fuzuli region with his family.

This is already Eloglan second loan. After taking out his first loan,  he had changed his line of business but after some time he decided to return to raising cattle again because he enjoys this work and cannot abandon it. He learned this trade from his father. At present he needs 2000 AZN in order to buy a cow.

loans.use: Purchasing a cow

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios M. is a single woman who lives in Purok RD, Barangay Su-ay, Himamaylan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures:  a general store and an electronic load business. Remedios joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1996 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Remedios has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 29,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 13,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 13th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,500 which she intends to use to buy more stocks for her general store so that she can continue to save up for the future expansion of her business and home repairs. 

Remedios M. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Carlita

texts.en:
Carlita V., age 41, is from the village of Mandih. Carlita and her husband have three school-aged children. To make a living, Carlita makes and sells food. She sells dried goods in the local community. Carlita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Carlita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services. She wanted to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Carlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Carlita is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Carlita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Blezel

texts.en:
Blezel D., age 47, is from the village of Siari. Blezel is widowed and has four children. To make a living, Blezelowns and operates a specialized retail store. Primarily, she sells seafood products, including fish and shrimp in the local community. Blezel has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

Blezel joined PMPC this year to gain access to financial services. She hoped to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Blezel is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new equipment and tools to expand the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Blezel from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment & tools to expand the business

loans.name: Mapinduzi Group

texts.en:
Happiness C. is in her mid-thirties and is married with four children. She has run a tailoring business since 1997. The business is open between 10 a.m. and 6 p.m. and earns her a good monthly profit.

This will be Happiness's tenth loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. Her previous loans were used to change her business location and to buy cloth and lining, loans which she have successfully repaid. Happiness aims to use this loan to increase her stock of Vitaba (cloth), zippers, and other tailoring material. Happiness's dream is to one day earn enough profit to improve the premises of her business. 

Happiness will share the loan with her loan group, Mapinduzi, which totals 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans. 

In the picture, Happiness is seen wearing green, sitting to the far right.

loans.use: Increasing stock of cloths, zippers and other tailor materials.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel E., age 57, is from the village of Bago. Rachel and her husband have two school-aged children. To make a living, Rachel makes and sells baked goods in the local community. Rachel has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Rachel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services. She wished to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Rachel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Rachel is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make her baked goods. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Rachel from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

texts.en:
Marcelina A., age 60, is from the village of Mandih. Marcelina and her husband have four children. To make a living, Marcelina raises pigs for sale. Marcelina has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month.

Marcelina joined PMPC this year to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Marcelina is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marcelina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

loans.name: Sam-At

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam-at K. and her husband, Mr. Sophai Orn, have been married since 1975 and have five daughters. Two of their daughters are married and live outside the family home, another two are silk weavers and another one attends school. They are living on an island in the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Sam-at sells the fish that her husband caught in the village; her husband is a fisherman. 

She asked for a Kiva loan two times already. She now is asking for another loan of $600 to provide capital for her daughters to continue her business by buying additional silk fabrics for resale. 

Photo: Sam-at is in nice dressing as she prepared to go to pagoda on Pchum Ben day. Pchum Ben is a Khmer festival during which food is offered to Buddhist monks in the hope that such a deed will benefit the spirits of dead relatives.

loans.use: To provide capital for her daughters to continue her business by purchasing additional silk fabrics for resale

loans.name: Laisim

texts.en:
Mrs. Laisim Y. (in the photo) is 59 years old, and her husband, Mr Sim Len, is 58 years old, have been married since 1977 and have five children - three sons and two daughters. Three of them are married and live outside the family home and two assist their mother in her weaving business. They live on an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. The couple is older, but they are still strong enough to work.

Mrs. Laisim Y. has been a silk weaver since she was 17 years old. She sells her finished products to a middleman who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband is a motor taxi driver. She is requesting a loan of US$1,100 to purchase silk materials for her and her daughter’s weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her and her daughter’s weaving business.

In 2008, Estrella joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC that was used as additional capital for her business, Estrella is now requesting her sixth loan of 4,000 PHP to invest in hog raising.

loans.name: Utamaduni Group

texts.en:
Rehani S. is in his late twenties and is unmarried. He has been running a phone accessory shop for the past two years, where he sells chargers, phone covers and batteries. Rehani's shop is open between 6 am and 10 pm daily, and earns Rehani a good monthly profit.

This will be Rehani's third loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. Rehani used the previous loans to improve his store facilities, as well as increasing his stock of spare parts, protective cases, batteries and chargers. Both loans have been successfully repaid. Rehani aims to use this loan to stock up on products and thereby increase sales and the business. Rehani's dream is to be a successful business man one day. 

Rehani will share this loan with his loan group, Utamaduni, which totals 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans.

In the picture, Rehani is seen in the back row, third from left, wearing white and green.

loans.use: To increase his stock of products.

To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the arts sector and is particularly involved in tailoring and embroidery activities. Ursulina has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $50 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ursulina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business.
