loans.name: Uvumilivu Group

texts.en:
Judith G. is in her late twenties and is married with two children, aged seven and three. Judith has been operating her own hair and beauty salon for the past three years. The salon is open between 7:30 am and 9 pm daily and earns Judith a good monthly profit. 

This will be Judith's 3rd Motisha loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. A Mothisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. 

Judith used her previous loans to expand her salon, loans which she has successfully repaid. She will use the new loan to buy another steaming machine and another dryer. Judith's dream is to expand her business to also include a large CD and DVD library. 

Judith will share this loan with her loan group, Uvumilivu, which totals 16 members. The members of the group will hold each other responsible for paying back the loans. 

In the picture, Judith is seen in the front row, second from right.

loans.use: To buy a steam machine and a dryer

loans.name: Amos Kioi

texts.en:
Amos Kioi N. is a 34-year-old single man, who has been in the business of operating general stores from which he distributes a variety of shop items to small scale retailers at a wholesale price. His general store (warehouse) is based at Kangemi, just few kilometers from Nairobi City center. Most of his customers own retail shops in the Kangemi shopping center. He has been in this business for twelve years with a very good and stable income. The other source of income for the family is building and construction.  

N. was introduced to KADET LTD by a Credit Officer and he has no history with any other MFI. He is applying for his first loan of 20,000 KES with KADET LTD and he intends to add more stock of goods to the general stores, so that he will have enough items to supply to his clients. He plans to use the profit gained to establish stable general stores.

He is very ambitious to own a supermarket in the future.

loans.use: Add more stock of goods to the general stores

To make a living, she sells bananas. Consolacion has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately $150 a month for these activities.

loans.name: Dondovdorj

texts.en:
Mr. Dondovdorj, 29, is married and has one daughter, age 14. The daughter attends a local secondary school. They live in their own small wooden house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They are planning to renovate their home next summer. 

In 2001 Dondovdorj graduated from an Art College as a craftsman which specialized in traditional Mongolian blacksmithing. Between 2001 and 2003 he worked in an art factory, which provided him with good experience. In 2003 he decided to open his own art workshop and since then his business has been doing quite well. 

His wife, Otgojargal, is a craftsman as well and they run the business together. Dondovdorj was telling us that his business was struggling when they first started, but now they have their own customers from whom they receive enough orders. They make things by customer order and design in a single copy. Therefore customers always remain satisfied and happy. 

At the moment their product size is limited by the size of their oven, which they use for casting and melting the metal. Therefore, they want to use the loan to buy an oven for metalwork with a bigger capacity and capability.

loans.use: to buy an oven for metalwork with a bigger capacity and capability

Virgilia has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately $350 a month for these activities.

loans.name: Fagana

texts.ru:
Fagana H. 35 let. Ona zamujem i imeyet 2 detey, doch kotoroy 7 let ona uchitsya v shkole i doch 5 let kotoraya xodit v detskiy sadik. Fagana yavlyayetsya IDP personom ,ona pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. 

Uje 7 let kak Fagana zanimayetsya skotovodstvom, Etomu biznessu ona nauchilas u svoyey mami. U sebya doma ona prodayet sir, moloko, yogurt i t.d. Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi.
texts.en:
Fagana H. is 35 years old. She is married and has two children, a 7-year old daughter who goes to school and a 5-year old daughter who goes to kindergarten. Fagana is an Internally Displaced Person. She is a refugee from the town of Fuzuli now living in the Fuzuli Region with her family. 

She has been raising cattle for seven year salready. She learned this trade from her mother. She sells cheese, milk, yogurt etc out of her house. At present she needs 2000 AZN in order to buy a cow.

loans.use: Purchasing a cow

loans.name: Lê Đắc's Group

texts.en:
Lê Đắc C.  (20209010014) is a 39-year-old man living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  C. is the group leader for a 3-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Thôn Đông nhóm 03 (Nhóm 03).


C. is married and has 3 school-aged children.  To make a living, C. works in a manufacturing business.  The main source of income for the business comes from manufacturing and selling products to local businesses and community members.  C. has been engaged in this business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3.100.000 VND a month for his work. 


In 2008, C. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities.  C. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6.048.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to invest in renovating the business.  He is now requesting a new loan of 5.152.000 VND which will be used to further renovate the business.  This will be his 3rd loan borrowed from SEDA.  C. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Nguyễn Thị Hà C. (0) is a 28 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a manufacturing business.


2.  Lê Thị Mỹ Lệ (0) is a 23 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector operating a service-based business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


C. Lê Đắc  (20209010014) là 39 tuổi nam.  Anh ấy sống ở tH.nh phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  C. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các tH.nh viên.  Mặc dù mỗi tH.nh viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các tH.nh viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Thôn Đông nhóm 03 (Nhóm 03).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  C. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 6 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, C. kiếm được khoảng 3.100.000 VND.  Vào 2008, C. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  điều kiện và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  C. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 6.048.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư đổi mới công việc kinh doanh.  Anh ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Nguyễn Thị Hà C. (0) là 28 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận H.nh công việc kinh doanh sản xuất.


2.  Lê Thị Mỹ Lệ (0) là 23 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận H.nh công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm C. phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To invest in renovating the business

loans.name: Hoàng

texts.en:
H. Hoàng Thị (20209010013) is a 34-year-old female living in the town of Huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  She is married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, H. owns & operates a business raising chickens for sale.  H. has been engaged in this business for over seven years and earns approximately 3,600,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2008, H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  H. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,048,000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. H. is now requesting a new loan of 8,288,000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be the fourth loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


H. Hoàng Thị (20209010013) là 34 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học.  Để kiếm sống, H. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gà để bán.  H. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 7 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, H. kiếm được khoảng 3.600.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2008, H. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  H. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua thức ăn gia súc & các loại cung cấp khác.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  H. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện điều kiện sống chung của gia đình người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Lê's Group

texts.en:
N. Lê Thị (20209010008), a 47-year-old female living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh, is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Cụm Đông 1 - nhóm 01 (Nhóm 01).

N., who is married and has three school-aged children, owns and operates a service-based business providing general services to local community members. Engaged in this business for over one year, she earns approximately 3.000.000 VND a month.

In 2008, N. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 6.048.000 VND from SEDA that was used to purchase equipment to improve the business, she is now requesting a new loan of 6.944.000 VND to invest in expanding the business. The will be Nhan's fourth loan from SEDA, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1. Đỗ V. T. (0) is a 33-year-old male who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support his business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

2. Lê Thị Y. (0) is a 23-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.

3. Nguyễn Thị C. (0) is a 24-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture making business.

About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

N. Lê Thị (20209010008) là 47 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.. N. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Cụm Đông 1 - nhóm 01 (Nhóm 01). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ nói chung cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương. N. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 1 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, N. kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND. Vào 2008, N. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. N. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 6.048.000 VND từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua thiết bị để cải thiện công việc kinh doanh. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.944.000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Đỗ V. T. (0) là 33 tuổi nam. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 2. Lê Thị Y. (0) là 23 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa. 3. Nguyễn Thị C. (0) là 24 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được T. báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục T. báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp T. tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. .

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Lê

texts.en:
Dị Lê D. (20209010009) is a 51-year-old man living in the town of Huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. He is married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, Dị owns & operates a business raising cattle for sale.  Dị has been engaged in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 3,300,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2008, Dị joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Dị has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,048,000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future.  Dị is now requesting a new loan of 8,288,000 VND, which will be used to purchase breeding livestock.  The loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Dị from SEDA.  Dị plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Để kiếm sống, Dị Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán.  Dị thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 8 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Dị kiếm được khoảng 3.300.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2008, Dị đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các D.ch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Dị đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua con giống.  Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
"Charles V. is a 61-year old married woman who supports her family by operating a business venture, buying and selling peanuts (salted and Sugar coated).  She lives in Vista Alegre , Tap-ok, Brgy. Enclaro, Binalbagan, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1992 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard buying and selling peanuts (salted and Sugar coated), she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 10,000. 

Charles is now borrowing PHP 20,000 so that she could  purchase a transport vehicle . This will be her 20th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 20,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Charles aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: 
 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.
"

loans.use: Purchase transport vehicle

loans.name: Erdenechimeg

texts.en:
Erdenechimeg D. is a 46 years old widow who lives with her son in the Hentiy province of Mongolia. She and her son live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent in a rented yard. Her son currently works and lives in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia's capital city. Erdenechimeg operates a business where she sews traditional Mongolian clothes such as deels, or long coats in her home. She began her business in 2004 and has since then has built a stable operation. She sews a wide variety of deels which can be worn throughout the year according to her customers' specifications. She charges between 80,000 and 120,000 MNT including material cost and 35,000-50,000 MNT without material cost. Her monthly revenue is 600,000 MNT. She produces all her clothes with nice quality therefore, she always has a high demand for her clothes. 

Erdenechimeg is a very honest, helpful and hardworking woman and is requesting a 600,000 MNT loan so that she can purchase more fabric and materials for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more fabric and materials

loans.name: Sharon Juliah

texts.en:
Sharon Juliah K. is 24 years old, separated and has one child age, age six, who is in grade two. She runs a salon in Karionbangi's open air market (stall number 600) and most of her customers are youths and Ladies, and  she also plaits for pupils at Joy Academy School on a monthly basis. Her monthly income has risen to Kshs.12, 000 in  the three years that she is been operating the business.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a Credit Officer and she has never borrowed from any other MFI.Juliah is applying for her first loan of Kshs.15,000  from KADET LTD and she intends to buy a blow dryer worth Kshs.5,000 and  beauty products worth  Kshs.10,000 for the salon work to progress well.

Sharon hopes to save some of the income earned to open a beauty shop and a school, as this will help her to serve her customers who are increasing in great numbers due to the satisfactory services she offers, hence be able to provide the basic needs to the family.

loans.use: Buying a blow dryer worth Kshs.5,000 and beauty products worth Kshs.10,000

loans.name: Hishigjargal

texts.en:
Hishigjargal R. is 39 year old and  lives with her husband and one daughter in the Hentiy province of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Her husband works as a chairman at the Judicial Decision Execution Agency of the local province. Her daughter attends a local elementary school. She operates a second hand clothes trading business in her town. She started her business in 2010 by renting a small stall in the local market to sell a variety of used clothing that have been imported from Korea.  At first, the working capital was 500, 000 MNT and soon grew to over 1 ,500 ,000 MNT. Within a short time, her business has reached at sustainable level and she was able to improve greatly her family's standard of living. Her earnings have enabled her to buy a new car for her family. Today, she focuses on her dream of owning her own house in the future. 

She is requesting a  2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a variety of products in order to increase her product line for her growing store.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of products

loans.name: Marusya

texts.en:
Marusya S. is a widow who lives with her two sons in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. She and her two sons live together in their own ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent. Her both two sons are carpenters while Marusya operates a food trading business next to her home. She opened her small grocery shop after building small kiosk in her yard. Soon her children started operating a wooden products making  business by producing a variety of wood items in the rented yard. Her children' business was  successful enough to buy new land and a fence where they  run their wood production today.  The price for main raw material of wood production, that is timber, has risen by 2 1/2 - 3 times from the previous price therefore, they need more funds in order to increase their working capital. Marusya is a very active and kind woman and she hopes to expand her family businesses and she dreams of having her own apartment as well as a big grocery store in the future. 

She is requesting  a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more food stuffs at 200,000 MNT for her small grocery kiosk and also to purchase more timber at wholesale price of 1,300,000 MNT for her children's wood producing business.

loans.use: To purchase more timber

loans.name: Augustine B.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is pleased to present to you teachers of the St. Joseph Vocational Institute, Magburaka. This institute was established in 1985 by the Roman Catholics to improve the education of girl children in Magburaka and its surroundings. 

Augustine B. M. who is pictured on the left is the leader of this group. Augustine was born in Kamabai village. He is fifty-two years old, married with six children – three in secondary school and three in primary school.  Augustine has been in the teaching profession for eight years now. Augustine will use part of his share of the loan to pay school fees and other school charges for his children. He will invest the rest of the loan in agriculture.

loans.use: pay school fees and invest the rest in agriculture

loans.name: Islom

texts.en:
N. Islom is 48 years old. He’s married with seven children. Islom is a farmer. He grows various crops, such as potatoes, carrots and wheat. His sons help him with the business. 

Islom has been working in that business for more than seven years and has gained rich experience. Now Islom requests $3,000 US Dollars to purchase input materials, including seeds and mineral fertilizer for growing his crops. 

After gathering his harvest, he wants to sell to the local inhabitants at lower prices than in the market. Islom promises to repay the loan properly and thanks everyone for support.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients can run their businesses successfully. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Nurulo

texts.en:
T. Nurulo is a hard-working, 50-year-old man who has considerably improved his economic situation due to growing potatoes, onions and other vegetables. He feels happy to have the privilege of being a father to eight children. 

Nurulo grows a variety of different native vegetables and sells them at the market. He is saving money in order to become a taxi driver in the future, when his efforts in the field no longer are fruitful. In order to have a successful harvest, Nurulo is asking for a loan of $1,500 USD to buy sacks of seeds and organic fertilizer for his crop.

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi.
