loans.name: Fe En Dios 4, 5 & 6 Group

texts.es:
Georgina es una de los miembro del Grupo Fe en Dios 4, 5, y 6, compuesto por 13 mujeres y dos hombres microempresarios dedicados a las ventas de ropa, productos naturales, zapatos, joyerias, etc. Su familia está compuesta por ella, su pareja y tres hijos, de los cuales aun dos viven con ellos. Nos dice que su actividad favoritas es comer, por lo que disfruta cada horario de comida. 

Georgina está muy emocionada de recibir su Segundo préstamo en Esperanza Internacional, después de haber pagado satisfactoriamente su préstamo anterior y haber dado un paso para el crecimiento de su negocio.  Ella ha tenido su negocio por alrededor de 15 años, el cual inició vendiendo prendas de Oro. Georgina está planificando invertir su nuevo préstamo en la compra de 15 unidades de perfumes y Diez pares de zapatos. Ella va a utilizar sus ganancias para construir un habitacion en su vivienda, y aportar a los ingresos de la familia. Su sueño es poder viajar por varios paises, y poder comprar mercancias en el exterior, ve su sueño muy facil de cumplir si se dedica y continua desarrollando su negocio a traves de los prestamos.

Está asociada de Esperanza adqurio un prestamo con nosotros porque tenía el deseo de superarse y seguir inyectando capital a su negocio. Su historia está siendo usada para representar a los demás miembros de su grupo y a los clientes de Esperanza, tanto los haitianos (quienes en su mayoría ha emigrado hacia la Republica Dominicana desde Haití, algunos de ellos recientemente) y los dominicanos, quienes por lo general viven en comunidades muy pobres, esta zona, como muchas otras zonas de escasos recursos en la Republica Dominicana, carecen de agua potable y energía eléctrica constante. Este grupo se encuentra ubicado en una zona de pocos recursos de Samana, una ciudad turistica en desarrollo, bordeada por las costas del Oceano atlantico, con hermosas playas y rica en recursos naturales.
texts.en:
Georgina is one of the members of the Grupo Fe en Dios 4, 5, & 6 [Faith in God 4, 5 & 6 Group] composed of 13 women and two men, owners of microenterprises in the areas of clothing sales, natural product sales, shoe and jewelry sales, etc. Her family is made up of her, her partner and three children of whom two still live with them. She tells us her favorite activity is eating, so she enjoys every mealtime. 

Georgina is very excited to receive her Second loan with Esperanza Internacional, after having satisfactorily paid off her previous loan and taken another step for the growth of her business. She has had her business for around 15 years and began by selling pieces of gold jewelry. Georgina is planning to invest her new loan in the purchase of 15 units of perfume and ten pairs of shoes. She is going to use her earnings to build a new room in her living quarters and to contribute to the household income. Her dream is to be able to travel to various countries and buy merchandise abroad. She sees her dream as very easy to fulfill if she is dedicated and continues developing her business through the loans. 

This associate of Esperanza obtained a loan with us because she had the desire to do better and continue injecting capital into her business. Her story is being used to represent the other members of the group and the clients of Esperanza, both Haitians (who for the most part have emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haití, some of them recently) and the Dominicans, who in general live in very poor communities. This area, like many other areas of scarce resources in the Dominican Republic, is lacK. in safe drinK. water and dependable electrical service. This group is located in the low-resource area of Samana, a developing tourist destination bordered by the coast of the Atlantic Ocean with beautiful beaches and rich in natural resources.

loans.use: To purchase perfumes and shoes

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es: Genoveva, de 42 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Por las mañana trabaja en un Wawa Wasi (programa del gobierno cuya función es cuidar niños, mientras sus madres solteras en su mayoría trabajan); asimismo por las tardes se dedica a la venta de ropa. Este último negocio lo realiza mediante pedidos, en un inicio empezó con algunas prendas pero ahora su negocio se ha establecido, por lo que siempre tiene mucha demanda por parte de sus clientes o amistades que viven cerca de su casa. Lo que más le gusta de su negocio en conversar con sus clientes, sin embargo debe tener cuidado con las prendas que tienen y más las que son de color claro, ya que sus clientes son muy observadores al momento de comprar el producto. Por tal motivo desea comprarse unas vitrinas, para exhibir los productos que tiene además que los tendrá en buen estado. Este es su 15avo crédito con MFP, por lo que asegura que este crédito será muy beneficioso en el desarrollo de su actividad. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará más ropas para incrementar su stock de ropa.
texts.en:
Genoveva, 42, is a very hard-working, married mother who lives in her own home along with her husband and their two children. In the mornings she works in a Wawa Wasi (a government program whose function is to care for children while their mothers, most of them single, are at work). Likewise in the afternoons she works selling clothing. This latter business is by special order. 

In the beginning she began with a few articles of clothing but now her business has become established so there is always a lot of demand from her customers or friends who live near her. She enjoys speaking with her customers the most. However, she has to take a lot of precautions with the clothing and especially with lighter-colored garments since her customers are sharp-eyed at the moment of purchasing the product. Thus she wishes to purchase some display cases in order to show off the products she has and also to keep them in good condition. 

This is her 15th loan with MFP and she states that the loan will be highly beneficial in the development of her business. With the current loan she plans to purchase more clothing to increase her stock.

loans.use: To increase her stock in clothing

loans.name: Keyla Sofía

texts.en:
Keyla is a 32-year-old single mother who lives with her two children in Alajuela, located near the central valley of Costa Rica. Keyla has a business selling various stationary items including ink cartridges, blank CD´s, DVD´s, and other computer hardware/software/office supplies. Additionally, she offers cell phone top-up and photocopying services. Keyla plans to use this loan to invest in ink cartridges in order to fill her store with more inventory items in an effort to attract more customers. 

Being a single mother and business owner, Keyla must be organized. Her days are jam packed, as she operates within the constraints of a tight schedule. Keyla wakes up at 5:30 AM in order to prepare breakfast for her children, get them ready for school, and carry out domestic tasks. She brings her children to school around 7:00 AM, then between 7 and 8 Keyla does her exercises in order to be able to open the store by 8:30 AM. At mid day, she closes her store to eat lunch; she re-opens the store at 1:30 PM and works until 6:00 PM. At this time, she helps her children with their school work and prepares dinner. She usually goes to bed by 9:30 PM.

In terms of goals and aspirations, Keyla has many. The idea is to expand her business and increase income so that she can continue to provide quality food, shelter and education for her children. Her ambition is for her business to become an established corporation in her community, offering various services to meet the needs of a diverse range of clients. Her major motivation is the sustenance of her family, and to provide a  positive example for her children. The values she wishes to instill are those of ambition, hard work, strength and a fighting spirit. It is of special importance, a source of pride to Keyla, to be able to support a dignified home and living conditions. 

Keyla has mentioned the importance of having a good credit history.  Like many micro-entrepreneurs, Keyla has found it difficult to secure a source of financing for working capital. She says that in order to surmount this challenge, it is important to project a positive image (as you can see in the picture). She says that once you are approved for credit, you must be punctual with repayments and responsible with the credit allowed you. She says a good credit history can opens doors and speaks to the general caliber of an individual´s nature.

loans.use: For the purchase of ink cartridges

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en: Marlyn R. is a 36-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating three business ventures: fishing, fish vending and pig fattening. She lives in Pandan, Brgy. Mahawak, Medellin, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fishing, fish-vending and pig-fattening businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 24,000 Philippines pesos (PHP). Marlyn is now borrowing PHP 10,000 so that she can purchase fishing gear and other equipment. This will be her fifth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Marlyn aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable") way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending-team page on Kiva to join our team: http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: Purchase fishing equipment

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es:
Cándida es una mujer esforzada, dedicada al comercio, desde hace varios años, iniciando con dinero prestado. Lo que hoy ha venido a crecer en su negocio una pequeña pulpería en donde vende una variedad de productos, ha comenzado con poco, ya que todo su capital lo tenía invertido en cosméticos.
También nace la idea de alquilar un cuarto para mejorar los ingresos y poder pagar los gastos básicos en tiempo y forma y apoyar  a sus dos hijos.
Ahora con los financiamientos en Afodenic ha logrado aumentar de productos y con este préstamo, comprara granos básicos, golosinas, productos lácteos, pollo, carne con el objetivo de poder seguir creciendo en su pulpería. Lo que está contenta ya que se está  consolidando económicamente.
texts.en:
Cándida is a woman who has been dedicated to commerce for several years.  She started with borrowed money.  Now her business, a small grocery store, has grown.  She sells a variety of products.  She started with a small amount of products because all of her money was invested in cosmetics.  

She also had the idea of renting out a room to improve her income.  With the improved income she will be able to pay for the basic expenses on time and support her two children.

Now, with the loans from Afodenic, she has managed to get more products.  With this loan she will buy basic grains, sweets, dairy products, chicken, and meat.  Her objective is for her grocery store to continue growing.  

She is pleased because her financial situation is getting stronger.

loans.use: Buy various products like basic grains, sweets, dairy products, and chicken to increase her sales

loans.name: God Divine Gift Group

texts.en:
Moses H., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called God Divine Gift.  He is 44 years old and married with three children who are between the ages of 3 and 12 years. He was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to financial constraints. He cares for one sibling.

For three years, he has been operating a pharmacy on Peace Island outside of Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy another consignment of drugs. 

He describes himself as a devoted man whose goal is to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy another consignment of drugs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more gasoline

loans.name: Don’T Let Your Brother Fall Group

texts.en:
Titus T., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Don’t Let Your Brother Fall.  He is 42 years old, single and has two children aged between 2 and 6. He was only able to attend school to 10th grade due to lack of financial support. 

For 3 years, he has been running a motorcycle transport business in Thinkers’ village outside of Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more spare parts and petroleum.

He describes himself as a friendly man whose goals are to improve his business and to continue to educate his children.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts and petroleum

loans.name: Dios Todo Lo Puede 3 Group

texts.es:
Paula es una de los miembro del Grupo Dios todo lo puede 3, dedicados a las ventas de ropa, cosmeticos, zapatos, etc. Su familia está compuesta por ella, 3 hijos y su pareja de varios años, la finalidad de su negocio es poder darle un mejor futuro a sus hijos, esa es su mayor motivacion. 

Paula está muy emocionada de recibir su cuarto préstamo en Esperanza Internacional, después de haber pagado satisfactoriamente sus préstamos anteriores y haber dado un paso para el crecimiento de su negocio.  Ella ha tenido su negocio por alrededor de 3 años, el cual inició con un dinero que tenia ahorrado, manteniendo estable su negocio hasta la fecha. Paula está planificando invertir su nuevo préstamo en la compra de dos paquetes de Ropa usada, estos paquetes (llamado paca) son una buena oportunidad para el negocio informal, tiene una gran demanda en el pais. Ella va a utilizar sus ganancias para ahorrar y compartir los gastos familiares con su pareja, a medida que va tomando mas prestamos, mejorara su negocio y podra tambien de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida. 

Está asociada de Esperanza comenzó con nosotros porque vio la oportunidad de crecimiento que ofrece nuestro programa, tambien en ese momento necesitaba mas capital para aumentar sus ventas. Su historia está siendo usada para representar a los demás miembros de su grupo y a los clientes de Esperanza, tanto los haitianos (quienes en su mayoría ha emigrado hacia la Republica Dominicana desde Haití, algunos de ellos recientemente) y los dominicanos, quienes por lo general viven en comunidades muy pobres, esta zona, como muchas otras zonas de escasos recursos en la Republica Dominicana, carecen de agua potable y energía eléctrica constante. Este grupo se encuentra ubicado en una zona bordeada de campos de caña en San Pedro de Macoris, una ciudad famosa por sus jugadores de pelota y por la industria azucarera, su economía actual depende de la Zona franca, la industria del cemento y otras actividades menores como el turismo.
texts.en:
Paula is a member of the Dios Todo Lo Puede 3 Communal Bank.  They sell clothes, cosmetics, and shoes, etc.  Her family is comprised of herself, three children, and her long-time significant other.  The purpose of her business is to be able to give her children a better future.  Her children are her greatest motivation.

Paula is very excited to receive her fourth loan with Esperanza Internacional.  She repaid her previous loans satisfactorily, and they were used for the growth of her business.  She has had her business for about three years.  She started with money that she had saved, and her business has remained stable.

Paula plans to use the new loan to buy two bundles of used clothes.  These bundles (called “pacas") are a good opportunity for her informal business.  There is a great demand in her country.  She will use the earnings to save and to share the family expenses with her life partner.  With future loans she will improve her business.  She will also be able to improve her quality of life.

The group's association with Esperanza started because Paula saw the opportunity for growth that this program offers.  Also, at the time she needed more money to increase her sales.  Her story is being used to represent the other members of the group and Esperanza’s clients.  There are as many Haitian clients (most of whom have emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti, some of them are new clients) as Dominican.  The Dominicans generally live in very poor communities.  This area, like many other areas with scant resources in the Dominican Republic, lacks potable water and continual electricity.

This group is located in an area that is bordered by sugar cane fields in San Pedro de Macoris.  This city is famous for its soccer players and the sugar industry.  Its current economy depends on the duty-free zone, the cement industry, and other smaller activities like tourism.

loans.use: To buy bundles of used clothes

loans.name: Tulia Esther

texts.es:
El negocio que tiene Tulia A. de 54 años de edad  en Santa Elena, un barrio al sur de Barranquilla, es su gran bendición familiar, porque con sus utilidades ha logrado llevar a su hija a niveles superiores de educación y por eso hoy es una enfermera profesional, laboralmente ubicada en la ciudad de Ibagué y también desde allí apoya su gestión Comercial 
Tulia Inició su actividad hace 9 años, comercializando ropa que compra en la ciudad de Medellín y  vende a crédito   a clientes en la ciudad de Barranquilla. En la actualidad tiene 8 años de ser cliente de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización que la ha apoyado en el fortalecimiento de su negocio a través de 8 financiamientos, formándola  empresarialmente y adquiriendo buenas relaciones pues ha conocido muchas personas que la han ayudado y el mejor ejemplo es que su hija pudo realizar sus prácticas profesionales en el departamento de Amazonas por razones de esta cadena de buena conexión. En la actualidad solicita su credikiva porque adicionará calzado, pues abrió un nuevo mercado en Ibagué y tiene pedidos con los cuales rotará mas rápido su cartera, aprovechando la época de primas y bonificaciones a fin de año, especialmente con los  clientes que tiene en diversos sectores  de la ciudad. Su  sueño ampliar su negocio mediante su gestión y los financiamientos que proyecta tener a futuro con la Fundación, organización que ha trascendental para su mejor desempeño productivo, relacionado con nuevos clientes y capital de trabajo adicional para responder sus pedidos.
texts.en:
Tulia A., age 54, lives in Santa Elena, a neighborhood to the south of Baranquilla.  Her business is a great family blessing because with its profits she has managed to give her daughter a higher education.  Her daughter is now a nurse who works in the city of Ibaqué.  That is also where she supports her business efforts.

Nine years ago Tulia started her activity by selling clothes that she bought in the city of Medellín.  She sells the clothes on credit to customers in the city of Barranquilla.  She has been a client of Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for eight years.  This organization has supported her in strengthening her business with eight loans.  It also helped shape her as a businesswoman, and it has helped her acquire good relationships.  She has known many people who have been helped.  The best example is that her daughter was able to do her professional training in the Amazonas department because of the network of good connections.

She is currently requesting a Kiva loan because she will start selling footwear.  A new market in Ibaqué opened.  She has orders, which will make her money turn over more quickly.  She will be taking advantage of the end of the year payments and bonuses, especially with the customers she has in diverse sectors of the city.  

Her dream is to expand her business through her efforts and the future loans she plans to have with the Fundación.  This organization has been of great significance in improving her productive performance, her connection with new customers, and increasing her working capital in order to fill her orders.

loans.use: To buy clothes and footwear that has been ordered

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel, de 64 años, es una madre de familia con mucho vigor, es viuda, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su hija y su yerno. El negocio al que se dedica, es el de una tienda y una de las más concurridas de su barrio, además la amabilidad y el buen trato que ofrece a sus clientes, han hecho que sea la preferida por sus vecinos. Es así que desde muy temprano atiende a sus asiduos compradores, en donde disfruta mucho de la compañía y la comunicación con ellos. Lleva más 17 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer de pie todo el día, porque sufre con problemas de varices en los pies. Por ello, tiene a su hija, quien la apoya en el trabajo, así evita realizar mucho esfuerzo. En adelante, espera ampliar las instalaciones de su tienda, para tener más productos que vender.  Este es su 15avo crédito con MFP, sabe además que este préstamo le será muy beneficioso para el desarrollo de su trabajo. Asimismo es líder en su grupo comunal y le gusta poner en orden las reuniones. Con el crédito que solicita, espera comprarse más mercadería en comestibles, de esa manera incrementará  su stock de productos.
texts.en: Isabel, aged 64, is a very energetic widowed mother, living in a house she owns with her daughter and her son-in-law. She engages in retail: she runs one of the busiest shops of her neighborhood, and she has become her neighbors’ favorite thanks to her kindness and the pleasant manners she uses when tending to them. And so she starts tending to her regular customers very early in the morning, and she very much enjoys their company and their conversation. She has been engaging in this activity for more than 17 years, and to her the most difficult part is to keep standing all day long, as she suffers from varicose veins in her feet. For this reason her daughter helps her in the shop, so that she avoids making too many efforts. In the future she hopes to widen her shop’s space in order to have more products to sell. This is her 15th loan with MFP, and she already knows this loan will be very useful for the development of her activity. She is also the leader of her communal bank, and she likes organizing and leading the meetings. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more edible products, in order to augment her stock.

loans.use: To buy more edible products to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Strong Business Sisters Group

texts.en:
Koko Lamie, who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Strong Business sisters.  He is 39 years old, married and has three children aged between 3 and 18. He was not able to attend school due to financial constraints. 

For 4 years, he has been selling charcoal in Congo Town outside of Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more bags of charcoal.
He describes himself as a determined man whose goals are to improve his business and to build a house.


In the photo that accompanies this profile, Rebecca is inset at lower right because she was absent during disbursal.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more planks

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “CAMINEMOS JUNTAS”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac, en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio  es el Sr. Roberto; El socio tiene 75 años de edad;  él es casado y tiene 8 hijos; el socio se dedica a la artesanía, el es artesano desde hace 28 años ahora el socio tiene su propio stand en el centro artesanal, el mismo ha aprendido a elaborar artesanía y la produce y vende. El socio requiere un capital de trabajo para comprar materiales para la elaboración de la artesanía. El socio solicita el préstamo para  comprar materiales como arcilla, pigmentos, para elaborar la artesanía.

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Introducing Roberto, a member of the Banco Comunal “Caminemos Juntas” (Let’s Walk Together Communal Bank), located in the Huanchac, in the province and department of Cusco.

Roberto is 75 years old, he is married and has 8 children. He has been an artisan for 28 years, engaging in handicrafts. He now has his own stand in a crafts center; as he has learnt to create handicraft by himself, he produces and sells it. He needs working funds to buy materials to create handicrafts. He is requesting a loan to buy materials such as clay and pigments to create handicrafts.

He is thankful to and appreciates this loan-granting mean, and at the same time he commits to comply with repaying his dues at the set deadlines.

loans.use: To buy clay and pigments to produce handicrafts.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “CAMINEMOS JUNTAS”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac, en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio  es el Sr.Guillermo; El socio tiene 47 años de edad;  él es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; el socio alterna sus actividades con la ingeniería civil, el socio estudio ingeniería civil y trabaja en el municipio de Santiago, el socio alterna este trabajo con la compra de materiales de ingeniería para realizar un proyecto.  El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales para realizar un proyecto de inversión privada.

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “CAMINEMOS JUNTAS”. This bank is located in the Huanchac district in the province and department of Cuzco.  

The member is Guillermo. He is 47 years old. He has in a common law marriage and 2 children. He practices civil engineering, which he studied in the town of Santiago   He alternates this work with purchasing engineering materials to undertake a project. The member is asking for the loan to invest in the purchase of materials to undertake a private investment project.   

The member is grateful for and values the loan given ion this way and is committed to making the payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: private investment project

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: Francisco Javier tiene 36 años, su actividad económica es el destace de cerdos. Hace más de 12 años que tiene este negocio. Por lo que es un hombre muy emprendedor por lo que siempre ha buscado la forma de salir adelante. El inicio este negocio como una alternativa de trabajo por la escasez existente de empleos para mejorar sus ingresos y así mantener a su familia, su hijo de 10 años  estudia en una escuela pública pero el hace muchos sacrificios para mantenerlo. Es por eso el motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de cerdos pues tiene cierta demanda de parte de sus clientes. Sueña con establecer un negocio de comida en su vivienda, pero quiere salir adelante con su negocio actual.
texts.en: Francisco Javier is 36 years old. His economic activity is butchering pigs. He has had this business for more than 12 years. That is why this man is very enterprising and has always looked for a way to get ahead. He started this business as a work alternative due to a scarcity of existing jobs. With it, he improves his income and thus supports his family. His 10 year old son goes to a public school but he sacrifices a lot to support him. That is why the reason for the loan is to buy pigs because he has a certain level of demand from his customers. He dreams os starting a restaurant in his home, but he wants to get ahead with his present business.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Yhasmany

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “CAMINEMOS JUNTAS”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac, en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio  es el Sr. Yhasmani; El socio tiene 24 años de edad;  él es soltero  y viene desde hace 2 años trabajando con su mama en un negocio en común ellos venden juegos pirotécnicos. El socio también estudia turismo y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar productos de pirotecnia de la capital del país y con la otra mitad invertirá en su educación. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar productos pirotécnicos y para pagar sus mensualidades de turismo.

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "Caminemos Juntas" [Let's Walk Together] located in the district of Huanchac, in the province and department of Cusco. 

The member is Yhasmani, who is 24 and single. For two years he has worked together with his mom at a business selling pyrotechnic games. The member also is in school majoring in tourism. At this juncture he requires the loan to purchase pyrotechnic products in the country's capital and with the other half he will invest it in his education. The member seeks his loan to buy pyrotechnic products and to pay his monthly school fees in the tourism program. 

The member appreciates and gives thanks for the loan granted by this means and likewise promises to make his payments within the established time period.

loans.use: To purchase pyrotechnic products and pay his monthly school fees

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “CAMINEMOS JUNTAS”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac, en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio  es el Sr. Jorge; El socio tiene 25 años de edad;  él es soltero  y viene trabajando brindando servicio de taxi en su propio vehículo, el socio solicita el préstamo para comprar un equipo de sonido para su auto y con más de la mitad comprar un ropero, el socio trabaja mucho y ya termino de pagar sus letras de su auto y ahora comprar sus cosas para la casa el socio es un chico joven y muy responsable, el tiene el sueño de estudiar una carrera profesional en la universidad y de graduarse y trabajar o poner su propia empresa a futuro. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar un equipo de sonido para su auto y para comprar un ropero para él.

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “Caminemos juntas” (We Walk Together).  It is located in the Huanchac district, Cusco province, in the Cusco department.

The member is Mr. Jorge.  He is 25, single and he drives his own taxi.  He is requesting the loan to buy sound equipment for his car and also a dresser with more than half of the money.  The member works very hard and he has already finished making the payments for his car.  Now he wants to buy things for his house.  The member is a very responsible young man and he dreams of studying for a professional career at the university.  He would like to graduate and work or start his own business in the future.  

The member appreciates and values the loan granted him and also he promises to make the payments in the established time period.

loans.use: To buy sound equipment for his car and a dresser for himself.

loans.name: Kelly

texts.es: Kelly, de 35 años, es una madre muy trabajadora, vive en casa de suegra en compañía de su esposo y sus 3 hijos. La actividad a la que Kelly se dedica, es la venta de ropa casual, medias y prendas interiores para ambos sexos de ese modo gana su propio capital. El gran carisma y el buen trato que posee, ha sido muy beneficioso en su negocio, aunque sus ventas lo realice de manera ambulatoria, siempre los clientes la prefieren. Se siente muy feliz y contenta de trabajar con este negocio, donde ya lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad, sin embargo le es dificultoso trabajar con su pequeña hija, por lo enfermiza que es y no tiene quien la ayuda a cuidar de ella. En adelante piensa ampliar su negocio y construir su casa con material noble, para mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos. Este es su 15avo crédito con MFP y  se compromete en pagar a tiempo sus cuotas,  para acceder a otros con mayor tranquilidad sin complicaciones a su grupo comunal, donde la valoran y la tienen presente. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará más ropa casual, para abastecer su negocio y tener variedad que ofrecer.
texts.en:
Kelly, 35, is a very hard working mother.  She lives in her mother-in-law’s house with her husband and three children.  Kelly sells casual clothing, stockings and underwear for both sexes to earn her own capital.  Her great charisma and kind treatment of customers have been very beneficial for the business.  Even though her sales are ambulatory, customers always prefer her.

She feels happy and content to work with this business where she’s been occupied for four years.  However, it is difficult to work with her small daughter because she is sickly and she doesn’t have anyone who can help care for her. In the future she plans to expand her business and build a house out of substantial materials to improve her children’s quality of life.

This is her 15th loan with MFP and she commits to repay in a timely fashion so that she can access future loans more easily and without complications for her communal group where she is held in high esteem.

She will use the requested funds to buy more casual clothes to stock her business and have variety available.

loans.use: To acquire casual clothes to have in stock.

loans.name: Milton Roberto

texts.es:
Milton Banderas C. vive en Soledad con su cónyuge y 3 sus hijos en las edades de 5 a 11 años, allí tiene una miscelánea llamada Variedades Lourdes Camila	 que   inició   en una mesa en la sala de sus casa, buscando que los transeúntes, vieran su mercancía y la compraran. Muy pronto su negocio  creció rápidamente,  porque tiene el buen hábito de invertir sus utilidades y así ha logrado aumentar su capital y mejorar su infraestructura pues  ahora tiene 3 vitrinas bien surtidas, con mercancías que rotan rápidamente, lo cual da cuenta de la prosperidad alcanzada. En la actualidad solicitará su primer credikiva para comprar mercancías como  ropa, perfumes, bolsos, detalles para el hogar y accesorios para damas y niñas, preparándose para el final del año, que viene lleno de mucha alegría, porque sus clientes reciben primas y bonificaciones de las empresas donde trabajan y con ellos logran obsequiar detalles deseándoles feliz navidad y próspero año nuevo a sus familiares y amigos. 
Su sueño es tener un buen local en donde exhibir sus productos y en la actualidad está por cumplirlo, pues su familia recibió el subsidio de vivienda que otorga el estado, así que prontamente separará la actividad comercial de su vida familiar, porque ubicará su miscelánea en la planta baja y a su familia en el segundo piso
texts.en:
Milton Banderas C. lives in Soledad with his wife and their 3 children, ages 5 to 11. He has a general store called “Variedades Lourdes Camila” (Lourdes Camila Variety Store) that he began on a table in a room in his house, hoping that passersby would see his merchandise and buy it.

Before long, his business grew rapidly because he has the good habit of investing his profits and, thus, has succeeded in increasing his capital and improving his infrastructure. Now, he has three well stocked display cases with inventory that turns over quickly, and he reports the business has achieved prosperity.

Currently, he is applying for his first Kiva loan in order to purchase inventory such as clothing, perfumes, handbags, household items, and accessories for ladies and girls in preparation for the end of the year. This comes with a lot of happiness because his customers receive premiums and bonuses from the businesses where they work, and with these they obtain gifts for their families and friends, wishing them a happy Christmas and prosperous New Year.

His dream is to have a good location where he can exhibit his products. At present, he is achieving it because his family receives a housing subsidy granted by the state so that he will shortly be able to separate the business from his family life by locating his general store on the ground floor and his family on the second floor.

loans.use: For the purchase of clothing, perfumes, hand bags, household items, and acceessories for ladies and girls.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “CAMINEMOS JUNTAS”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac, en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio  es el Sr. Alberto; El socio tiene 28 años de edad;  él es soltero  y viene trabajando elaborando mochilas, carteras, billeteras y mucho ma sen cuero, el socio se considera artesano y le encanta utilizar su ingenio para elaborar una y mil curiosidades utiles para las personas. El socio trabaja con este arte desde hace 3 años y el desea a futuro exponer su arte y tener su local en pleno corazón turístico de Cusco. El socio requiere capital de trabajo para comprar materiales como cuero, hilos, cuerdas, mostacillas entre otros. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales.

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Alberto belongs to the "Caminemos Juntas" (Let's Walk Together) Communal Bank.  This bank is situated in the Huanchac district, Cusco province, Cusco department.    Alberto is 28 years old and single.

He works making backpacks, purses, wallets, and many other leather items.  He is an artisan, and he delights in using his talent to make a thousand and one useful items.  He has worked at this art for three years.  In the future he wishes to display his art and to have a place in the heart of the tourist center in Cusco.

Alberto needs working capital to buy leather, thread, rope, and beads, among other things.  He is requesting the loan to buy materials.  He values and is grateful for the loan that has been provided,  and he pledges to make his payments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy materials

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “CAMINEMOS JUNTAS”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac, en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio  es el Sr. Luis Alberto; El socio tiene 25 años de edad;  él es soltero  y viene trabajando brindando servicio de taxi en su propio vehículo, el socio solicita el préstamo para hacerle el mantenimiento correspondiente a su vehículo, el socio también comprara combustible. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar combustible para el vehículo y hacerle el mantenimiento correspondiente.

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto is a member of the "Caminemos Juntas" (Let's Walk Together) Communal Bank.  This bank is situated in the Huanchac district, Cusco province, Cusco department.  

Luis Alberto is 25 years old and single. He works providing taxi service in his own vehicle.  He is requesting the loan to provide maintenance to his vehicle.  He will also buy fuel.  Alberto needs the loan to buy fuel and to provide maintenance to his vehicle.

He values and is grateful for the loan that has been provided,  and he pledges to make his payments in a timely manner.

loans.use: For vehicle maintenance and fuel

loans.name: God Bless Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you members of the “God Bless” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 for each in order to invest in their businesses. 

Salamatu D. is the leader of this group. Born in Kamakwie town, Salamatu is twenty-eight years old, single, with three children – two in primary school and one in secondary school. She sells slippers and has been doing this business for eight years now. Salamatu will use her share of the loan to buy slippers/flip-flops in large quantity to add to her current inventory.

loans.use: Buy slippers/flip-flops in large quantity

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CAMINEMOS JUNTAS”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac, en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Juana;  La socia tiene  44 años de edad;  ella es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos,  La socia se dedica  a la realización de artesanía en su propio domicilio ella realizas en arcilla con sus pequeño horno mostacillas, botones y todas a las piezas para collares, pulseras entre otras, ella también pinta y los esmalta. La socia requiere capital de trabajo.  La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales para la elaboración de bisutería en arcilla.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Introducing Juana, a member of the Banco Comunal “Caminemos Juntas” (Let’s Walk Together Communal Bank), located in the Huanchac, in the province and department of Cusco.

Juana is 44 years old, and she is a single mother of 3 children. She engages in handicrafts: in her house, with her small oven, she produces clay bead necklaces, clay buttons and all the parts for chains, bracelets and other ornaments. She also paints and enamels them. She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of the materials she needs to prepare her clay costume jewelry.

She is thankful to and appreciates this loan-granting mean, and at the same time she commits to comply with repaying her dues at the set deadlines.

loans.use: To buy materials to produce clay costume jewelry.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CAMINEMOS JUNTAS”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac, en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Zenaida;  La socia tiene  42 años de edad;  ella es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos,  La socia se dedica a la artesanía, ella elabora todo tipo de trabajos en arcilla y también compra otros tipos de arte. La socia necesita capital de trabajo para comprar mercadería ya lista como chalinas de baby alpaca, adornos  para el hogar, ceniceros, llaveros todo en motivos inkas. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería para vender.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Introducing Zenadia, a member of the Banco Comunal “Caminemos Juntas” (Let’s Walk Together Communal Bank), located in the Huanchac, in the province and department of Cusco.

Zenadia is 42 years old, she lives with her partner and she has 2 children. She engages in handicraft, producing every kind of clay objects; she also buys other kinds of crafts. She is requesting a loan to buy ready-made products such as baby alpaca scarves, house ornaments, ashtrays and key rings, all with Incan motifs. She is requesting a loan to invest it in the purchases of products to sell.

She is thankful to and appreciates this loan-granting mean, and at the same time she commits to comply with repaying her dues at the set deadlines.

loans.use: To buy products to sell.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CAMINEMOS JUNTAS”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac, en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Francisca;  La socia tiene  45 años de edad;  ella es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos,  La socia se dedica a la distribución de cigarrillos y venta de juegos pirotécnicos, la socia es visitada por muchas personas en las fiestas patronales y fiestas locales con realce de aniversarios honrosos, La socia distribuye junto a sus hijos los juegos pirotécnicos a diferentes ciudades en el país. La socia en esta ocasión necesita capital de trabajo para la compra de algunos juegos y abastecer su mercadería para las fiestas que se vienen en el mes de octubre, noviembre y diciembre.  La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería y juegos para abastecer su negocio. 

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Francisca, 45, is a member of the “CAMINEMOS JUNTAS” (Let’s Walk Together) communal bank located in Huanchac district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

She is a single mother of two children.  She distributes cigarettes and sells fireworks.  She is visited by many people during the Patron Saint festivals and local fiestas associated with important anniversaries.  She and her children distribute fireworks to various cities in the country.

On this occasion she needs funds to invest in merchandise and fireworks to stock her business.

She is grateful for and values the loan granted through this means and at the same time pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy merchandise and fireworks.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CAMINEMOS JUNTAS”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac, en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra.  Georgina;  La socia tiene  40 años de edad;  ella es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos,  La socia se dedica al comercio minorista ella es comerciante de granos secos (vende cereales, quinua, habas, frejoles, maíz, comida para pollos entre otros.) La socia necesita el capital para comprar mercadería y poder implementar su negocio en el mercado de ttio.  La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería para implementar su stand en el mercado.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Georgina, 40, is a member of the “CAMINEMOS JUNTAS” (Let’s Walk Together) communal bank located in Huanchac district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

She has a live-in partner and two children.  She is a retailer.  She sells basic grains (cereals, quinoa, lima beans, broad beans, corn, chicken feed, among others).  She needs capital to buy merchandise to stock her business in Ttio’s market.  She is requesting funds to invest in merchandise to stock her stand in the market.

She is grateful for and values the loan granted by this means and at the same time pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy stock items for her stand in the market.

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es: Emilio tiene la edad de 22 años, es soltero, y vive con sus padres. El quiere comprar dos vacas terneros para engordar y en varios años venderlos en el mercado. Sus padres y el ha dedicado varios años a su finca y quieren aumentar el número de animales de diferentes edades y aumentar su hato. Cuenta con varios animales ya, un área de potrero de buena calidad, y una zona adecuada para esta actividad. Está el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. El espera de tener más ingresos para invertir en la finca y con las ganacias brindarle a su familia una mayor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Emilio, 22, is single and lives with his parents.  He wants to buy two calves to fatten up and take them to market to sell in a few years.  His parents and he have dedicated several years to their farm and they want to increase the number of animals of different ages and increase herd size.

He has several animals already, a pasture area in good condition, and an area that is adequate for this type of activity.

This is his first loan from FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the terms offered.  He hopes to have more income to invest in the farm and use the profits to provide his family with greater economic stability.

loans.use: To buy calves to raise.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CAMINEMOS JUNTAS”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac, en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Celia;  La socia tiene  38 años de edad;  ella es natural de Oropesa y es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos,  La socia se dedica al comercio minorista la socia compra y vende golosinas en la entrada del molino 1, este es un centro comercial muy amplio en el cual la socia a adquirido un local para vender sus golosinas traídas de la frontera con Bolivia, La socia esta deseando viajar y requiere el préstamo para comprar su mercadería.  La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería para vender en su local. 

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Celia, 38, is a member of the “CAMINEMOS JUNTAS” (Let’s Walk Together) communal bank located in Huanchac district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

She is from Oropesa and a single mother of two children.  She is a retailer.  She buys and sells sweets at the entrance to El Molino #1 which is a large shopping center where she acquired a stand in which to sell the sweets she brings from the border with Bolivia.  She wants to travel and needs the loan to buy merchandise.  She is asking for funds to invest in the purchase of merchandise to sell in her stand.

She is grateful for and values the loan granted by this means and at the same time pledges to repay it in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy stock merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Albertina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CAMINEMOS JUNTAS”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac, en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Albertina;  La socia tiene  46 años de edad;  ella es casada y tiene 2 hijos,  La socia se dedica a confeccionar diferentes prendas de lana, ella realiza chompas de lana en su domicilio y a pedido, La socia es muy conocida y tiene su clientela desde hace 4 años atrás y realiza chompas y ropones para niños, ella trabaja en su domicilio y una es que termina la prenda la lleva a donde sus clientes. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar lanas y botones para sus trabajos pendientes. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra lanas y botones. 

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Albertina, 46, is a member of the “CAMINEMOS JUNTAS” (Let’s Walk Together) communal bank located in Huanchac district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

She is married and has two children.  She makes various articles of clothing out of wool.  She makes wool sweaters at home and on order.  She is very well known and has had her customer base for the last four years.  She makes sweaters and children’s robes.  She works at home and once she finishes an item she home delivers them to her customers.

She needs funds to buy wool and buttons for her pending jobs.  She is asking for the loan to invest in the purchase of wool and buttons.

She is grateful for and appreciates the loan granted by this means and at the same time pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy wool and buttons.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy pigs to raise.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CAMINEMOS JUNTAS”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac, en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Soledad;  La socia tiene  18 años de edad;  ella es soltera y tiene su pequeño negocio en Calca, La socia se dedica al comercio minorista ella vende frutas en el mercado modelo de Calca desde hace 1 año y le va muy bien en esta ocasión le gustaría adquirir mayor porcentaje de frutas para tener mejores ganancias, ella es una joven muy emprendedora y pese a que no tuvo el apoyo de sus padres en cuanto a apoyarla a que estudie una profesión ella no renuncia a ese sueño. La socia ahora necesita el capital de trabajo para comprar mercadería de los proveedores de frutas.  

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Soledad, 18, is a member of the “CAMINEMOS JUNTAS” (Let’s Walk Together) communal bank located in Huanchac district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

She is single and has a small business in Calca.  She has been a fruit retailer in Calca’s Modelo Market for the last year.  She does very well and would like to acquire a larger amount of fruit in order to have better profits.

She is a very young entrepreneur and despite not having any support from her parents for her to study a profession she does not give up on that dream.

She is asking for funds to buy merchandise from fruit suppliers.

She is grateful for and appreciates the loan granted and at the same time pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy merchandise from the fruit suppliers.

loans.name: Moinagbety Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Hold Sorbeh” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni city.  They are requesting for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each to enable them to further improve the size and quality of their respective businesses.

Pictured on the left is Ramatu K. who is the leader of this group. Ramatu was born in a village called Kalangba, near Makeni. The sixty-nine-year-old is a widow with five children, all of whom are now grown-ups. 

Ramatu has been doing business for many years. She sells “gara lappers” (locally dyed cloth). She also sells rice, groundnuts/peanuts, and palm oil (the country’s favorite cooking oil). Ramatu will invest her entire loan into her business. She will buy gara lapper making materials – inks, caustic soda, powder, white cotton cloth, etc. She will also buy rice, groundnuts and palm oil to add to her market food business inventory.

loans.use: Buy gara lapper making materials, rice, groundnuts and palm oil to add to her inventory

loans.name: Dolores Yolanda

texts.es: Dolores Yolanda se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos, hace más de 4 años que tiene este negocio. Ella ha puesto mucho empeño por mejorar su negocio, por lo que no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos para su negocio. Ella se levanta temprano para alistar su bolso en donde prepara todos los productos que le mostrara a sus diferentes clientes, por lo que siempre está pendiente de lo que ellos le solicitan. Es por este motivo que solicita este crédito para la compra de materia prima como pintura de uñas, tratamientos, perfumes, cremas entre otras cosas.
texts.en: Dolores Yolanda has been selling cosmetics for over 4 years.  She has been keen to improve her business; this is not the first time that she has received financing for her business.  She gets up early to prepare her bag with all the products to show her different customers, so she is always aware of what they are requesting.  She is requesting this loan to buy raw materials such as nail polish, treatments, perfumes, creams and more.

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Esperanza Y Esfuerzo 3 & 4 Group

texts.es:
Santos (Estela, como todos la conocen) es una de los miembro D. Grupo Esperanza y Esfuerzo 3 y 4, dedicados a las ventas de ropa, cosmeticos, zapatos, ventas de alimentos, etc. Su familia está compuesta por ella, su esposo y sus 4 hijos,  la cual disfruta al maximo, tambien le encanta asistir a la iglesia y cantar. Su principal reto actualmente es poder construir un apartamento, para alquilar y generar mas ingresos.

Santos está muy emocionada de recibir su septimo préstamo en Esperanza Internacional, después de haber pagado satisfactoriamente sus préstamos anteriores y haber dado un paso para el crecimiento de su negocio. Ella ha tenido su negocio por alrededor de 6 años, el cual inició con su primer prestamo. Santos está planificando invertir su nuevo préstamo en la compra de alimentos (arroz, hachuelas, aceite, azucar, etc), para su pequeño colmado, negocio que se basa en la venta de todo tipo de alimentos y otros productos, es una pequeña tienda en la comunidad. Ella va a utilizar sus ganancias para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio.

Está asociada de Esperanza comenzó con nosotros porque necesitaba invertir en su negocio. Su historia está siendo usada para representar a los demás miembros de su grupo y a los clientes de Esperanza, tanto los haitianos (quienes en su mayoría ha emigrado hacia la Republica Dominicana desde Haití, algunos de ellos recientemente) y los dominicanos, quienes por lo general viven en comunidades muy pobres, esta zona, como muchas otras zonas de escasos recursos en la Republica Dominicana, carecen de agua potable y energía eléctrica constante. Este grupo se encuentra ubicado en una zona bordeada de campos de caña en San Pedro de Macoris, una ciudad famosa por sus jugadores de pelota y por la industria azucarera, su economía actual depende de la Zona franca, la industria D. cemento y otras actividades menores como el turismo.

La persona en el circulo, no pertenece al grupo, es el acompañante de uno de los miembros.
texts.en:
Santos (or Estela, as she is known to everyone) is a member of the group Hope and Striving 3 & 4. The members sell clothes, cosmetics, shoes, food, etc. Her family is made up of her, her husband, and their 4 children, who she enjoys hugely. She also loves to go to the church and sing. Her main challenge at the moment is to build an apartment to rent out and generate income for the family.
Santos is very excited to receive her 7th loan from Esperanza Internacional after having successfully repaid her previous loans and having taken the first steps in growing her business. She has had her business for about 6 years, and she started it with her first loan. Santos plans to use the new loan to buy food (rice, beans, oil, sugar, etc) for her small grocery store, a business that depends on selling all sorts of food and other products. It is a little community store. She is going to use the income to continue investing in her business. 
She started this association with us because she needed to invest in her business. Her story is being used to represent the rest of the members of this group who are clients of Esperanzo, who are a mix of Haitians (who for the most part have emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti, some of them recently) and Dominicans, who for the most part live in very poor communities. This area, in common with many other resource poor areas of the Dominican Republic, lacks potable water and a reliable electricity supply. This group can be found in an area at the edge of the sugar cane fields of San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for its baseball players and for the sugar industry. Its present day economy depends on the free trade zone, the cement industry, and other more minor activities like tourism. 
The person circled in the picture is not a member of the group - this is someone who was accompanying one of the group members.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, oil, sugar, flour, etc

loans.name: Teodolinda

texts.es: Luz, de 42 años, es una madre de familia muy noble y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y sus 4 hijos. Después de haber de trabajado arduamente por muchos años en la venta de botellas, fierros, y lavado de ropa pudo comprarse su moto carro. Desde entonces se dedica alquilar su moto y de las ganancias que obtiene lo administra. A diario esta al pendiente de las horas de trabajo que le da a su moto, lleva ya  4 años en esta labor y cada cierta temporada, se preocupa en cambiar los repuestos de su motocarro, para que pueda trabajar sin ningún problema. En adelante, piensa ampliar su actividad, dedicándose a la venta de golosinas y de comida al paso. Es su 15avo crédito con MFP, y sabe que tiene que pagar puntualmente sus cuotas y esta dispuesta hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una es una socia muy servicial y colaboradora. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará madera, para  cercar el patio donde guarda su moto, de ese modo asegurarse de los delincuentes.
texts.en:
Luz, 42, is a noble, hard working mother.  She lives in her own house with her husband and four children.  

After having worked very hard for several years selling bottles, metal and washing clothes she was able to buy her motor vehicle.  Since then she leases it out and administers the profits she obtains.  Every day she is watchful of the hours her motorcycle works.  She has been in this business for four years and every so often she must replace parts on the vehicle so that it can continue working problem free. In the future she plans to expand her activity selling snacks and fast food.

This is her 15th loan with MFP and she knows that she must make her repayments punctually and is willing to do so.  She is a very helpful and collaborative member of her communal bank.

She will use the requested funds to buy lumber to fence in the yard where she stores her motorcycle so that it will be safe from delinquents.

loans.use: To buy lumber to build a fence around her yard to keep her vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy raw materials to make concrete blocks.

loans.name: Ana Elvira

texts.es:
Ana Elvira B. Vive en el Municipio de Puerto Colombia, a tres calles muy cerca al mar, con sus dos hijos en las edades de 32 y 28 años. Ella es una confeccionista  muy querida por sus clientes, que aprendió este oficio  desde muy joven  y que desde hace 20 años desempeña como su actividad productiva única, pues tiene un pequeño taller en su casa, donde fabrica toda clase de ropa para damas y especialmente uniformes escolares para niños y jóvenes estudiantes que le generan ingresos para sus gastos. Su clientela es muy acreditada y Ana Elvira, este año al igual que en los anteriores, espera confeccionarle los vestidos de navidad y año nuevo de su  familia,  para que se vistan elegantes con su ropa   y luzcan sus diseños  en estas lindas fiestas, por eso con su credikiva comprará las telas, adornos e hilos, para este propósito. 
Este es su tercer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con los créditos ha logrado incrementar su capacidad de compra y responder a pedidos de sus nuevos clientes; su meta a mediano plazo, es adquirir una máquina de confección industrial, para mejorar el acabado de las prendas  que fabrica y ampliar su oferta en nuevos y mas exigentes mercados.
texts.en:
Ana Elvira B. lives in Puerto Colombia three blocks from the ocean with her two children who are 32 and 28 years of age.  She is a clothing designer that is very well liked by her customers.  She learned her skill at a very young age and for the last 20 years this has been her only source of income.  

She has a small workshop in her home where she makes all kinds of clothes for women and especially school uniforms for children and young students that generate income to meet her expenses.

Her clientele is well-to-do and Ana Elvira, this year as in years past, will make their Christmas and New Year clothes for their families so that they will dress elegantly and show off her designs during these lovely festivities. She will use her Kiva loan to buy fabric, decorations and thread for this purpose.

This is her 3rd loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  The loans have made it possible for her to increase her purchasing capacity and to be able to meet customer demand from new customers.  Her medium range goal is to acquire an industrial sewing machine in order to improve the finishings she makes and expand her offers into new and even more demanding markets.

loans.use: She will buy fabric, decorations and thread.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es: Maria Cristina se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos, hace más de 9 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que siempre está buscando la forma de salir adelante. Por lo que no es la primera vez que solicita financiamientos, pues ha sido muy gratificante para ella.  Sus dos hijos están a su cargo han sabido aprovechar los sacrificios que su madre realiza para ellos puedan estudiar.  El lugar donde está ubicada llegan muchos clientes y diariamente llega a ofrecer sus productos. Así con el financiamiento podrá comprar leche, crema, cuajada, queso y otros productos.
texts.en:
María Cristina has sold dairy products for over 9 years.  She is always seeking ways to get ahead and has had previous loans that have been quite gratifying for her.

Her two children who are in her care appreciate the sacrifices their mother does for them so that they can go to school.

The spot where she is located attracts lots of customers that come by daily to buy her products.

She will use the financing to buy milk, cream, cottage cheese, cheese and other items.

loans.use: To buy dairy products.

loans.name: Las Amistosas Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LAS AMISTOSAS”; este banco está situado en el distrito D. Urocos,  provincia D. Quispicanchis,  departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Braulia;  La socia es casada ella tiene 3 hijos y ella tiene 46años D. edad; Ella se dedica a la venta D. chicha y comida en su casa, La socia tiene su negocio en casa y ella misma fermenta el maíz y también cocina para sus comensales, La socia lleva los fines D. semana a la tablada lugar donD. se reúnen todos los ganaderos para comprar nuevos ganados, ella aprovecha esta feria para vender sus comiditas caseras. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. insumos para su comida y comprar también maíz para la chicha.

Los  otros socios alternan sus actividades con la atención D. bar retaurant, venta D. panes, venta D. comidas, venta D. mates, venta D. productos secos.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to "The Friendly" Communal Bank, located in the district of UROC, Quispicanchis Province, Department of Cusco.  Her name is Mrs. Braulia.  She is 46 years old and married with three children.  She sells chicha, a fermented beverage maD. of maize, and food from her house.  Her business is situated in her home, and she herself ferments the maize and cooks for her guests.  On the weekends, she travels to the fair where farmers gather to buy new cattle.  It is there that she sells her home-cooked meals.  She is requesting a loan to invest in buying food ingredients and also to purchase maize for chicha.

The other members work in bars and restaurants as well as in sales of breads, meals, mates, and dry goods.

Mrs. Braulia is grateful and appreciates receiving a loan through this process, and she promises to make her payments in a timely manner.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for food and also to buy corn for making chicha, a fermented beverage.

loans.name: Maria Nicolasa

texts.es:
María es madre de dos hijos, es una mujer trabajadora, dedicada al negocio para ayudar con los gastos de la familia. Casada, siendo su esposo conductor.
Desde hace varios años se dedica al comercio de venta de cosméticos, y la costura. Comenzando solo con la costura.
Luego comienza a invertir con dinero a través del financiamiento en Afodenic, siendo una puerta para la inversión en su negocio de cosméticos, de esta forma logra cubrir los gastos ya que cuando no tiene costura, vende sus productos unos por encargo de catalogo y mantiene productos siempre.
Con este nuevo préstamo desea comprar ropa y cosméticos logrando así poder vender más y crecer en inventario. Lo que generara mejores ganancias.
texts.en: María is a hardworking woman and mother of two.  She is married, and her husband is a driver.  She works as a trader to help her family meet its expenses.  For a number of years, she has been selling cosmetics and sewing.  She began just with the sewing.  Then she began to invest in her cosmetics business thanks to loans from microfinance partner Afodenic.  This allowed her to cover her costs when she did not have any sewing work.  She sells her products by catalog order and always has them on hand.  With this new loan, she hopes to buy clothing and cosmetics so that she can increase her inventory and sell more.  This will give her a better income.

loans.use: To buy clothes and cosmetics for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For breeding pigs and improvements to the pig pen.

loans.name: Marizol

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MACHUPICCHU”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Marizol;  La socia tiene  34 años de edad;  ella es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo,  La socia es natural de la provincia de Apurimac, la socia se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa, ella distribuye a diferentes lugares, trae de la ciudad de Lima al por mayor. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería y repartir  a sus clientes. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de ropa para la venta.

 La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Marizol is a member of the “MACHUPICCHU" community bank.  This bank is located in the Huanchac district in Cusco province in the department of Cusco.

Marizol is 34 years old.  She is a single mother and has one son.  She is from Apurimac province.  She buys and sells clothes, which she brings mostly from Lima and which she distributes in different areas.  She will use this loan to buy clothing to sell to her clients.

She is grateful for this way of getting a loan, and she promises to comply with her payment schedule within the time specified.

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Martha  Jesus

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MACHUPICCHU”; este banco está situado en el distrito D. Huanchac en la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Martha;  La socia tiene 63 años D. edad;  ella es viuda y tiene 3 hijos,  La socia se dedica a la compra y venta D. productos farmacéuticos desD. el año 1990 y a la venta D. cosméticos por catálogos para ayudar un poco a incrementar sus ganancias económicas, La socia trabaja principalmente como preventista para las diferentes boticas D. la zona, ella venD. los productos D. distintos laboratorios  La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. mercadería para distribuir los productos farmacéuticos. 

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "Machu Picchu" community bank; it is located in Huanchac district in Cusco province, department of Cusco.

Her name is Martha; she is 63 years old, a widow, and has 3 children. Since 1990, Martha has bought and sold pharmaceutical products. She also augments her income through catalog sales of cosmetics. 

Martha's works mainly as a sales coordinator for different pharmacies in the area and sells products from various pharmaceutical companies. She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise to distribute pharmaceuticals.

Martha appreciates and values the loan granted through Asociación Arariwa and is committed to repaying her loan within the established period of time.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for distribution of pharmaceutical products.

loans.name: Petronila

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MACHUPICCHU”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Petronila;  La socia tiene 75 años de edad;  ella es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos,  La socia se dedica a la atención de sus tiendas de abarrotes, ella tiene su negocio en mesa redonda y solicita el préstamo para implementar su negocio la socia desea comprar azúcar, arroz, leche para implementar su tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería de primera necesidad.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "Machu Picchu" community bank, located in Huanchac district in Cusco province, department of Cusco.

Her name is Petronila. She is 75 years old and the single mother of 3 children. Petronila runs grocery stores and she wants a loan to set up a another store. The loan will be used to buy basic household goods like sugar, rice, and milk to set up the business. 

Petronila appreciates and values this loan made possible by Asociación Arariwa, and is committed to repaying her loan within the established period of time.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise (basic household goods).

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MACHUPICCHU”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Liz;  La socia tiene  56 años de edad;  ella es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos,  La socia se dedica al comercio minorista ella compra y vende ropa, también vende productos de belleza por catalogo. La socia es independiente en cuanto a su trabajo el viaja a traer novedades a la ciudad de Lima y dependiendo l época ofrece las prendas que trae. La socia solicita el préstamo para viajar y traer un poco de ropa interior.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “MACHUPICCHU”. This bank is located in the Huanchac district in the province and department of Cuzco. 

The member is Liz. She is 56 years old and single mother of 3 children. She works as a retailer who buys and sells clothes. She also sells beauty via catalogue. The member works independently. She travels to bring new products from the city of Lima and offers the clothes she sells according to the season. She is asking for the loan to travel and bring a little bit of underwear. 

The member is grateful for and values the loan made to her in this way and she is also committed to making her payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: The member is asking for the loan to travel and bring back a little bit of underwear to sell.

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es: Modesta tiene 59 años, es una madre de familia muy amable, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y su hija mayor, quien cursa estudios superiores. El negocio al que  Modesta se dedica, es la venta de galletas, chocolates, gaseosas y demás golosinas, negocio que le ha generado regulares ganancias, debido a que se encuentra ubicado en la primera planta de su casa y muchos de sus vecinos y amistades acuden a ella para comprar algún producto que posee. En ocasiones su esposo lo ayuda en el trabajo y junto sacan adelante este negocio. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es realizar las compras en el mercado; ya que ahí puede comprar un poco de todo con la finalidad de variar y diversificar su negocio; es así que lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil, es no contar con dinero suficiente para abastecer su negocio. En adelante, planea convertir su negocio en la tienda más surtida de productos comestibles, ya que por su zona no hay bodega. Es su 15avo créditos con MFP y está muy feliz de poder obtenerlo, manifiesta que invertirá todo el aporte en su negocio, ya que quiere mejorar su vida. En su grupo comunal es muy respetada por su responsabilidad demostrada. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará  gaseosas, diversas galletas y papelería en general.
texts.en: Modesta is 59 years old. She is a very friendly wife and mother who lives in her own house with her husband and oldest daughter who is in college. The business that Modesta has is selling cookies, chocolates, soft drinks and other snacks. This business has generated regular income for her since it is on the first floor of her house and many of her neighbors and friends go to her to buy a product she has. At times, her husband helps her at work and together they get the business ahead. What she likes the most about her job is making purchases at the market. There she buys a little of everything in order to vary and diversify her business. She has been doing this business for 3 years and she considers the hardest thing to be no having enough money to supply her business. In the future, she plans on making her business the store withe the widest variety of food products, since there is no grocery store in her area. This is her 15th loan with MFP and she is very happy to be able to get it. She says that she will invest it all in her business, since she wants to improve her life. She is very respected in her community group because of the responsibility he has shown. With the loan that she is asking for, she will buy soft drinks, various cookies and general paper products.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks and cookies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Pigs to raise and fatten up.

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MACHUPICCHU”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yudith;  La socia tiene  41 años de edad;  ella es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo,  La socia es natural de la provincia de Puno, la socia se dedica a la compra y venta de carbón, ella lleva a vender al por mayor a diferentes provincias en el país la socia trae de Puerto Maldonado, La socia también es docente de profesión y ahora alterna su trabajo con este negocio. L a socia esta en busca de un capital para traer una nueva carga de carbón de la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de carbón y traer de Puerto Maldonado.
