Janylkan A., 35, is married. She has three sons and a daughter. The sons are at school and the daughter is not yet.  Janylkan is engaged in cattle raising and her husband works as a firefighter.  With money received from the loan, Janylkan wants to purchase hay for their cattle. 

Kanybek K., 37, is married. He has three sons; two sons are at school and the third son is not yet.  Eight years ago, with the initial investment of 15,000 soms, Kanybek and his wife started to breed livestock. With money received from the loan, Kanybek wants to purchase five farm animals for breeding and hay to feed them during the winter season. 

 --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

loans.use: to purchase coal for heating during the winter season

loans.name: Nelli

texts.en:
Nelli O. is 20 years old; she lives in Ijevan city with her parents. Nelli is a student of Yerevan State University, Ijevan branch, and at the same time she runs her own hairdressing salon. Before this business, Nelli was engaged in food sales, but in 2009 she changed the type of her business and she hasn't regretted this change. Thanks to income from her new business, she helps her parents to support their family and pays for her education.    

Nelli is asking for a 400,000 AMD loan to buy a hairdryer, furniture, hair dye, hair spray, etc. for her business.

loans.use: To buy a hairdryer, furniture, hair dye, hairspray, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase construction supplies

loans.name: Muzaffar

texts.en:
B. Muzaffar is 33 years old and lives in Kumangir region with his wife who helps him with living expenses. For 4 years he has worked his land which produces carrots, potatoes and onions. His greatest dream is to be able to establish more crops to that he can leave equal parts to his family. He started farming when his parents taught him to work in this way.

 Muzaffar is requesting financing to be able to buy supplies to apply to his crops in order to get a good yield and sell more at the market.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase more essential inventory

loans.name: Kholik

texts.en:
H. Kholik is dedicated to agriculture and the sale of cultivated vegetables, which means that he can be around his family, helping to raise their quality of life and educate all his five children. Kholik has been characterized as a person who is hard-working, since he has been working in agriculture since he was very young. This kind of work requires effort, dedication and above all, strength, as it can include heavy work, meaning that people get tired quickly. 

In spite of this, Kholik is determined to raise the standard of living in his family and to improve the quality of the seeds he cultivates. For this reason, he is asking for help in order to be able to receive more credit from IMON International.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Nazir

texts.ru:
Nazir M. 29 let. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey,sin kotoromu 7 let on uchitsya v shkole i doch kotoroy 5 let ona xodit v detskiy sadik . Nazir yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda , seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy.

Nazir uje 5 let kak zanimayestya etim biznesson ovcevodstva. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyeqo otca. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit ovcov.
texts.en:
Nazir M. is 29 years old. He is married and has two children: a 7-year old son who goes to school and a 5-year old daughter who goes to kindergarten. Nazir is an Internally Displaced Person; he is a refugee from the town of Fuzuli, now living with his family in the Fuzuli Region.

Nazir has been raising sheep for five years already. He learned this trade from his father. At present he needs 2000 AZN in order to buy sheep.

loans.use: Purchasing sheep

loans.name: Chunaidullo

texts.en:
M. Chunaidullo is a 50-year-old married man with six children. His family plans include moving forward with crop production so that he can financially support his children’s studies. The biggest problem Chunaidullo faces is that pests have affected his crops, and he does not have enough money to deal with the problem. He has been working in agriculture for five years. He is requesting this loan in order to use it for his crops, thus thwarting losses. Agriculture is his family’s source of income. For this reason, Chunaidullo gives thanks to IMON and Kiva for the support it gives him via this loan, which will be of great benefit for his crops.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Alice Njeri

texts.en:
Alice, aged 40, is married with one child and lives in Uthiru, which is on the outskirts of Nairobi. Her husband John operates a butcher shop. Alice operates several businesses to earn some income for her family. Primarily she sells shoes both for ladies and men. She is also practicing farming, rearing pigs for sale, and in addition to all this she has constructed some rental houses for extra income. Alice has been in business for the last twelve years.

She has applied for a loan with which she plans to buy more shoes for sale and also purchase feed for the pigs. Her customers are mainly residents and hotels within the area. She has never borrowed from another financial institution. In the future, she hopes to run a wholesale shoe supply shop for the schools around the area.

loans.use: to buy more shoes for sale and feed for her pigs

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George has been making seat covers for sale in Naivasha town since 2006.  He is 27 years old, married to Elizabeth Auma, and they have two children.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the cash to buy a new sewing machine and employ someone else to work on it.  This will help him in meeting the ever increasing demand on his time.

In future, George is planning to start supplying upholstery material in bulk while still growing his tailor shop.

loans.use: To buy another sewing machine

loans.name: Alvard

texts.en: Alvard S. has been working in sales since the 1990s. Since 2002 she has been renting a booth at a very busy “Petak” (“Bee”) market. Alvard sells clothing for large-sized adults, and she is the single and unique seller of this kind of goods at the market, so she has developed a permanent clientele. Alvard requires to purchase new stock, and that is why she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: purchasing new clothing stock

loans.name: Mirzohamid

texts.en:
Born in Kumsangir region in 1959, Mirzohamid now lives with his wife and their four children. Mirzohamid is a farmer. Recognized by the people of the neighborhood as a serious man, Mirzohamid would like to expand his crop into a viable source of income. In order to do that, he needs a loan of 1500 USD to buy fertilizer so as to expand his crop. The income from it will then help him to cope with the needs of his large family and give all his children higher education. Mirzohamid is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to achieve his dreams through this loan.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Shadrack Kariuki

texts.en:
Shadrack has operated his food stall in Naivasha town for the last two years. He is 47 years old, married to Sophia Njeri, and they have three children.   

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to buy wheat flour,   cooking fat and cooking oil in bulk with this loan he has applied for from KADET LTD. 

Shadrack hopes to have a chain of food stalls around  the town so that he can meet the demand of his ever increasing clientele. He desires to have a good income flow that will sustain the business so he will be  able to cater for the basic needs of the family

loans.use: To buy wheat flour  and cooking fat and cooking oil in bulk

loans.name: Moris Odhiambo

texts.en:
Moris has been working in auto repair, operating in Naivasha town, since 2000.  He is 31 years old, married to Pamela Apiyo, and they have two children. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his second loan.  He repaid the first loan well and on time.  He plans to use the cash to buy a battery charger which will enable him to diversify his services by offering a battery-charging service.

Moris hopes to open up his own garage in future as he is currently an employee.

loans.use: To buy a battery charger

loans.name: Sadullo

texts.en:
D. Sadullo has been selling cattle for more than 17 years. This has helped him move on in his business. He's the father of five children who all need to be fed and provided with the necessary education. One of his main needs is the need to purchase cattle in order to improve his business. For this reason Sadullo went to IMON International and requested a loan of 1000 USD. Not only will his business benefit from it, so will his family. Your support will really help him.

loans.use: Purchasing cattle in order to expand the business

loans.name: We Dae Pay Quick Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you members of the “We Dae Pay Quick” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni city.  They are requesting a loan of SLL 800,000 for each to enable them to further improve on the size and quality of their respective businesses.

Pictured in the left is Isatu T. who is the leader of this group. Isatu was born in Makeni; she is age sixty-one. She is a widow with seven children most of whom are now grown-ups and living on their own. 

Isatu sells cooking oil, salt, Maggi cubes (used to give sauce a sweet taste), etc. She has been doing business for many years now. With the help of this loan, she will be able to expand her business by buying the above-mentioned items in bulk.

loans.use: Buy cooking oil, salt, Maggi cubes, etc.

loans.name: James Njoroge

texts.en: James is 32 years old, married to Irene Wangeci, and they have two children.  He has been operating a motorcycle transport service in Naivasha town for the last five years. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend, and this will be his first loan.  James plans to use the cash to renew his PSV licence and buy a headlamp for his motorbike.  He is also planning to buy a taxi in the near future.

loans.use: To buy a headlamp and renew his PSV licence.

loans.name: Gaiyur

texts.en:
Gaiyur makes his living driving a taxi around the city of Tursunzade in beautiful Southern Tajikistan. Operating his own taxi has fulfilled this pleasant-mannered young man’s long-term desire to be self-employed. He offers good service to his customers and tries to give them an enjoyable ride. In business for about two years now, Gaiyur is requesting a 12 month loan of $1000 USD to help purchase spare parts to repair his car. We are happy for this opportunity to help Gaiyur improve his business and continue his success.
