loans.use: Purchasing spare parts to repair his car

loans.name: Hannah Njeri

texts.en:
Hannah has operated her retail shop in Naivasha town for the last six years. She is 29 years old and recently got married to Joseph Githege.
Hannah was introduced to Kiva partner, KADET, by her friend and this will be her first loan. She plans to buy dry foodstuffs (including rice, sugar and flour) in bulk for resale. She will add these to her shop's stock in order to serve her customers well. Hannah hopes that her retail shop will grow in future and that she will also be able to start selling her goods wholesale.

loans.use: To buy dry foodstuffs (such as rice, sugar and flour) in bulk for resale

loans.name: Lumeteh

texts.en:
Lumeteh L. was born in 1975 and lives in Ntamulung, a quarter of Bamenda in the North West region of Cameroon. She is married to Che Gideon Neba and they are blessed with four children.
Lillian has faced some challenges in life. She has been struggling with ill health and the problem of poor market conditions. Most difficult has been the problem of raising capital for her business and paying for her children’s education, building a house of her own and taking care of the utilities.
L. plans to invest this loan in her tailoring business. She has been in this business for about two years and success is her watch word. She believes the business will succeed because it is situated at a nearby school and this will obvious lead to a high demand for her end products. Lillian also thinks her approach to her customers is captivating and hence lead to the success of her business. The loan will help her community because they will be able to afford goodlooking dresses at affordable prices.
L. will plow back her profit into her business and use part of it to care for her family. She also will use the proceeds to pay her house rent and save for rainy days. Her children’s school needs will also be taken care of. She appreciates Kiva partner, GHAPE, because of the training she frequently receives and the low cost of obtaining and paying back a loan.

About GHAPE
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff, and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase material for sewing and designing dresses

loans.name: Fuad

texts.ru:
Fuad A. 31 qod. On jenat i imeyet 3 detey , doch kotoroy 7 let uchitsya v shkole , doch 5 let uchitsya v detskom sadike i sin  3 qodikov . Fuad yavlyayetsya IDP personom , on pereselene iz Fuzuli qoroda , seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione.

Fuad uje 4 qoda zanimayetsya etim biznessom. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u dyaydi svoyeqo kotoriy i posovetoval yemu zanatsya etim biznessom skotovodstva. U sebya doma Fuad prodayet moloko , sir, kefir. Seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi.
texts.en:
Fuad A. is 31 years old. He is married and has three children: a 7-year old daughter who goes to school, a 5-year daughter who goes to kindergarten and a son who is just 3. Fuad is an Internally Displaced Person; he is a refugee from the town of Fuzuli now living in the Fuzuli Region.

He has been in this business for four years, having learned it from his father, who had encouraged him to go into raising cattle. Fuad sells milk, cheese, and kefir out of his home. At present he needs 2000 AZN in order to buy a cow.

loans.use: Purchasing a cow

loans.name: Naomi Mumbi

texts.en:
Naomi has operated her shop in Naivasha town for the last three years. She is 25 years old, married to Samuel Kisinga and they have two children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her second loan. She paid her first loan in good time. She plans to use this loan to buy dry food stuff in bulk including sugar, rice, flour and salt, to sell.

Naomi hopes to grow her retail shop into a whole-sale shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy dry food stuff in bulk including sugar, rice, flour and salt, to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 38-year-old single woman living with her parents and three siblings. She has sold accessories, perfumes and children clothing from her home since 1990.  She collaborates with her brothers to help their father with family expenses. She is requesting $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new merchandise and add more variety of perfumes to meet the demands of her customers. In the future, she hopes to open a formal store in which to present her products.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Ndung Irene

texts.en:
Ndung Irene C. was born in1969. She is married to Nana Jean Perrie and they have four children. They live in Nacho Junction, a quarter in Bamenda North West Region of Cameroon.

Irene's challenges include paying her house rent and building a house of her own. She plans to invest this loan in an off-license business and buy food stuff including cocoa yams, palm oil and other ingredients to prepare Ekwang — an African dish. She believes the business will succeed because she has long experience. She believes her approach to her customers will be captivating and hence lead to success. The loan will help the people in her community because they will be able to afford at least three meals per day at affordable prices.

Irene will plough back her profit into her business and use part to care for her family. She also will use the proceeds to pay her house rent and save for rainy days. She likes GHAPE because of the training she receives and the low cost of obtaining and paying back loans.

About GHAPE: The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, groundnut oil, beans, and wood

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 47-year-old married woman living in Lebanon. Since 2008, after finding it hard to satisfy the family's needs, she decided to open her own business to help her husband. She opened a mini market in addition to adding a corner where she sells gifts and gadgets. She is thankful for her decision to start a business. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new merchandise to increase her sales and therefore her income. In the future, she is planning to open a formal gadget store to sell her products.

loans.use: purchase new merchandise

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret A.	was born in 1940. She is married to James and they are blessed with  three children and living in  Ntamulung, a district  in Bamenda, North West Region of Cameroon.

Margaret has faced some challenges in life. She has been struggling with ill  health and the problem of poor  yield due to natural disasters. The most difficult have been the problem of raising capital for her business, paying for her children’s education, and building a house of her own.  She plans to invest this loan in agricultural products, namely in the production  of cash crops and other farm produce such as cassava, corn, and cocoyams. She is most  especially interested in cassava which is used in the production of gari and water-fufu (staple dishes). She also plans to invest part in her general provisions store which will raise daily income for her family. 

Margaret believes the business will succeed because she has been in the business for a long time. She feels that she was born a farmer and now she has become an expert in farming over the past years. She also thinks her approach to her customers will be captivating and hence lead to the success of her business The loan will help her community because they will be able to pay for at least three meals per day at affordable prices.

Margaret will plough back her profit into her business and use part to care for her family. She also will use the proceeds to pay her house rent and save for a rainy day. She prefers GHAPE because of the training she frequently receives and the low cost of obtaining and paying back a loan.

About GHAPE
 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase of cassava seedlings  and fertilizer

loans.name: Arman

texts.en: Arman A. is married and has two children. The family lives in Sarnakunk village, Syunik region, Armenia. It is the third time that Arman is receiving a loan from SEF International. Arman is a farmer, keeping cattle and cultivating the land. While his wife looks after the children and the house, Arman the breadwinner is planning for the winter. He has applied for this loan to buy seeds for autumn sowing and purchase cattle feed.

loans.use: buying seeds and cattle feed

loans.name: We Too Can Do Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “We Too Can Do” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are petty businesswomen who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, in order to seek a loan of SLL 800,000 for each person in the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit and consequently improve their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Rosaline M. Z.. Rosaline was born in Pujehun 27 years ago. She is single and has three children, two of whom are attending primary school. Rosaline has been selling slippers, sprays, trousers, etc. for three years now. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above-mentioned items in large quantity to add to her business.

loans.use: Buy slippers, sprays, trousers, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Pay for construction expenses

loans.name: Richard  Pole

texts.en:
Richard has been farming for commercial purposes in Naivasha town since the year 2003.  He is 42 years old, married to Somia N. and they have three children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend and this will be his second loan.  He paid his first loan well and on time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy fertilizer and seedlings for planting.

Richard would also like to own his own farming equipment in future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings for planting

loans.name: Artur

texts.en: Artur Y. is married with 2 children. He and his family lives in Vorotan village in the Sisian region. Both Artur and his wife teach at the local school, however it is not possible to survive on their teachers salary alone, and for that reason the couple is involved in agriculture to make ends meet. The family needs to prepare for the cold autumn, which is why Artur has applied for this loan to buy seeds for the autumn sow.

loans.use: To buy seeds for the autumn sow.

loans.name: Lum

texts.en:
Lum C. was born in1973, she is married to Neba Jonathan and they are blessed with five children. She lives in Ntamulung, a quarter in the city of Bamenda, which is located in North West, Cameroon.

C. has faced some challenges in life. Poverty has been her major difficulty and she has been unable to raise capital for business projects. She plans to invest this loan in an off-license business where she will buy foodstuffs, including waterfufu, eru, palm oil and other ingredients, in order to prepare different dishes such as ikwang, an African dish prepared with cocoayams. She believes the business will succeed because she is experienced and she believes her approach to customers will be captivating. The loan will help her community because they will be able to afford at least three meals per day. C. will invest her profits into her business and also use them to care for her family and save for rainy days. She prefers GHAPE because of the training she frequently receives and the low cost of obtaining and paying back a loan.

About GHAPE 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community among its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase palm oil, rice, chicken, groundnut oil and other foodstuffs.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a student from Jenin who studies in Arab American University of Jenin. Amal's husband supports her and cover all her education expenses, but for personal reasons her husband couldn't pay next course's tuition fees. Amal came to FATEN and took $1000 for this purpose.

Amal is a good student and full of hopes of finishing school to start work as she is married and would like to contribute to her household responsibilities. 
Amal appears in the picture here in FATEN's office.

loans.use: Pay tuition fees

loans.name: Elizabeth Bih

texts.en:
Elizabeth Bih A. was born in 1947, is married to Raymond A. and has been blessed with eight children. They live in Ntamulung, a part of Bamenda North West Region of Cameroon.

Elizabeth has faced many challenges in life. She has been struggling with ill-health and poverty because of natural disasters. Her most difficult challenges have been raising capital for her business, paying for her children’s education and building a house of her own. She plans to invest this loan in agricultural products so that she can raise cash crops and produce such as cassava, corn and yams. Cassava will be her main crop because people in her area use it to make many foods. She also plans to start a general store as a way to generate income for her family. She believes these efforts will succeed because she has been in these lines of work for a long time and was born into a farming family. She also believes that she is good at customer relations, and this will increase her chances of succeeding. This loan will also help her community because it means that people will be more likely to afford three meals per day at reasonable prices.

Elizabeth will use her profits to expand her business, take care of her family, pay her rent and send her children to school. She likes working with GHAPE because of the training she receives and the low cost of receiving and paying back a loan.

About GHAPE 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount to a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients

loans.use: To buy supplies for a farm

loans.name: Alex Karatina

texts.en:
Alex has made a living raising animals in the town of Naivasha for the last four years.  He is 32 years old, married to Neopapa Ene Karatina and has two children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend and is now applying for his first loan. He plans to buy 15 young goats which he will raise and sell. This is a good business to be in in this part of the world because goat meat is a delicacy among locals and many people who vacation in the area.

He hopes to grow his business so that he will be stable financially in the future, and be better able to provide for the basic needs of his family.

loans.use: To buy 15 young goats which he will raise and sell later at a profit.

loans.name: Nforteh Margaret

texts.en:
Nforteh Margaret N. was born in 1972, is married to Gieba Victorine Neba and is blessed with three children. She and her family live in  Ntamulung, a section in Bamenda North West Region of Cameroon.

Margaret has faced many challenges in life, including the loss of her parents while she was quite young. She has also struggled with poor health and natural disasters. Today, her main challenge is raising capital for her business, paying for her children’s education and meeting the needs of everyday life.  She plans to invest this loan in agricultural products, raising items such as eggs, corn and yams. She will also open a general store which will help her raise more money for her family. She believes she will succeed because she worked in these fields for a long time and was raised in a farming family. She also believes that she is good at customer relations. The loan will also help people in her community afford three meals per day.

Margaret will use her income to grow her business and care for her family. She also will use the proceeds to pay her rent and save for rainy days. She likes working with GHAPE because training is frequent and loans are available for a small fee.

About GHAPE 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To expand a small farm

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine, aged 30, is married to David, who works as a mechanic. They have no children and live in the town of Kariobangi, which is located on the outskirts of a Nairobi. For many years now, Catherine has operated a shop where she makes and sells bead work. Kariobangi is a highly populated area with many poor people nearby. With this loan, she plans to buy more of the raw materials she needs to make the items she sells. She has never borrowed from other financial institutions. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and open other shops in the city center and on the outskirts of Nairobi

loans.use: To buy more materials to make beaded items to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a pig for later sale

loans.name: Frasiah Wanja

texts.en: Frasiah, aged 33, is married with one child and lives in Lower Kabete, which is in the outskirts of Nairobi. Frasiah operates a tailoring business in the city center, which she has done for the last three years. Her husband is a businessman as well.  With this loan, she plans to buy a sewing machine for Ksh 27,000, rolls of cloth for Ksh 15,000 ,and pay salary for her staff for Ksh 8,000. She mainly gets orders from schools within the city center, makes wedding gowns, and does repair work on a daily basis. She has never borrowed from other financial institutions. In the future, she hopes to expand her business, become a distributor of school uniforms, and run a tailoring school to train others.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine, rolls of cloth, and pay salary for her staff

loans.name: Francis Njoroge

texts.en:
Francis has been making furniture for sale in Naivasha town for the last four years.  He is 24 years old, married to Maureen Njoroge, and they have one child.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the cash to buy more lumber for use in furniture making.

Francis hopes to get major tenders from suppliers of furniture in future.

loans.use: To buy more lumber

loans.name: Jane Wairimu

texts.en: Jane, aged 31, is married with one child and lives in Kilimani estate, a Nairobi suburb. Jane operates a  tailoring business in the city center. Her husband is a businessman as well. She has done this kind of business for the last three years. With this loan, she plans to buy a sewing machine for Ksh 27,000, rolls of cloth for Ksh 20,000, and other accessories for Ksh 3,000. She mainly gets orders from schools within the city center, makes wedding gowns, and does repairs on a daily basis. She has never borrowed from other financial institutions. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and open another branch and create employment for other people.

loans.use: buy another sewing machine for Ksh 27,000, buy cloth for Kshs 20,000, and other essentials  for Kshs 3,000

loans.name: Leah Ene

texts.en:
Leah has been rearing animals for sale in Naivasha town for the last year.  She is 42 years old, married to T. Ndungo, and they have three children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her first loan.  She plans to buy two cows and five sheep which she will rear and sell later at a profit.

loans.use: To buy two cows and five  sheep which she will rear and sell later at a profit

loans.name: Regine

texts.en: Regine is 28 years old. She is married with 3 children whose ages range between 3 and 7 years.  They are not yet in school. Her husband is a businessman. Regine has a shop where she sells sugar, salt, candles, maize flour, rice, soap , Vaseline, etc. She has been in this business for 4 years. The loan will be used to buy more goods to sell and with the profits she will pay school fees for her children and put aside savings. Regine is also famous for selling beer in her neighborhood so in return she gets customers to buy shop commodities as well. She is hoping to open up a big shop in the future selling commodities wholesale.

loans.use: To purchase salt, sugar, candles, rice and maize flour

loans.name: Leopold

texts.en: Leopold is 57 years old. He is married with four children whose ages range between 19 and 28 years. He has a salon and works together with his wife. All their children go to school. With the loan he will buy more equipment for hairdressing and hair relaxers. With the profits he will set up a full contained salon. His business is well known for good services and effective customer care services to all clients.

loans.use: To buy more equipment for hairdressing and hair relaxers

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en: Samvel M. is married with three children. The family lives in village Soflu, Syunik region, Armenia. Samvel is his family’s breadwinner. Living in a somewhat isolated region requires special effort. Samvel has a small farm. The cattle and the land cultivation bring a source of income to the family. Samvel has applied for the loan to purchase seeds for autumn sowing.

loans.use: buying seeds for autumn sowing

loans.name: Neba Florence

texts.en:
Neba Florence Manka’a was born in 1969. She married but is separated from her husband due to some difficulties. They are blessed with  five children and live in  Ntamulung, a district in Bamenda, North West Region of Cameroon.

Florence has faced some challenges in life.  She has been struggling with ill  health and the problem of poor  yield due to natural disasters. The most difficult problem has been raising capital for her business and  paying for her children’s education and building a house of her own.  She plans to invest this loan in agricultural products, namely in the production  of cash crops and other farm produce such as, cassava, corn, and cocoyams. 

She is most  especially interested in cassava which is used in the production of gari and water-fufu (staple dishes). She also plans to invest part in her general provisions store which will raise daily income for her family. She believes the business will succeed because she has been in the business for a long time and that she born a farmer and now she has become an expert in farming over the past years. She also thinks her approach to her customers will be captivating and hence lead to the success of her business. The loan will help her community because they will be able to afford at least three meals per day at reasonable prices.

Florence will plough back her profit into her business and use part to care for her family. She also will use the proceeds to pay her house rent and save for a rainy day. She prefers GHAPE because of the training she frequently receives and the low cost of obtaining and ease of paying back a loan.

About GHAPE 

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community in its clients and staff.

loans.use: Purchase of farm tools, fertilizer, and seedlings

loans.name: José Claudio

texts.es: José tiene la edad de 55 años, es casado, y vive solo con su esposa. El quiere comprar insumos para la producción de ayote. Además, desea realizar la siembra y mantanamiento en el momento adecuado. Cuenta con una propiedad adecuado para este cultivo. Tiene varios años que se dedica a su finca y quiere crecer. Está el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. El espera de tener más ingresos para invertir en su finca y con las ganancias brindarle a su familia una mayor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: José is 55 years old and married. He and his wife live alone. He wants to buy farming inputs to grow ayote squash. He wishes to have everything ready so that he can plant at the right time. José has good land for farming. He has spent many years working on his farm and wants to expand it. This is the first loan he will receive from FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the services it provides. José hopes to have greater income to invest in his farm. The profit he earns will provide his family with greater financial security.

loans.use: Planting ayote squash.

loans.name: Epiphanie

texts.en: Epiphanie is 36 years old, and she has three children between the ages of 14 and 3. She is married to a builder. All of her children attend school. She sells potatoes, cassava and yams and this loan will be used to purchase larger quantities than what she has been selling in the past. With the profit she will pay school fees for her children. Her business is well known by her customers and most of them go to her to purchase their daily needs. She would like to own her own truck so that she can supply in large volume. She is proud of her business because it has done tremendous things towards her well-being.

loans.use: buy more potatoes, cassava and yams for resale

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en: Sabina is 31 years old. She is married with three children whose ages range from 4 to 12 years and all of them go to school. She has a restaurant where she sells African food, tea and drinks. Her husband works at a travel agency. It has been one year since she started her business. With the loan she will buy food for sale and utensils to use in the restaurant. With the profit she will use it to rehabilitate the house. Sabina’s business is well known because she provides good customer service to her clients. She wakes up very early in the morning to keep the place clean and welcoming. In the future she hopes to be provide catering services to the whole district.

loans.use: To buy food for sale  and utensils to use in the restaurant

loans.name: Diane

texts.en:
Diane is 30 years old. She is married with three children. The first-born is 8 years old and he is in school while the others have not yet started school. The youngest is one month old. Her husband is a farmer. They have a happy family. 

Diane and her husband are able to provide health insurance for their family and to cover the school fees of their son. Diane sells staples, cooking oil, soap, sugar, and rice in her shop. She has spent one year in this business.  With the loan she will purchase more commodities to sell and with the profit she will invest more capital into the business.

loans.use: purchase staple foods, cooking oil, sugar, and rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The purchase of better chalk manufacturing machines and overall improvement of her business

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: Roberto tiene 55 años, posee una casa propia construida de material noble, en ella habita él y sus 2 jóvenes hijos y juntos tienen muchas ganas de salir adelante. Solo tuvo que poner mucha fuerza para criar a sus hijos, siendo padre y madre a la vez que eran muy pequeños, puesto que su esposa se fue al extranjero para conseguir mejores oportunidades económicas. Actualmente trabaja en como vigilante en un condominio de departamentos y a base de mucho esfuerzo terminó de construir su casa, además que sus hijos terminaron de estudiar la etapa escolar, por lo que se encuentra preparándose para entrar a la universidad. Le gusta mucho su trabajo, aunque sabe que es de gran responsabilidad cuidar las viviendas de varias personas, se esfuerza a diario por hacer lo mejor posible, además cuenta con la ayuda de su hijo mayor, quien lo reemplaza una vez a la semana para que pueda descansar. Roberto tiene muchos planes para el futuro, que es el de instalar un negocio, pero no sabe cual será, solo quiere continuar trabajando para sacar adelante a sus 2 jóvenes hijos. Es el sexto crédito que tiene con MFP y promete cumplir sus pagos puntualmente, pues quiere quedar bien con todas las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar adelante en busca del progreso. Roberto tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en pagar la letra  inicial de un auto que comprará para alquilarlo, de esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Roberto is 55 years old and has his own house, built from high quality materials. He lives in the house with his 2 young children and they all have hopes of improving their lives. It was hard for Roberto to raise his children alone, since their mother left the country to pursue better work opportunities when the children were very young.

Roberto currently works as a security guard at an apartment complex. Through a lot of hard work, he was able to build his house and put his children through school. They are now preparing to apply to college. Roberto likes his job; he knows it is a big responsibility to insure the safety of the residents at the complex and works hard every day to do the best he can. 

His oldest son helps him by working 1 day a week so that Roberto can rest. Roberto has a lot of plans for the future, like setting up his own business. He hasn't yet decided what kind of business he wants to start, so in the meantime he keeps working to support his children. This is his sixth loan from MFP and he is committed to making his payments on time, so that he can make a good impression with all the people who made possible the credit that will allow him to continue developing. Roberto plans to use this loan to pay the first installment on an automobile that he will rent out. In this way, Roberto hopes to improve his income.

loans.use: Payment of the first installment on an automobile that will be hired out.

loans.name: Simon

texts.es:
Simon de 62 años, tiene una tienda de víveres en la parte delantera de su casa, vive en una zona periurbana llamada Paraíso y caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y  ecología en disolución. 

El para poder mantener a su esposa y a sus cuatro hijos decidió invertir sus ahorros en víveres para vender. Desde ese tiempo trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 22h00pm todos los días vende arroz, azúcar, bebidas, caramelos. A podido capitalizar el negocio debido a la ayuda de la institución.   

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, aceite y azúcar para su tienda de víveres, en el futuro quiere tener la tienda mas surtida y así asegurar la vejez de el y su esposa.
texts.en:
Simon is 62 years old and runs a small grocery store in the front part of his house.  He lives in a semi-urban zone called Paraíso, which is characterized by its dirt roads and deteriorating ecosystem.

In order to support his wife and four children, he decided to invest his savings in groceries to sell.  Since that time, he has worked from 7:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. every day, selling rice, sugar, drinks, candies, etc.  He has been able to capitalize on business with the help of Fundación D-MIRO Mision Alianza.

With this loan, he wants to buy rice, oil, and sugar for his grocery store.  In the future, he wants to have the best-stocked store, and in this way, to be able to support himself and his wife in their old age.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and drinks

loans.name: Roy

texts.es: Roy, de 27 años, vive en su casa propia a lado de su familia conformada por su esposa Natividad de 24 años y su pequeña hija Yanira de 6 años;  juntos y con muchas ganas de salir adelante habitan en un populoso distrito ubicado al norte de la ciudad. Desde  hace 12 años, este trabajador hombre se dedica a la reparación y refacción de todo tipo de  refrigeradoras, al principio ayudaba a su tío en su taller, pero luego fue aprendió las técnicas y ahora es socio con su tío, juntos trabajan y se reparten las ganancias de este negocio que han logrado sacar adelante con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación. Es así que trabaja desde muy temprano en el taller asimismo ofrece el servicio a domicilio. Le gusta mucho su trabajo, además las ganancias que percibe le permiten ofrecer a su familia una buena calidad de vida. Como es un hombre emprendedor, para el futuro tiene planeado instalar su propio taller e implementarlo con modernas herramientas, pero sabe que solo lo logrará siendo muy constante en su trabajo. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Roy tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de algunas herramientas que le hacen falta en su taller de refrigeración, pues quiere ofrecer un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Roy is 27 years old and lives in his own house, alongside his 24 year-old wife, Natividad, and his young daughter, Yanira, who is 6 years old.  They live together in a populous district located north of the city and share a great desire to get ahead.  This hard-working man has been repairing all types of refrigerators for 12 years.  At first, he helped his uncle in his workshop, but he learned the techniques and now he is a partner with his uncle.  They work together and split the profits from their business, which they have moved forward through much effort and dedication.  He starts working in the workshop very early in the morning, and they also offer service at their clients' homes.  He truly enjoys his work, and the earnings make it possible for him to offer his family a good quality of life.  Since he is an enterprising man, he plans to set up his own workshop in the future and to furnish it with modern tools.  He knows he will only be able to achieve this if he is very consistent in his work.

This is the first loan that he has requested from Microfinanzas Prisma and he promises to make his repayments punctually, as he does not want to come off badly to the people who are making it possible for him to have the money to keep working in search of further progress.  Roy plans to invest the loan in the purchase of certain tools that his workshop is missing, because he wants to offer better service.

loans.use: to buy certain tools to improve the efficiency of his work

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es:
Ana es una pequeña comerciante, mujer trabajadora que ha logrado poner su propio negocio. Un comedor en donde hace una variedad de comida. Casada con tres hijos.
Iniciando con poco dinero y propio solo con la venta de refrescos, en frente de su casa. Toma la iniciativa ya que enfrente de su casa hay una empresa. Pero no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para vende comida y arreglar el local. Y busca la alternativa por medio del financiamiento en Afodenic, en donde logro invertir en el comedor.
Hoy con este  préstamo comprara: granos básicos, carnes pollo, frutas, verduras para aumentar en la elaboración de más platillos variados. Contenta porque ah alcanzado que su negocio este solido lo que ayuda más a su familia.
texts.en:
Ana is a small business owner. She is a hard-working woman who has managed to open her own business, a small restaurant where a variety of foods are available. She is married and has three children.

She started her business with little money and only sold soft drinks in front of her house. She took the initiative since there was a business opposite her house. However, she did not have enough money to sell food and straighten-up the area. She found an alternative by getting a loan with Afodenic and she is able to invest money in her business.

With this loan, she will buy staple grains, meats, chicken, fruits and vegetables to use in the preparation of a greater variety of meals. She is pleased because she is able to make her business more sound so that she can help her family more.

loans.use: to invest in staple grains, chicken, meat, fruits, vegetables, soft drinks with the objective of making a greater variety of dishes

loans.name: Merida

texts.en:
Merida is a 27-year-old mother who lives with her husband and son in Alajuela, San Ramón, located in the central valley of Costa Rica. 

Merida has completed a two year program in the art of beauty/cosmetics. She has combined her educational background and her entrepreneurial instincts to open a beauty salon. Merida offers hair services such as styling, cutting, coloring and other hair related services, as well as nail services (manicures, pedicures etc.)  She plans to use this loan to invest in the purchase of various beauty products/tools such as hair dryers, a hair straightener, scissors, creams, shampoos, nail polish, etc. Merida started her business five years ago with a loan she shared with a friend. This loan will be her first with Fundación Mujer. 

Over the past year, Merida has been focused on raising her newborn son. As a result, she has been working half time at her salon. This loan will mark the return to full time work for Merida, as she aims to transform this loan into profits. Full time business hours are from 9:00AM to 6:00PM, Monday to Saturday, and Merida works alone.  The months of October, November and December are the busiest in the beauty industry. Merida can count on anywhere between 60 to 100 regular clients who make monthly visits during this time. Merida´s services are sought not only by members of her immediate community, but by clients in neighbourung communities who travel to visit her salon (San Jose, San Carlos, Guanacaste). These clients have helped to keep her business flourishing as there are a number of beauty salons in the area, creating high levels of competition for clients.

 In an effort to differentiate her salon from those of her competitors, Merida would like to invest in an automatic nail painter. This machine paints nails quickly and with intricate designs. The machine is quite expensive, so Merida will not be putting the current loan towards such a machine, possibly the next loan.

In general, Merida wakes up early, prepares breakfast for her husband and son, and carries out domestic tasks. From 9:00AMto 6:00PM she will be working in the salon, with an hour lunch break.

loans.use: For the purchase of a hair straightener, scissors, nail polish, and a hair dryer

loans.name: Julio Alberto

texts.es: El señor Julio Alberto A.,  tiene la edad de 76 años, vive en el Barrio La Francia, es casado y su esposa es ama de casa, tienen 3 hijos mayores de edad que sobreviven de manera independiente, ellos son agricultores y cuentan con una experiencia de más de 27 años, esta ha sido  a lo largo de estos años el sustento diario de la familia, es para sus cosechas que solicita un préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas, e insumos vegetativos, que permitan una mejor  producción, un incremento en los volúmenes de ventas que le solventen  proyectos familiares de garantía para su retiro y el de su esposa, la tranquilidad de sus hijos que habitan bajo buenas condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
This man is Julio Alberto A..  He is 76 years old, and he lives in the La Francia neighborhood.  He is married, and his wife is a housewife.  They have three grown children who live independently.

They are farmers, and they have over 27 years of experience.  Throughout these many years this has been his family's daily support.

He is requesting a loan for his crops.  He will buy fertilizers, fungicides, and vegetative supplies, which will allow for a better production.  This will increase sales volumes.  It will also pay for family projects such as securing retirement for him and for his wife.  And, it will give his children peace of mind and good living conditions.

loans.use: Plant maintenance

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 46 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su esposo Salvador (52), y de  sus 2 jóvenes  hijos, juntos se esfuerzan a diario para salir adelante. Desde hace varios años esta trabajadora mujer se dedica en la venta de tortas y kekes, ella empezó desde su casa, vendiendo chupetes, yogurt, golosinas  y todo lo que la imaginación se lo permitía, ya que siempre ha mostrado estar dispuesta en ayudar a su esposo en los constantes gastos del hogar. Al cabo de dos años tuvo la iniciativa de estudiar repostería y desde entonces emprendió su propio negocio, es así que se encuentra preparando tortas, bocaditos y helados, disfruta mucho la actividad que realiza, ofreciendo los más deliciosos postres a sus habituales compradores, que en su mayoría son comerciantes de las  tiendas de su zona. Ni bien termina de preparar ya tiene toda su producción vendida, y para aumentar su producción, se asoció con una amiga para vender en mayor cantidad, pues sola no se abastecía. Así transcurren los días de esta laboriosa mujer que siempre busca mejorar su negocio, es por eso que para el futuro tiene planeado comprar un horno nuevo, para vender ella misma sus tortas, kekes y bocadillos a los grandes centros comerciales de su ciudad. Es el 13 avo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente como siempre, además esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. María tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de cantidad de ingredientes al por mayor, pues necesita para preparar sus postres porque  que tiene varios pedidos por cumplir,  de esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
María is 46-years-old. She lives in the house she owns with her husband Salvador (52-years-old). They have two young children and everyday the family works together to get ahead. For several years this hardworking woman has sold cakes and kekes (pastries). She began working out of her house, selling pacifiers, yogurt, candy, and everything else you can imagine because she's always been willing to help her husband earn money for the family expenses. After two years she took the initiative to study baking and since then she's opened her own business. That's how she found herself making cakes, pastries, and ice creams. She enjoys her occupation and she offers the most delicious desserts to her loyal customers, who are primarily shopkeepers from the neighborhood stores. As soon as she makes her products they're sold. To increase her production she teamed up with a friend to sell a greater quantity. She couldn't do it all on her own. 

That's how the days pass for this hardworking woman who's always looking to improve her business. She's planning to to buy a new oven in the future so that she can sell her cakes, kekes, and other products to big commercial centers in the city. This is her 13th loan with MFP and she promises to make her payments punctually, as always. She's very grateful to everyone who's made this money possible. It will allow her to continue working in search of progress. María plans to invest the loan in wholesale ingredients that she needs to make her desserts because she has various orders to complete and in this way she hopes to improve her income.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients to prepare her cakes and bocaditos

loans.name: Policarpio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SR. DE TANTAMARCA”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Chicon en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Policarpio;  El socio tiene 48 años de edad;  él es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; El socio  trabaja vendiendo DVDs en el mercado, este socio compra al por mayor todos los CDs que están en cartelera y los lleva a revender a Urubamba, el socio saca una comisión extra por la venta de los mismos. El solicita el préstamo para comprar CDs al por mayor para la reventa.

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Policarpio is a member of the communal bank “SR. DE TANTAMARCA”; this bank is located in the Chicon district in the province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco. 

Policarpio is 48-years-old; he lives with his common-law wife and they have 4 children. He works selling DVDs in the market. He buys all the latest CDs wholesale and retails them in Urubamba, taking an extra commission for his sales. He's requesting this loan to buy CDs wholesale and then retail them.

He's very grateful for the loan and he promises to make his payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of CDs to retail

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SR. D. TANTAMARCA”; este banco está situado en el distrito D. Chicon en la provincia D. Urubamba y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Cecilia;  La socia tiene 61 años D. edad;  ella es csasada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia  trabaja criando gallinas, cuyes y también la socia elabora chicha D. jora, ella fermenta el maíz y elabora la chicha D. maíz. La socia necesita capital D. trabajo para elaborar su chicha y aumentar sus cuyes. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. cuyes y D. maíz.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Cecilia is a member of  the communal bank “SR. D. TANTAMARCA”; this bank is situated in the Chicon district in the province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco.

Cecilia is 61-years-old. She's married and has 4 children. She raises hens and guinea pigs, and she also makes chicha (a corn liquor popular in Peru). She ferments the maize and makes the chicha. She needs the working capital to make her chicha and increase her guinea pigs. She's requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of guinea pigs and maize. 

She's very grateful for this loan and she promises to make the payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: Purchase of guinea pigs and maize

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SR. DE TANTAMARCA”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Chicon en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Justina;  La socia tiene 33 años de edad;  ella es madre soltera y tiene 4 hijos 15,13,9,4,; La socia  trabaja sembrando y cosechando sus tierras ella es agricultora como actividad principal. La socia necesita el préstamo para comprar semilla para sembrar maíz y papas, ella también comprara abono para la tierra. La socia solicita el préstamo para sembrar maíz y comprar abono.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Justina is a member of the communal bank "SR. OF TANTAMARCA". This bank is located in the district of Chicon, in the province of Urubamba, department of Cusco. Justina is 33 years old, she is a single mother of four children, aged 15,13, 9 and 4. She is a farmer and her work is to plant and harvest her land. Justina requests a loan to buy corn and maize seeds as well as potatoes to plant; she will also buy fertilizer for the soil. 
Justina acknowledges and appreciates the loan through this medium and she also takes the commitment to meet the payment deadlines of her rates.

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SR. DE TANTAMARCA”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Chicon en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luz;  La socia tiene 32 años de edad;  ella es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia  trabaja criando gallinas y chanchos para la venta, la socia los engorda y los vende. Ella trabaja haciendo esto desde hace 4 años y compra animales para el engorde y venta final pasada la madurez. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de tres chanchos y aves de corral.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Luz belongs to the Sr. de Tantamarca village bank; the bank is located in the Chicon district in the Urubamba province of the state of Cusco, Peru.

Luz is 32 years old and lives with her partner with whom she has 3 children.  She works raising chickens and pigs to sell.  She raises them, fattens them up and sells them.  She has worked in this field for 4 years; she buys the animals, fattens them up and sells them once they are ready.  She is seeking this loan to buy 3 pigs and some chickens.

She is grateful for the loan she will receive and at the same time, promises to be punctual in repaying it.

loans.use: Purchase of 3 pigs and some chickens

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SR. DE TANTAMARCA”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Chicon en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Virginia;  La socia tiene 42 años de edad;  ella es casada y tiene 5 hijos; La socia  trabaja criando patos, pollos y chanchos, la socia compra animales menores para dedicarse al comercio minorista mediante la venta de estos animales. La socia tiene sus clientes a los cuales lleva los animales una vez que estén preparados para la venta. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de animales menores y de este modo incrementar sus ventas.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Virginia belongs to the Sr. De Tantamarca village bank; the bank is located in the Chicon district of the province of Urubamba in Cusco, Peru.

Vriginia is 42 years old, and married with 5 children.  She works raising ducks, chickens, and pigs.  She buys the small animals and then sells them retail.  She delivers the animals to her customers once the animals are ready to be sold.  She is seeking this loan to purchase more small animals to increase her sales.

She is grateful for the loan she will receive and at the same time promises to repay it on time.

loans.use: Purchase of small animals to increase her sales

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SR. DE TANTAMARCA”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Chicon en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Natividad;  La socia tiene 37 años de edad;  ella es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia  trabaja atendiendo su tienda de abarrotes, ella necesita implementar su tienda de abarrotes comprando harinas al por mayor, aceite, arroz, azúcar. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería e implementar la tienda abarrotes.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Natividad belongs to the Sr. De Tantamarca village bank; the bank is located in the Chicon district in the province of Urubamba in Cusco, Peru.

Natividad is 37 years old and married with 4 children.  She runs a small grocery store but she needs to build up her inventory of goods; she needs to buy a number of items wholesale, including flour, oil, rice, and sugar.  She is seeking a loan to buy this merchandise to stock her store.

She is grateful for the loan she will receive and at the same time promises to repay it punctually.

loans.use: Purchase inventory to stock her small grocery store

loans.name: Benancia

texts.es: La señora Benancia es  casada tiene 4 hijos su esposo de profesión músico ellos viven en  casa familiar  de su tío de parte  de la señora ubicada en la zona Ballivian el alto. Su negocio principal es la venta de ropa nueva  de señoras de pollera (mantas, enaguas de paño, centros de encaje blusas, polleras, chompas, sombreros, etc.) con el dinero del crédito comprara una cantidad de ropa variada para  surtir su puesto de venta. El negocio lo realiza mas en los pueblos, ferias de provincias como por ejemplo Tiahuanaco, Laja. Tambillo y otros. Su aspiración es ser dueña de casa en la que actualmente vive, por lo cual trabajan en mutuo apoyo y esfuerzo para alcanzar ese objetivo, es un apersona muy decidida y muy trabajadora esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada.
texts.en: Benancia is married with 4 children; her husband is a musician.  They live in her uncle's home in the Ballivian El Alto neighborhood.  She works selling women's clothing (ponchos, wool skirts, fitted blouses, t-shirts, sweaters, hats, etc.).  With this loan, she will buy a variety of new clothing to stock her store.  She does most of her business in villages and in provincial markets such as Tiahuanaco, Laja, Tambillo and others.  Her goal is to have her own home; she works together with her husband to achieve this goal.  She is a very dedicated and hard-working person who is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for showing the confidence in her to give her this loan.

loans.use: Purchase new stock for the end of the year

loans.name: Marcia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SR. DE TANTAMARCA”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Chicon en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Marcia;  La socia tiene 35 años de edad;  ella es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; La socia  trabaja administrando y atendiendo su tienda barrotes ella desea implementar su pequeño negocio con la compra de productos de primera necesidad ella tiene en su casa su negocio. La socia quiere comprar al por mayor, arroz, azúcar, aceites, harina y otros. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería para la tienda abarrotes.

 La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Marcia belongs to the Sr. De Tantamarca village bank; this bank is located in the Chicon district in the province of Urubamba in Cusco, Peru.

Marcia is 35 years old and lives with her partner with whom she has 4 children.  She runs a small general store and she would like to stock it better by buying some basic groceries.  She runs the store out of her own home.  She would like to buy these products wholesale; she needs rice, sugar, oil, flour and other products.  She is seeking this loan to buy the products for her store.

She is grateful for the loan she will receive and at the same time, promises to repay it punctually.

loans.use: Purchase inventory for her small general store

loans.name: Casimiro

texts.es: El señor Casimiro es un cliente que ya trabajo con la institución casi año y medio, el trabajo en banca comunales, las bancas comunales son grupos de personas la mayoría son mujeres que sacan en grupo y la garantía es el mismo grupo, el señor Casimiro es contratista de obras, el trabaja con una empresa de servicio de alcantarillado, su trabajo es duro por que el a pesar que hace los contratos con los albañiles también trabaja como albañil, su esposa en este momento esta viaje en su pueblo de origen en ahí ellos  tienen ganado, el tiene tres hijos pero ellos ya trabajan y son independientes,  el crédito será invertido en la compra de tubos para la construcción de alcantarillados, el señor es una persona de buena actitud y muy consciente.
texts.en:
Casimiro is a borrower that has worked with Emprender for almost a year and a half. He has worked in communal banks, which are groups of individuals (mostly women) that take out a loan in a group and are backed by that same group.

Casimiro is a work contractor and works with a sewerage company. His work is hard because despite contracting the builders, he also works as one. His wife is currently away in hometown where they have cattle. Casimiro has three children but all of them work and are already independent. He has a good attitude and is very sensible.

The loan will be invested in the purchase of pipes for sewer system construction.

loans.use: To purchase pipes for construction.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SR. DE TANTAMARCA”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Chicon en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la  Sra. Teodora;  La socia tiene 66 años de edad;  ella es casado y tiene 8  hijos; La socia  trabaja criando gallinas, ella también tiene su chichería en su propio domicilio, La socia elabora la chicha de jora a base de maíz macerado, ella vende todas las tardes en su casa, también cría gallinas para la venta o para cocinar para los clientes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar maíz amarillo para elaborar la chicha.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the village bank "Sr. de Tantamarca" [Lord of Tantamarca] located in the district of Chicon in the province of Urubamba and department of Cusco. 

The member is Teodora, 66; she is married and has eight children. The member raises chickens and also makes and sells chicha, a traditional mild corn liquor, out of her own home. She makes chicha de jora out of corn mash and sells it every afternoon at her house. She also raises chickens for sale or for preparing food for the customers. The member is seeking the loan to purchase yellow maize for making chicha. 

The member appreciates and gives thanks for the loan granted through this means and likewise promises to make her payments within the established time period.

loans.use: To purchase yellow maize for making a traditional mild corn liquor

loans.name: Yaneth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SR. DE TANTAMARCA”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Chicon en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la  Sra. Yaneth;  La socia tiene  24 años de edad;  ella es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijos; La socia  trabaja criando animales menores como cuyes, gallinas, pollos, La socia compra al por mayor y menor aves de corral y animales menores caseros, ella los cría y engorda, muchas veces se reproducen y luego los vende a las diferentes quintas restaurantes de turismo en la zona. La socia solicita el dinero para implementar su negocio y adquirir mayor número de animales menores. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de aves de corral y animales menores.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the village bank "Sr. de Tantamarca" [Lord of Tantamarca] located in the district of Chicon in the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco. 

The member is Yaneth, 24, who is a single mother with one child. The member raises small animals such as guinea pigs, hens and young chickens. She buys poultry and small domestic animals, both wholesale and retail, which she cares for and fattens. Often the animals reproduce and then she sells them to the various rural tourist restaurants in the area. The member is requesting the money to set up her business and purchase a larger quantity of small animals. She is seeking the loan to invest in the purchase of poultry and small animals. 

The member appreciates and gives thanks for the loan granted by this means and likewise promises to make her payments within the established time period.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of fowl and small animals

loans.name: Carmen Julia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SR. DE TANTAMARCA”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Chicon en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Carmen;  La socia tiene 36 años de edad;  ella es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia  trabaja comprando y vendiendo mercadería de tipo CDs, ella compra al por mayor en Cusco y los trae para la reventa a vender al mercado modelo de Urubamba, La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería para implementar su tienda, La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la mercadería e implementar su negocio de CDs.
 
La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Carmen belongs to the “Sr. de Tantamarca” Communal Bank.  This bank is situated in the Chicon district, Urubama province, Cusco department.

Carmen, age 36, is in a common-law marriage and has three children.  She works buying and selling CD merchandise.  She buys wholesale in Cusco, and she brings the merchandise to the Modelo Market in Urubamba to resell.

She is requesting the loan to buy merchandise to supply her store.  She is asking for the loan to buy merchandise to supply her CD business.

She is grateful for and values the loan that was granted. She pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to supply her CD business

loans.name: Cirilo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SR. DE TANTAMARCA”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Chicon en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Cirilo;  El socio tiene 39 años de edad;  el es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; El socio  trabaja es albañil y trabaja en todo tipo de obras , actualmente están construyendo un condominio ecológico en este bello poblado, el socio en esta oportunidad solicita el préstamo para invertir en la educación de sus menores hijos, el socio pagara unas mensualidades hasta que le regularicen el sueldo. El socio solicita el dinero para invertir en el pago de las mensualidades de sus menores hijos.

 El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower is part of the Señor de Tantamarca communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Chicón, which is in the province of Urubamba and in the department of Cusco.

Cirilo is 39 years old and has a live-in partner and three children. He works as a builder on all types of projects, and is currently building an ecological condominium in this beautiful area. At this time, Cirilo is requesting a loan to invest in his young children’s education. He will use the money to pay their monthly school payments until they normalize his salary.

He appreciates and values the loan provided and he promises to make his loan payments according to the established time frame.

loans.use: To invest in his young children's monthly school payments.

loans.name: Irving

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SR. DE TANTAMARCA”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Chicon en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Irving;  El socio tiene 22 años de edad;  el es conviviente y tiene 1 hijos; El socio  trabaja vendiendo animales menores, el ayuda  a su mama a la venta de aves de corral (patos bebes, pollitos), el los vende en el mercado central, el socio solicita el préstamo para hacer de este  un pequeño capital y aumentar en el negocio de su mama y generar su propio negocio. El socio solicita el préstamo para aumentar aves de corral y venderlos.

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower is part of the Señor de Tantamarca communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Chicón, which is in the province of Urubamba and in the department of Cusco.

Irving is 22 years old and has a live-in partner and one child. He works helping his mother to sell young fowl (baby ducks and chickens) in the central market. He is requesting the loan to have capital and to expand his mother’s business and have his own. Specifically, he will use the loan to purchase fowl and sell them.

He appreciates and values the loan provided and he promises to make his loan payments according to the established time frame.

loans.use: To buy more fowl and sell them.

loans.name: María Ester

texts.es:
María se dedica al comercio desde hace varios años, es madre de cinco hijos, soltera.
Sus ventas son productos de cosmético, zapatos, ropas, productos de cocinas el cual ha logrado aumentar su inventario atreves de los financiamiento que Afodenic ha dado.  Otros ingresos que tiene es que sabe costura y también cose para logra tener mejores ingreso ya que tiene que cubrir todos los gastos ya que no cuenta con el apoyo de su ex esposo.
Desea comprar: tres docenas de sandalias, productos variados Avon, ropa para dama y caballero, y telas para coser.
Logrando poder tener variedad de producto para alcanzar ventas altas y poder cubrir sus necesidades de ella como de sus hijos.
texts.en:
María is single and the mother of five children. She has been working in sales for several years, selling cosmetic products, shoes, clothing, and cooking products. Through the loans that AFODENIC has given to her, she has been able to increase her inventory. She knows how to sew and this is another form of income that she has. She sews to be able to earn more because she needs to pay for all of the expenses now that she no longer has her ex-husband’s support.

María wants to buy a dozen sandals, a variety of Avon products, men’s and women’s clothing, and fabrics for sewing. With this, she will be able to have a variety of products to be able to have high sales and cover her and her children’s needs.

loans.use: To purchase Avon cosmetic products and men's and women's clothing to be able to increase sales.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SR. DE TANTAMARCA”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Chicon en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Andres;  El socio tiene 42 años de edad;  el es casado y tiene 4 hijos; El socio  trabaja vendiendo y comprando animales menores, el socio tiene una pequeña granja en su terreno y el se dedica a la crianza de animales menores para la venta. El socio tiene patos, gallinas, pollos, gallos, chanchos, cuyes. E lo socio desea mejorar su granja e implementar algunas aves también. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar algunas aves de corral y mejorar su granja.

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: Our partner belongs to the "SR. DE TANTAMARCA" communal bank; this bank is in the Chicon district of the Urubamba provincia and the Cuzco administrative district.  His name is Andres; he is 42 years old, married and has 4 children.  He buys and sells small animals.  He has a little farm on his land and raises small animals for sale.  He has ducks, hens, roosters, pigs, and guinea pigs.  He'd like to improve his farm and add some birds as well.  He is requesting this loan to buy some poultry and make improvements to his farm.  He appreciates and values the loan recieved through this channel and, at the same time, commits to making his repayments according to the established timeline.

loans.use: To buy poultry and make farm improvements

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SR. DE TANTAMARCA”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Chicon en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es el Sr. Eufemia;  La socia tiene 43 años de edad;  ella es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia  trabaja en el mercado como comerciante minorista ella compra y vende verduras en el mercado central de Urubamba la socia compra al por mayor de los mayoristas las verduras, ella luego los vende en su stand. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar verduras al por mayor.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our partner belongs to the "SR. DE TANTAMARCA" communal bank.  This bank is in the Chicon district of the Urubamba province and the administrative district of Cuzco.

Her name is Eufemia.  She is 43 years old, is married, and has 3 children.  She works as a small retailer buying and selling produce in the central market of Urubamba.  She buys produce in bulk from the wholesalers and then sells it in her stand.  She is seeking a loan to buy bulk produce.

Eufemia is grateful for and appreciates the loan received through this channel and, at the same time, commits to making her repayments according to the established timeline.

loans.use: To buy produce in bulk

loans.name: Angela Norma

texts.es:
Ángela de 42 años, vive en una zona periurbana llamada Paraíso y caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y  ecología en disolución. Tiene una pequeña papelería. 

Para ayudar con los gastos familiares de su esposo y poder pasar tiempo con sus tres hijos comenzó a vender papelería en su casa a sus vecinos, construyendo la parte delantera de su casa en un local obtuvo ingresos suficientes para surtirla. 

Para continuar trabajando en su negocio ella necesita comprar con el préstamo una vitrinas, papelería y bisutería. En el futuro quiere readecuar mejor su casa y incrementar su negocio.
texts.en:
42 year old Angela lives in a suburb called Paraiso, known for its unpaved streets and environmental degradation.  She has a small stationery store.  To help with her family's expenses and be able to spend more time with her three children, she started to sell stationery in her home to neighbours.

Building the rear of her house into a shop earned her enough money to get ahead.  To keep working in her business, she needs this loan to buy display cabinets, stationery and costume jewellery.

In the future she would like to renovate her home and grow her business.

loans.use: Purchasing of stationery and merchandise

loans.name: Cirilo Alejandro

texts.es: El señor Cirilo Alejandro C. C., tiene la edad de 35 años es soltero habitante de la Comunidad de San Caralampio, desde hace mas de 7 años que se dedica a la actividad de la agricultura, de los cuales se ha enfrentado a problemas en sus terrenos tales como plagas, sequias, es para solucionar este problema que solicita un préstamo para brindar un mejor mantenimiento a sus siembras en la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas, abonos orgánicos, que permitan una mayor producción de cosechas, incremente los volúmenes de ventas, favorezca su economía  en la inversión para la construcción y remodelación  de la infraestructura de su vivienda. El es un hombre humilde pero muy trabajador que ha logrado su bienestar por sus esfuerzos propios, y que su responsabilidad con las cuotas de su ultimo prestamo demuestran su honradez, responsabilidad, e inmpetu por mejorar cada dia sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Cirilo Alejandro C. C. is 35 years old, single, and lives in the community of San Caralampio.  For 7 years he has made a living from agriculture, and he has had to deal with problems on his land such as pests and droughts.  In order to solve these problems Cirilo is asking for a loan so that he can improve the health of his crops—specifically, by purchasing fungicide and organic fertilizer.  This would allow him to improve his crop yield, increase his sales, and improve his finances so that he can invest in construction and remodeling work on his home.  Cirilo is a man who is modest yet very hardworking and who has managed to improve his welfare through his own efforts.  He was responsible in making the payments on his previous loan, and demonstrates his integrity, responsibility, and energy every day so that he can improve his living conditions.

loans.use: Improving the health of his crops

loans.name: Fernando Jose

texts.es: El señor Fernando Jose C. S., tiene la edad de 40 años, es casado y su esposa labora como domestica en una casa en particular, apoyando a los gastos que se incurren en su hogar, el señor C. trabaja como fontanero para la Empresa Nicaragüense de Agua Potable,  siendo este el ingreso más importante de la familia, ellos tienen 3 hijos que los apoyan en las actividades del hogar, ellos habitan en una humilde casita que se ha deteriorado por el paso de una serie de tormentas que atacaron al país estos últimos meses. Es para su hogar que solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción que le permitan la culminación con las remodelaciones en su vivienda, es para Don Fernando de suma importancia como jefe de familia, la finalización de este proyecto para favorecerlos, con un espacio digno donde morar y desarrollar sus vida para un crecimiento optimo.
texts.en:
Fernando is 40 years old, married, and his wife works as a domestic servant in a private home to help with household expenses.  He works as a plumber for the Nicaraguan Potable Water Enterprise, and his is the most important income for the family.  They have 3 children who help with household activities.  The family lives in a humble little house which has deteriorated with the passage of a series of storms that attacked the country in recent months.

It is for his home that Fernando seeks a loan, to buy construction materials that will allow him to finish remodeling his house.  It is very important for Fernando, as head of the family, to finalize the project on the family's behalf, with a space that is worthy of them and where they can live and develop their lives for optimal growth.

loans.use: TO FINISH CONSTRUCTING HIS HOME
